The staff, no matter where we ran into them, was so friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again and again!!
review.locationRemarks: The North Beach neighborhood is a short walk away and a lively/energetic part of the city!  Loved the out of the way bars and restaurants there!

review.title: An Oasis in The Dirty, Noisy, Crowded Storm
review.reviewText: I havent been to San Francisco in 20 years and was so surprised at how it has changed.  Maybe I caught it at a bad time, but the streets were filthy with trash everywhere and the streets so crowded that we walked down towards Fishermens Wharf and just turned back due to the congestion.  Anyway....this hotel in the financial district was our veritable shelter in the storm.  It was quiet, clean and whoever manages the staff must have been trained by a 5 star hotel.  It reminded me of the Ritz Carlton in Maui. Everywhere you go there is a smile and a "do you need anything"? They brought milk and cookies to the room every night for my girls. When I asked about the wifi fee, they comped it. When I struggled with the coffee maker, a new one was sent up immediately.  You are going to pay exorbitant amounts while staying in hotels in the San Fran/Napa/Sonoma area, at least here I got my $ worth.
review.locationRemarks: In Financial District that I liked because it was quiet.

Valet parking was very expensive, but at least we felt that our car was safe. We had heard that there are a lot of break ins into cars in San Fran. We enjoyed the free fruit and lemonade in the lobby, and if we come back to San Francisco, we hope to stay at the Omni again.

review.title: Wouldn't stay here again...
review.reviewText: I booked 2 rooms through Expedia after seeing the high rating and was thoroughly disappointed upon check in. The lobby was underwhelming to say the least. Then we went to our room that smelled like B.O and mold. I called downstairs and they quickly changed our room which was nice and good service but bottom line is the carpet, furniture, drapes and more are old and need to be redone. The other room didn't smell much better and I got bedbug bites all over my back and right arm. The place is no where I would stay again or recommend. I would recommend choosing a newer or remodeled hotel as this does not meet cleanliness standards.

review.title: City Hotel with good access to sights
review.reviewText:
Location: 
The Omni San Francisco is on California Street, where you can watch the cable cars go up and down the hill. It is located in the financial district and feels very safe. It is a short walk to the Embarcadero/Ferry Building where you can hop a streetcar to Fisherman's Wharf or wherever.
Hotel:
You arrive in the Valet area, and if you need to park there are many garages nearby, or you can valet with in- and out- for ~sixty-dollars a day but, you won't need a car if visiting the sights. The hotel lobby is awesome, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are spacious for a city-center hotel.

The breakfast was excellent (if not cheap) and the bar just fine. The exercise room was very well-equipped and spacious. The room was really comfortable and extremely clean. And of course the location is perfect.

review.title: Overpriced, but nice.
review.reviewText: This is a very well-maintained and nice hotel.  However, it was overpriced.  I understand that San Francisco is en expensive city, but $65/night for parking after you've spent $200/night on a room is too much.  There's also an extra charge for internet/wifi which should've been included in the cost of the room.  Room service is expensive as well with a 22% service charge and $5.00 delivery fee tacked onto every order.  If you have money to throw away, then this is the hotel for you.  Great location and it has a grand feel to it.  But you pay for each and every convenience that you get.

review.title: Great hotel friendly staff, meet beyond my expect.
review.reviewText: When arrive was greeted right away, was welcomed by everyone at the hotel with a friendly and positive attitude. Very clean and peaceful hotel.

review.title: Lovely Hotel in the Heart of Financial District
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel a great deal.  Car drop off and retrieval from the valet was simple and timely. Had a room on the upper floors with lots of sunlight and plenty of space for two people.  Charlie was friendly at the front desk, and the Concierge was helpful in giving ideas for dinner. My only complaint is that there were times when we felt a bit disregarded by some of the staff.  Not that people were not helpful or friendly, it is just we noted that we had to initiate service (such as requesting a glass of champagne or a bottle of water that were given to other guests who did not have to ask).
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great, though on a Saturday afternoon/Sunday, not a lot was open in the area.

review.reviewText: Great location. The room was clean, as were the other facilities in the hotel. Business center is a little small.

Stayed in the Omni during a recent business trip.  Excellent location and great staff.  The workout room was a pleasant surprise in its size and diversity.  A bustling lobby made for a difficult work environment but plenty of wifi-enabled cafes nearby.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Room, staff, overall hotel was great.  

The only room for improvement was that the bar was too crowded.  We couldn't get in once and couldn't get service another time.

The only restaurant is a steak house which did not meet our needs.  The staff did have excellent alternative choices in the area.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Iain for choosing to stay in our hotel.  I am so happy to know that you enjoyed your visit to San Francisco and your stay in our hotel.  We value your feedback and appreciate the kind comments regarding our team.  We hope to have the opportunity to host you again.  Thank you!

review.title: Superb Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We had a 4 night stay here a couple of weeks ago now, having had our trip delayed by a couple of days. We had originally planned to stay in the Hilton Financial District, but they would not move our dates so we cancelled and booked into the Omni.  Probably the best move we made. The Omni is a beautiful old style hotel in a great location in the Financial District at the foot of Chinatown.
We were made incredibly welcome on arrival after a long flight from the UK and were very pleased with the room that we had chosen.  It was clean and comfortable and well appointed with plenty of floor space and storage for a city hotel. 
Over the time of our stay the staff in the hotel were the friendliest and most helpful people I have ever met in 30 years of travelling, nothing was too much for them and everything was accomplished with a smile, overall we had a fabulous stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Super friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms and a great location.

review.title: Omni
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni San Francisco while in San Fran for our honeymoon.  It was the perfect choice!  The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, our room was very clean and comfortable, and the fitness center was in excellent condition every time I went.  It is also within walking distance to many of the sights, including the Ferry building, Pier 33, and Fisherman's Wharf.  It is pretty close to Coit Tower and Lombard Street if you don't mind walking uphill as well!  We would for sure stay here again if we ever went back to San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Peggy for choosing to stay at the Omni San Francisco and for taking the time to share your feedback.  We are so happy to know that you enjoyed your stay.  We value your business and hope to have the opportunity to host you again.  Thank you.

review.title: Very nice business class hotel
review.reviewText:
Staff are unbelievable !  Gracious, friendly, smiling, helpful, accommodating,etc. I could go on and on.  So refreshing to know they are trained well and execute flawlessly.  Hard to find this type of employee from front desk to housekeeping. 
Well done.  

Everything about this hotel was spot on from the beautiful lobby to nice rooms.  Good location near Chinatown.
Would highly recommend.

review.title: A well located hotel in the financial district.
review.reviewText: My two teenage daughters and I stayed here for 3 nights. It really is well located and has everything you would need. In a safe part area not far from Union Square for shopping etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Well located with a old world charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Like most hotels a little expensive but it has an old world charm. I think the gym could be improved, given there is no pool.
review.locationRemarks: You can easily walk to Union Square about 10 mins away. While you have the Cable car out the front. Short walk to Columbus Av for more restaurants.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Jenn for choosing our hotel.  We appreciate your kind comments regarding your experience and look forward to hosting you again in the future.  Thank you.

review.title: Excellent hotel with exceptional service
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Omni was amazing from start to finish. The staff is pleasant, helpful, and they go above and beyond to ensure that your stay is perfect! The complementary champagne hour and flavored water in the lobby were unexpected. We already booked a future stay at the Omni.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Sarah for choosing our hotel and for providing your constructive feedback regarding your stay.  We value your comments and hope to have the opportunity to host you again.  Thank you.

review.title: Great service and location
review.reviewText: I picked this destination based off star rating and proximity to where I needed to be. I was taken back by the fantastic service provided by the staff. The minute I arrived I was welcomed, offered water, and was able to check in (early) within minutes. Room service prices were outrageous, and from others I heard the food wasn't very great, so that was a bummer. Thankfully you are far from limited with other options given this downtown location. Very walkable to public transport.

review.title: Good location and excellent service
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel to stay in with a good price compared to other hotels. The hotel provides free umbrellas when we needed them the most. I'd probably be back.

review.title: Greatness!!!
review.reviewText: We celebrated our 41st and 43rd birthdays and we had a A list star like stay!!!!

managementResponses.response: Thank you Sharon for choosing to stay at the Omni.  I am so happy that you were able to stay with us and to enjoy opening day.  What a game it was!  Our hotel does offer different pillows depending on your preference.  Please let us know the next time you will stay with us and we will take care of you.  Thank you.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the baseball Stadium
review.reviewText: I was there for the open day baseball game. We got to the hotel at 1pm we able to check in before we went to  the game. They got  a cab for. Everyone a the hotel was helpful and nice. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable the only thing I didn't like was the pillow they was to soft but other bed bath the bed was very comfortable.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for considering the Omni your home away from home in the city.  We value your business and look forward to your next stay-cation.   Please let our team know how we may assist you in any way as we are happy to help.  Thank you.

review.title: Tried and True
review.reviewText: I use the Omni for overnighters when I am too pooped to commcome home.  My wife meets me there.  Room service dinner and breakfast.  A great night of sleep in between.  We always enjoy the stay!

review.title: Great except for traffic
review.reviewText: Traffic is awful to get here but once you manage to get in, the staff is friendly, rooms are clean and spacious.

review.title: Nice Hotel

managementResponses.response: Thank you for choosing the Omni San Francisco.  We appreciate your business and are happy to know you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to host you again in the future.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Super classy. Very clean and staff was super accommodating.

review.title: Great location, fantastic staff, excellent room
review.reviewText: My stay could not have been better. When I arrived there was a bellman who offered me a cold wash cloth to freshen up. There was no line at the front desk because they had three people there so check in was a breeze. The room was super clean, bathroom great, shower pressure strong, and as a business traveler I really appreciated the free wifi in the room (it was an upraded room) and all the electrical outlets that were conveniently placed at the side of the desk. The bed was extremely comfortable and I liked that they gave you 4 pillows, 2 firm and 2 soft, so you could choose the ones you prefer. The room was quiet so I got a good night's sleep. I forgot my phone charger but I called the front desk and they loaned me one for the night (with a $20 deposit - no big deal because I'm sure they lose a lot of them otherwise). My only slight cautionary word is they have no gift shop or place to buy sundries so if you need something you'll have to go out of the hotel. Not a great inconvenience because there a lot of stores near the hotel but if you need something quick it would be nice to have a gift and sundry shop. The location is very central and all in all, I loved the place. I would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: It owuld be nice of they had a gift and sundry shop.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in heart of business district.

review.title: Great Location and Property
review.reviewText: Wonderful location for a quick weekend getaway, great amenities and within walking distance to everything
review.locationRemarks: in the heart of the financial district so weekend everything is closed however, one block away is Chinatown.

managementResponses.response: Thank you Thomas for choosing our hotel.  We value your business and appreciate your kind comments regarding your experience.  I am so happy to know that you had a memorable stay.  We hope to have the opportunity to host you again.  Thank you.

review.negativeRemarks: Parking is pricey, but is a norm in downtown San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: In the centre of all tourist sites, can walk to Chinatown, Union Square within 10 mins, and to the Pier in 20 mins.  Lots of restaurants around.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for visiting San Francisco and choosing to stay at the Omni despite the wet weather.  We hope to host you again in the future Ruth!  Thank you for the feedback.

review.title: Hotel is centrally located
review.reviewText:
The reviews on the Omni where very positive. Our initial experience from the valet and doorman was excellent but unfortunately the front desk was not. We seemed rushed and our request for a king size bed was never acknowledged. I asked for some help with in house dinning and where I could take my pet to restaurants that are pet friendly; sadly it was poorly handled. 
The hotel it's self is beautiful and the rooms clean. If the Omni wants a better rating it must improve staff knowledge and service.
We will try again as the hotel is well located and walking distance to many of our favorite activities; coffee shops, dinning and exploring.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay.  We will review our pricing structure with the team and compare to other area hotels.  We value your business and do hope to have the opportunity to host you again.

review.title: Great spot in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: The location is great, you can walk everywhere or take an uber. It was clean, comfortable and the staff was pleasant. My only complaint is that they wanted $63 for parking which is outrages and charged $15 for wifi. The room service was also really expensive $30 for a club sandwich. I realize it is SF and everything is super expensive, but they don't need to gouge their customers on top of paying top dollar to stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, clean, comfortable, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: price gouging on everything beyond the room

All in all a great hotel, near the tourist attractions and local transportation. The room we got was spacious, one king bed and a complimentary roll away bed ( we were a family of three) We slept like babies and almost wanted to stay in than wander the city. Oops.

We will definitely stay at Omni Hotels for our future vacations. WELL DONE OMNI!!!

review.title: Fab hotel and central location
review.reviewText: Beautiful and very stylish hotel. Clean and sound-proofed rooms. Staff are very helpful, well informed and efficient. review.title: Want to get dinged for little things, stay here
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, conveniently located to things to do around the financial district. However, there isn't an in-house parking structure. Instead you have to use a nearby parking facility, which could be why they have valet parking for $55 per day. The restaurant is extremely expensive, I.E. Three slices of French toast and a glass of Coke, cost $27. WIFI is not free as their website says, unless your are a qualified stay, which is two or more nights and you cannot have book through a whole list of websites, which disqualifies you. Otherwise it's per night charge to get connected. Non alcoholic beverages in the mini fridge are NOT free, so if you don't mind paying $6 for a can of Coke, go right ahead and drink it.
review.positiveRemarks: Located close the training class location
review.negativeRemarks: See my above complaints and make a change!

review.title: Danny
review.reviewText: Small rooms - and parking was astronomical. Outside of the fact that they charge $55/day (which is unheard of and I live in NYC) they charge an additional $7/service per day for the parking + tax. $130 for 2 days of parking is pretty ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Trolly

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: The folks at the front desk and the doormen were great. Enjoyed greatly the free champagne in the lobby on Saturday. Only problem was slight deficits in housekeeping. Had a cigarette burn in my sheet (nonsmoking room), and toward the end of my stay there they were a bit lazy in making up the bed properly--throw pillows left on chair and on floor and robe not hung up.

review.title: Great staff. Tired rooms.
review.reviewText: What makes this hotel is location and staff. Central to everything yet far enough from crowded Fishermans Wharf. Front desk staff and bell staff are also a reason this hotel scores higher in my book. Charles at front desk was a real standout. As for the downside, rooms on the small side and in desperate need of renovation. No hotel in the 21st century should lack an ergonomic office chair and modern desk. Also, mattress on the soft side. And noise isolation could be much better. Avoid lower floors facing California St unless you enjoy the sound of the cable car chain grinding all day and night.

review.title: If only...

review.title: Very nice hotel in financial district.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the financial district which was very quiet on the weekend, but it was an easy walk to busier areas. It is on the tram line. It is about a 10 minute walk to the BART station, the Ferry Building and the Union Square shopping area. We found the staff all very friendly and very helpful, which we really appreciated as it was our first trip to San Francisco. Bed was comfortable, everything very clean, everything worked, very quiet room, we would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: The location worked fine for us.

review.title: Girls Weekend
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco Hotel (hotel) is located within the San Francisco Financial District. It is conveniently located in the mix of everything. It is within walking distance of the BART--the underground train.  We were able to ride the BART from the San Francisco airport to the "Montgomery" stop and walk to the hotel. Our suite was very clean, the staff very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  Disappointed to discover no spa, pool, jacuzzi or sauna considering "resort" is in the name but this was not a deal-breaker.  Note:  If you are staying in the Financial District mostly all stores, shops, markets, delis are closed during the weekend (Saturday and Sunday)--these would be great days to travel to Union Square or Fishermans Wharf to hang out. Great hotel, exceptional service, great food, good location!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean suites, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff.  Complimentary coffee, prompt, daily housekeeping services.
review.negativeRemarks: Would be great if it had a pool, spa, jacuzzi, or sauna or any combination of.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART, Cable Car directly in front of hotel, walking distance to China Town, walking distance to Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the financial district
review.reviewText: The Omni Hotel was very nice - conveniently located right in the middle of the financial district, it was easy to get to several bus lines as well as the BART. We were within walking distance of Union Square, Chinatown, and only a short bus ride away from several other tourist attractions. The staff was very accommodating, and the doorman very friendly. Overall, we had a great experience and would absolutely return should it fit in our hotel budget again.

review.title: Very nice hotel; good location, great staff
review.reviewText: Family of 4 stayed here for almost a week.  Although in the financial district, the location worked well for our vacation.  We walked to the fisherman's wharf area (25-30 mins) and to AT&T park (25 mins).  A couple of minutes from Chinatown.  If you don't mind walking, this is an excellent location.  Be aware that many restaurants close to the hotel close on weekends since it is primarily a business location, but you don't have to walk too far.  The staff was consistently professional and helpful throughout our stay.  The cleaning staff was always friendly and did a fine job cleaning our room.  We had two twin beds which was tight with the four of us, but worked out ok.  Fitness center is quite good...dead weights, weight machines and several treadmills, ellipticals, etc.  Free coffee downstairs each morning.  Concierge staff were very helpful.  Its about a $55 taxi ride from the airport.  BART is about $9 per person (plus a few block walk from the station), so if there is a family, I recommend a taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Plus you can tell this is a "nice" hotel....high quality surroundings, professional staff, always clean, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: We would stay here again.  But if you don't want to walk much and want to spend most of your time at Pier 39, then get a hotel down there.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district, so a business focus.  But works well for tourists also, as you are not that far away, and walking in SFO weather is nice

review.title: Great hotel in financial district.
review.reviewText: Most comfortable beds.  Walking distance to Chinatown, Ferry Building, cable cars. Uber friendly.

review.title: Great Hotel in the financial district.
review.reviewText: The door man welcomes you when you arrive. Check in is quick. Two very good restaurants but food is expensive but no worse than anywhere else. The room are top notch, very clean and fresh. Highly recommend this hotel but make sure you get a room with a view,
review.positiveRemarks: First class hotel. When the hotel heard that we wanted a room with a view, they immediately got a hold of us to rectify the problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Wishing that every room could have a view.
review.locationRemarks: the Omni Hotel has the California street cable car go right by the hotel. You are steps away from the market area. Union Square a few blocks away.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel in the financial district.  4 blocks from the Muni/BART station.  Right on the cable car line that runs on California Ave.  Walking distance from Union Square, Pier 39 and Chinatown.  

This hotel is a higher grade than I am used to.  Was pleasantly surprised with the turndown service with cookies and milk each night.  The personnel on property were very professional and friendly as you would expect in this level of hotel.  

We were traveling with my 12 year old son and asked for a roll away bed.  They had no problem furnishing it.  The room was a little on the tight side with the roll away, but still roomy enough for the three of us.  

Just one reminder that the hotel is in the financial district.  Many of the coffee places and restaurants near the hotel are closed on the weekend.  There still are several open, but you will have to walk 2 or 3 blocks for your morning Starbucks. The nice thing is that on the weekend, the area is quiet with a lot less traffic than the rest of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Turn down service with cookies and milk
review.locationRemarks: 4 blocks from the Muni/BART station.  Right on the cable car line that runs on California Ave.  Walking distance from Union Square, Pier 39 and China

review.reviewText: Everything about our brief stay was outstanding - the staff was immensely helpful and courteous without being obsequious.  The hotel is beautiful, incredibly clean and well appointed.  Bed and bedding were outstanding, bath facilities and complimentary toiletries exceptional - everything was even better than expected.  We stay in many 4 and 5 star hotels throughout the world and will not hesitate to book another Omni again - this was a wonderful experience.  Further, when we returned from an evening event without having had dinner, I ordered room service, which was superb.  Bravo!!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is situated in the financial district and adjacent to Chinatown - making business and fun and easy to access locale.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, incredible staff
review.reviewText: We stayed at Omni San Fran for a week. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, room was spotless, good location not too far to walk from BART, shopping, Embarcadero, Chinatown. All of those alone would make me stay again, but the staff there has to make it one of the best in the city.... definitely the best staff of any hotel I've ever stayed in. So courteous, friendly and willing to help in any way they could!  Esp. the chief concierge Mark.  I bothered him everyday with numerous questions about transportation, location, tours, etc. and always he was so thorough & helpful!  Whatever management is doing to keep their employees doing such a wonderful job is working & other hotels should learn from them!

review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff.  Room was spacious and quite comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel close to many good restaurants.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel's location was very convenient, close to good restaurants, and public transportations.

review.title: Convenient and Clean!
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean room, convenient location...  The Concierge had some great suggestions for day trips.  We visited Sausalito, Marin Headlands, Sonoma, etc.  Very fun!  Bob's Restaurant was terrific!  Our room was too small for three adults, and we were immediately changed to a room that fit better for our family of three.

review.title: Trip to SF
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Friendly staff. Enjoyed my stay.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown, AT&T Park, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf and Ferry Building Marketplace.

review.title: Oasis of quiet and comfort on holiday weekend
review.reviewText:
Memorial Day weekend in city with many visitors.  Location is great, ambience excellent.
Provided perfect base camp for holiday weekend with grandchildren.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!  Professionalism of staff, amenities, service, location, quality of accommodations.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Union Square , Chinatown, Nob Hill, Fishermans Wharf

review.reviewText: very friendly staff--front desk and housekeeping (i am writing a review not a book report)

review.title: Staff were genuinely attentive and helpful.
review.reviewText: Nice attention to detail: cookies and milk for our granddaughter; champaign for the rest of us. Very clean, nicely appointed, very quiet rooms. Well trained staff.

review.title: It's OK
review.reviewText:
I don't have a lot of bad things to say about this hotel. Then again, I don't have a lot of good things to say either. It's just an average hotel that is I overpriced. The staff is nice, the rooms are Ok and you will get overcharged for your stay.
Our room was NOT clean. I found an empty bag for California oranges in out bathroom intertwined with out shower curtain. So obviously, none of that was wiped down. The glasses in the room had lipstick marks on them and there were blonde hair all over. Luckily, we had to only stay one night.

review.title: Exceptional staff.
review.reviewText: This hotel has, hands down, the most amazing staff of any hotel I have visited.  Also, the champagne receptions on the weekend were a real treat.  Highly recommend!
Great location and veery comfortable hotel.  Probably wouldn't work that well for families but definitely for couples or business travellers. Front staff very helpful and friendly!!
review.positiveRemarks: Close to so many things  Right on the cable car line and in walking distance to the Ferry Building.

review.reviewText: In room coffee would have been nice without having to be an rewards member

review.title: Relaxing weekend in S.F.
review.reviewText: Perfect location.  Easy to get around.  Quiet and relaxing with friendly staff.

review.title: Great hotel with easy access to everything.
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Omni in May 2015 was great. The hotel staff was friendly and efficient, the rooms were really comfortable, and the location of the hotel provided easy access to everything! Just loved it and plan to return soon!

review.title: San-Fransico first trip
review.reviewText: We realy appreciate the hotel (room and restaurant). Great experience
review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel. The staff is helpfull and polite. The place is clean and confortable. Realy classy
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing realy needs improvement. Everything was perfect
review.locationRemarks: The location is ok and near public transportation. Good restaurant also and not to close of tourist attractions

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate you choosing our hotel and hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Thank you!

review.title: Amazing staff and beautiful facility!!
review.reviewText: I'm  a frequent traveler both in the USA, Canada and Europe, but never have I experienced the superior service granted by the Omni San Francisco staff. The room was spotless, bed and pillows were very comfortable. The location close to everything. Would highly recommend this hotel. Loved it!!!
review.locationRemarks: The location in perfect. Great restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel in the financial district.
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Omni San Francisco Hotel exceeded our expectatios.  Our suite was spacious and comfortable and everyone on the Omni hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay at the Omni San Francisco Hotel the next time we are in town.

review.title: Great hotel and location .
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Omni San Francisco-great downtown location.Just a few blocks to great shopping,restaurants -cable cars at the front entrance.

review.title: Within walking distance to all tourist attractions
review.reviewText: We celebrated our 6th anniversary at the OMNI and its all about the little things. From the upgraded room to the bottle of champagne, we have nothing but great things to say about this hotel can't wait to go back!

review.title: Earns five stars from me!
review.reviewText: Staff was incredible, milk & cookies waiting for me and a personal welcome note from housekeeping in my room. The room was spotless and the bed was oh so comfortable. I will certainly stay at Omni hotels again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendliness and customer service of the staff made me feel special.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi would be the only improvement. For the price of the room, it seems like this would be included.
review.locationRemarks: I was in the city for work, so did not do any sightseeing.

review.reviewText: It was an amazing stay. Staff was friendly and the hotel clean and up to date. Near everything you can imagine but far enough from the hustle bustle that you get a quiet nights sleep. Only down side is $60 parking a night. Would stay here again.
This Hotel was great.  The staff were all top notch and the ementiries were more then we expected.  We will stay at the Omni any chance we get

review.title: Comfortable, clean, close to transportation
review.reviewText: In the Financial District, right on the California Cable car line, can walk to Ferry Building, Chinatown, North Beach, Market Street and Coit Tower.  Well kept building and facilities, staff very helpful.
very clean, nice rooms, very friendly, helpful staff
review.positiveRemarks: All staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Enjoyed being near many things. I walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, AT&T Park, Embarcadero Center. I believe all were within 30 minutes.

review.title: In the heart of the Financial District
review.reviewText:
The staff were extremely friendly and helpful I'm guiding us to SanFransico's hot spots. The booked a few tours for us to give us more free time to tour the city.

My only complaint was there is not beverage vending machines and the cleaning staff changed our towels and sheets when we asked them not not. We pride ourselves on being environmentally concious.

review.title: not worth the money I paid for at all
review.reviewText: Outdated rooms. Noisy neighbors. Could hear screamings and yelling all night long. I know not hotel's fault but don't put kids next door to a couple. Common sense!! View of the parking lot... Paid over $500 for one night to see concrete from my window! The only good thing was the staff!

review.title: All good but the bed...
review.reviewText: All good but the bed was soft and a bit older seeming with indents on each side of king bed. The only thing that wasn't great about the stay!

review.title: Expensive hotel in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: Stayed for four nights for business.  At $525 or more a night you need to be on business.  Rooms are comfortable, beds are very nice and everything is spotlessly clean.  Showers good.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, great location, spotlessly clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Bottled water in the room was $7.50?  Seriously?
review.locationRemarks: Right at California and Montgomery, the heart of everything.

review.reviewText: Family of 4 with two teenage children.  Our room was very clean and comfortable, however for a bit more space for longer stays I would recommend a larger room or booking 2 rooms.  The hotel staff was extremely helpful, attentive and courteous.

review.title: Close to Ferry building, which is why we booked.
review.reviewText: Excellent service/staff.  Adequate room although a bit pricey for its features.  No view, which was a bit disappointing.  Good location for getting to the Embarcadero.

review.title: One complaint.
review.reviewText: Our television wasn't working properly for most channels. The picture or image would freeze on most channels and all you could hear was audio. We stayed for 7 nights. Our television was never fixed during our stay so they added complementary internet access to our room to off-set the fact that our TV was broken.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, but the television in our room. We loved our stay and would highly recommend these accommodations to either our friends or family members.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade the in-room technology. For example, add Google Fiber or Apple TV or OLED monitors plus remote.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk or Lyft or Uber to just about anywhere in the city from The Omni in around 10 - 15 minutes or less. The location rocks!

review.title: Perfect Location, Excellent Customer Service
review.reviewText: This hotel is wonderful - awesome location, comfy beds, nicely appointed rooms and best of all - amazing customer service.  We recently stayed here during spring break with our two kids (6 and 8).  The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating to our children. They hosted an Easter Egg hunt and had photos with the Easter Bunny on Easter morning - they even set up an area for the kids to dye eggs in one of their ballrooms.  In addition, milk and cookies were delivered to our room every day - our kids loved that.  The location was great - everything is a very quick taxi ride or short walk away, and we found the area to be much quieter than where we usually stay in Union Square - not as much city noise late at night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and we will definitely stay here again during our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Well located hotel in the financial district. Close to major sites. Very clean, will go back.

We had a great stay luvd the location in the city! So close to China Town and Union St. Also trolley is close too. People were great' especially Darryl, who greeted us when we got there with our car parking! He told us everywhere to go and how to get there! Wonderful man!! Just a great place to stay!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for letting us know of your positive experience. We are so happy that you had a memorable family vacation to San Francisco and appreciate your feedback. We hope to host you again.

Thank you.

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: I don't write reviews but feel compelled to write this after having had a great stay at Omni San Francisco with my family (with my wife and two kids aged 7 and 6). We have stayed in a LOT of hotels and this one sets the bar. I don't think I have had a more friendly and welcoming check in experience and it only got better from there. The staff is so well trained; helpful without being overbearing. Room and especially the bathroom (which I am picky about were odor free and very clean. Every day they would deliver milk and cookies in the afternoon for the kids. During check out they asked me if I would like some newspapers for the flight back to Seattle. In this day and age of non-existent customer service the management of this hotel should be extremely proud. I know this sounds like an over the top review; take it fro a discerning traveler - these guys deserve it.

Nice, comfortable and elegant hotel. Modern style with vintage charm. Professional and helpful staff. Excellent location, close to union square, italian and chinese quarters. I would stay there again!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: All good, only minor niggles, noisy air conditioning unit in room and small beds, actually traditional doubles but I guess we have got used to a larger bed. Fab location 15 mins walk from Union Sq and 35 mins to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel, too far of a walk to the embarcadero
review.reviewText: Great rooms, great staff, they were very courteous, especially when it came to getting our car multiple times.

review.title: Great hotel in the centre of SF!
review.reviewText: Great location, close to every place we wanted to go to.

review.title: Lovely full-service hotel in financial district.
review.reviewText: The facility is great, but the best part about the OMNI was the top-notch customer service from all hotel staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Family-friendly service; kids were provided a fresh chocolate-chip cookie and milk every day.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower curtain liners could be laundered more frequently.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stops outside hotel on California St.; not too far from Ferry Building and other transit stops.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful.  Gym had limited equipment but the day pass to the bay club across the street was reasonable at $15.

review.title: Easter Weekend
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Great staff. Very accommodating. Walking distance to everything in downtown SF
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, site seeing, boating, golf, restaurants

review.title: Great location excellent staff great fruit water!
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel in walking distance of many interesting areas. Clean friendly older building. Would def stay again. Beds are a little soft as are the pillows. Other than that super!

review.title: Nice hotel close to the attraction
review.reviewText: It was a great stay at the hotel. The lobby was beautiful, flowers were changed daily, the fruit water in the lobby was a great hydration after a long walk up hill and down hill plus the apple was always fresh.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Loved everything about this hotel. We will definitely be back!

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: For what it cost, this hotel was one of the best service wise, amenities (no free WiFi), gym, etc. The service was fantastic and first class. The room was big and relatively quiet. The location was also very convenient.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown and area attractions

review.title: Great Honeymoon
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel. My wife and I went for our honeymoon. I called the hotel before we flew out to San Francisco, and asked them what we could do for my wife. Without missing a beat they offered rose petals on the bed, chocolate covered strawberries (fresh), and free champagne to be in the room when we arrived. Every single staff member without knowing who we were somehow knew we were on our honeymoon and said congratulations. The staff was knowledgeable, and helped us figure out how to get everywhere we wanted to go without having the need for a rental car which was great since California traffic is crazy. Restaurant was fantastic, thought expensive  (like everything in San Francisco). Great location, less than a mile walk to the ferry building. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel for our vacation.

review.title: Exceptional Service
review.reviewText: Everyone from the front desk, to room service, to the incredibly friendly maid service, to the door men made our stay wonderful. The bag of gifts at check in for my 5 year old daughter was an indication of how lovely everyone would be. The breakfast at room service was prompt and delicious and the cookies and milk waiting for us after a long day was a great touch. We've stayed at a lot of 5 star hotels and the service at the Omni was definitely equal to what we have received at much more expensive hotels. The view from our fourth floor room was unfortunately of an office building within arm's reach but it didn't deter from our stay and had we asked to be moved I'm sure based on everything else we would've been accommodated. If a nice view is a requirement of your stay I would mention that when checking in otherwise the hotel was just what we were looking for with a great location on California street with the cable cars and within walking distance of everything.

review.title: Family, Friends, and Business
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our great location in the financial district which allowed for easy access to BART, MUNI, and ferries at the nearby Ferry Building. Easy walk to China Town, North Beach, SOMA. Beautiful foyer, landmarked building, gracious front-desk staff.  Morning coffee delivered to our door started each day off perfectly. But, though sheets and towels were attended to, the room was not really cleaned very well. Dust on glass shades and stuff on the rug from day to day.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very responsive/concerned. Surprised one night to find a note from the housekeeping director with a gift of bottled mineral waters and fruit.
review.locationRemarks: Near street car, BART/MUNI, ferries. Walk to lots of good neighorboods. Good eating, but fewer restaurants open on Sundays as financial district.
review.userLocation: New Yorker, now retired in Maine

review.reviewText: We stayed here for three nights and loved everything about it.  Excellent location and friendly service.  Plenty of space in the room/bathroom for 2 adults and 2 children.  We enjoyed our stay immensely and will certainly come back!

review.title: Be prepared to be pampered.
review.reviewText: Great hotel adjacent to Chinatown and walkable to Fisherman's Wharf. You will feel like you are having a truly luxurious escape between the doorman, helpful concierge, comfortable bedding and complimentary spa water and fresh fruits. Also, the adjacent Bob's Steak and Chop house is good for an elegant dinner.... just pricey for breakfast. However, a great pastry/coffee shop called Boulange is roughly a block away.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, walkable to North Beach (which has great Italian food) and walkable to Fisherman's Wharf (the tourist area).

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. Location was also very good. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. They good the extra mile to help.
Had breakfast at theHotel restaurant and it was good but $$$$.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Ferry building, China Town, Union Square..

review.title: Good hotel in a very convenient area
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in an area which is very convenient to an exploration of the city. It is 6 blocks or so from the Montgomery BART station, so it was not difficult to take BART into town from the airport. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Beds are comfortable, and the room was clean. The only downside was that we were given a room on the top floor, the 17th, which had small high windows, making the room somewhat dark and dreary. I would suggest asking for a high floor (less street noise) but NOT the 17th floor. Looking at the hotel from the outside, the windows on all of the other floors appear to be of a more standard size.
review.negativeRemarks: At check in, I would have liked to have been told of the unusual window configuration and asked if that was acceptable to me.
review.locationRemarks: It is an easy walk to the Ferry Building and Embarcadero. If you are visiting on a Saturday don't miss the Farmers Market behind the Ferry Building

review.title: Great location and staff.
review.reviewText: What a great place to stay. The service was top notch, room was awesome and location was perfect. Everything is in walking distance including shopping, Chinatown two blocks away, pier 39, etc. When I go back to San fran, I will stay at the omni 4 sure.

review.title: Hotel Omni
review.reviewText:
Didn't spend much time in the room but it was comfortable and the facilities were sufficient for our needs.

We ordered room service a couple of times whilst we were there and it came within the timeframes and was pretty good.
review.positiveRemarks: IT was quiet and wroked well
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the Financial District but also walking distance from Chinatown.

review.title: Pleased
review.reviewText: Easy check in/out. Fast service, valet was amazing overall a great experience.

review.title: Excellent and close to union Square
review.reviewText: Comfortable, beautiful and excellent room services
review.positiveRemarks: We can do many things walking
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect

review.title: A Perfect Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: The Omni heads our list of places to stay in San Francisco.  In every way it was delightful.  The staff was friendly and efficient and the location on California St. couldn't be better.  Cable cars and buses went right by the hotel.  We loved out three days there.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in the heart of everything.  The Ferry Building is six blocks down Californi and can be reached by hopping on a bus or cable car.

review.title: Nice Hotel. Very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but Internet should be free for what you are spending here.

review.title: Excellent but not outstanding!
review.reviewText: The beds (sheets, frames) , tvs (size) and other room equipment/decor could be better at this price.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds (sheets, frames) , tvs (size) and other room equipment/decor
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping, Bars, Lounges

review.title: Omni SF is my go to hotel in the Bay Area.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Omni SF a number of times now and I am always a happy customer. The rooms are large and well appointed, comfortable beds, plenty of fluffy pillows, drawer space, coffeemaker, desk and chairs. I cannot say enough about the friendly service - from the doorman to the maid service - everyone is pleasant and lovely. Delicious apples and tea in the beautiful lobby make it a great place to linger. It's well located, walking distance from Chinatown, and the Van Ness cable car runs right in front of the hotel with a stop on the opposite corner. My room is always ready, my bill is always correct, the gladly call a cab, give me directions, and hold my luggage. The interior rooms face office buildings but it's pretty quiet during the weekend and I'm usually out seeing the wonderful sites of San Francisco anyway so I don't mind.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Wonderful, spacious rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. The hotel puts everyone in a good mood!
review.negativeRemarks: My stay was perfect and lovely. Omni SF provides a wonderful respite for a weekend away from LA.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown and many wonderful French restaurants. You can actually walk to the wharf if you are inclined, it's good exercise!

review.reviewText: Staff very helpful and pleasant. Room good. Location worked for me it's convenient to walk to most places business and shops. The rates were reasonable for the level of hotel and I'd recommend
Great location. Wonderful staff and hotel. Very comfortable beds.

love this hotel
ill certainly will return
grate location and a wonderful stay
mostly recommended !!!!

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel I would go back. Everyone was very nice and I'd pay to go back again worth every penny.
The Omni in San Francisco was great. The hotel is beautiful and the service was outstanding.

review.title: Close enough
review.reviewText: The Omni is close enough to all of the favorites without being too touristy.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This hotel is central to almost anything you need.  However, if you need a cab, your doormen go above and beyond.  If you need anything else, the front desk does the same.  They work hard at this hotel and it shows.  I will stay here every time!
review.locationRemarks: China town is just up the hill and there is a little restaurant alley right down the street.  I would recomment Plouf restaurant in the alley.

review.title: Great Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing. Staff was great! They even sent a free bottle of champagne to my room for my birthday! Mark the concierge was great and got booked for us any tours we were looking to do. The staff also made great suggestions for things to do and dinner.

review.title: OMNI SF
review.reviewText: Great location, great hotel... just don't ask the concierge for a restaurant recommendation you may be disappointed. Instead go have dinner at La Folio...
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, spacious and clean room, great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The smoky smell in the room is not very pleasant, I don't know what type of perfume they are using... but it was for sure not my favorite.
review.locationRemarks: Go eat at The Slanted Door at the Embarcadero, also La Folio and Azizia are two amazing restaurants and for a quick lunch go to Boudin.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Everyone was incredibly nice.  Bed was incredibly comfortable.  From the doorman to the house cleaner, the staff was on point.  Even got a complimentary ride in an escalade.

review.title: Exceptional visit
review.reviewText: This hotel is a class act establishment! The staff is so kind and friendly, and every one we came across went out of their way to make our 3 year old son feel like a king! It is a perfect location, halfway between the Ferry Building and Union Square. We will definitely be staying here again. I cannot say enough about our great experience.

review.title: Visiting from The North
review.reviewText: Fantastic staff, fantastic stay.  Could not recommend this establishment more highly!!

review.title: Great staff, great location.
review.reviewText: Very nice in all aspects.  Remarkably friendly and helpful staff.  Great location away from the frenzy of Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: A warm welcoming place
review.reviewText: We arrived very late at night after a long day and difficult flight, and were met with warmth and welcome. Withinh 10 mins we were shown to our room which was exceptionally clean. comfortable and attractive. Our five day stay couldn't have been better. Any request or question was met with an attitude of "we can do this". The staff, all of them, were friendly and determined to make our stay as satisfying and relaxing as possible,

review.title: Great hotel, $15/day for wifi??
review.reviewText:
Very good experience, hotel staff very professional and friendly.  Liked the location, close to 
Union Square without all of the fuss and huge crowds.  Still a little upset about the charge for 
wifi.  I can't remember the last time I had to pay for wifi.  Ate at the hotel restaurant and had a 
very good meal although a little pricy.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff and location. Room was comfortable and very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close by and we walked to nearly every where.

review.title: Great hotel with so-so beds
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with good location, but beds were not that comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby, friendly staff, good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were too soft, slumped in he middle.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to Ferry Building, Chinatown, Coit Tower, North Beach, Yerba Buena Gardens, Metreon.

review.title: Luxury with a nice touch of hospitality
review.reviewText: They had gingerbread cookies and hot tea in the lobby.. A nice way to welcome guests with kids. Parking was expensive though.

review.title: Could. Not Have Asked for Better!!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was fabulous!!!! The staff was amazing, so friendly and helpful. The lobby was beautiful, the location was great and the rooms were roomy and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: It's easy to walk or get transportation from hotel. Ask at the desk for directions. They can get you where you are going to avoid the steep streets.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Staff is courteos and very helpful.  Rooms are clean and comfy, but you do get the feel that you are in an older building, floors squeak a little, nothing too dramatic.   Elevators are a bit slow (only 3 for a large hotel).  Overall a pretty decent hotel for a moderate price.  Would for sure stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything!  Cable cars right out front.  A few blocks from Chinatown and Union Square.  Great location.  Safe to walk at night.

review.title: Great location; friendly, attentive staff
review.reviewText: Juan at the front desk was superb. Was able to check us in early and gave us an awesome room.

review.title: Closer to a four star than a five star
review.reviewText: There is nothing particularly wrong with the Omni, but there is also not anything special or inspiring about it.   From a decor perspective it's stodgy and traditional.  Everything was clean and well maintained, but the room was not particularly large and it appeared to not have been updated in 10+ years.   As an example, the shower was a tub style shower with a cloth curtain.   Most hotels in this class have long ago upgraded to a walk in shower with glass and nice hardware.   Bottom line is that it was a fine hotel, but better ones are available in this category.

review.title: Nice hotel - location weekday good
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel and staff.  Location is central to downtown - good.  But being the financial district most things (food etc.) are closed in the immediate vicinity on weekends and holidays.  Other than that and the overpriced restaurant the hotel was pretty, hotel staff were great, and I would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: about 4 blocks from Bart and Market street.  Next to Chinatown.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the center of it all
review.reviewText:
This was my second stay at this hotel.  It's within walking distance of lots of shopping & other major
attractions.  Staff is very knowledgeable & courteous.
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown & lots of good restaurants.  Also excellent shopping.

review.title: Unbeatable location
review.reviewText: Amazing hotel, the parking expensive but a car is not needed in SA.

review.title: Great location, very nice hotel!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our one night getaway in the hotel, we booked a deluxe room with a king bed and it was amazing! The room was spatious and beautiful, the bathroom was stacked with everything you might need, nice bathrobes as well! We celebrated a birthday so we got a personal birthday cake and a card from the front desk! The stuff was very polite and helpful, the valet parking was not too expensive ($38 for over 24 hrs of parking). And finally the location was super convenient: walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, the Ferry Building, shopping and restaurants. Overall very satisfying experience!

review.title: Friendly and welcoming place to stay
review.reviewText: Quiet room on floor 14. Lovely interior design touches and a super friendly staff.  We enjoyed the extra touches of nightly cookies and milk and turn down service. Loved the location...walk to Union Squake or Chinatown in minutes...also close to Coit tower. Would certainly stay here again.

review.title: Pleasant experience
review.reviewText: Probably wouldn't have chosen but they have specials.  Great place to spend Christmas and eat at nearby restaurants.  Every detail caused comfort or pleasure.  Every staff contact was pleasant and fruitful.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Chinatown, close to Embarcidaro, Union Square

review.title: Beautiful hotel, close to Pier 39
review.reviewText: Everyone was so pleasant and they went out of their way to help and offer whatever we needed.

review.title: Great Service, Highly Recommended
review.reviewText:
The Omni is a great 1940s style hotel convenient to the business district and the tourist sites along the Embarcadero.  My wife and I stayed at the Omni Christmas week 2014 -- and it was possibly our best hotel experience ever. 

Our room was spacious, and the hotel was impeccably clean, but the level of service impressed us the most. The service exceeded what we have experienced in far more expensive hotels.  

It started for us with the best front desk experience ever with Juan at the front desk.  We had a complicated reservation with an extra room for visiting family on a couple of different nights. Juan did everything possible to make us comfortable and to put us at ease. He was pleasant, professional, and completely unflappable.  The excellent level of service continued with staff members always ready with a greeting and an offer of assistance.  Whether it was directions, recommendations, a newspaper, or a cup of decaf coffee, the staff was happy to help and sincere.  It just made you feel good to be there.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is beautiful!  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The lobby served hot cider and gingerbread cookies each morning...a great touch at Christmas.  We were traveling with a party of six for two nights and used the service of the bellman to get us cabs.  He was nice enough to arrange for us to all ride together to the pier leaving for Alcatraz.   The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The fee for the use of wifi in the room was too high.  There is really no good reason for not having free wifi.  Many hotels now offer this service.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for our family! The staff was wonderful to our kids. The Doormen were so inviting and wonderful they really make it a 4 star hotel with their friendliness!! Great location and very clean. Loved the free coffee and cookies and cider:-) the only con was the waitress in the hotel restaurant was not so friendly with our two year old daughter and made me feel uncomfortable- with how kid friendly everyone else was they need to make sure all are:-).

This hotel is beautiful and the staff were extremely courteous.  The lobby had hot cider and cookies in the morning which the kids loved. We would definitely stay here again.  Oh and the cable car stops right in front to make the San Francisco experience even better.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL!
review.reviewText: Love the location, staff, decor and price of rooms. Booked thru Expedia with no problem.

review.title: Fantastic downtown San Francisco location.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here on Dec. 19 to get a San Francisco Christmas experience.  Hotel was right across the street
from the BofA which has an incredible tree.  We did not have that view, but did have a bay, North Beach,
Transamerica view...which was probably better.  The room was very comfortable, the bed sumptuous, the
bath room large and spotless, great shower.  Had a great bar at the street level that was full of holiday
revelers!  Would stay again in a minute.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect downtown location, right on cable car line, close to Embarcadero & Union Square.

review.title: In financial district but don't let this stop you.
review.reviewText: We walked a lot on this trip.  Hotel was close to Ferry Building which is great fun on Saturday mornings because of a farmer's market.  Wonderful Gluten Free bakery inside the Ferry Building.  Hotel is centrally located but we were all over town.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Cable Car, Close to Embarcadero Bart Station, walk to China Town, about 8 blocks to Union Square.

review.reviewText: we enjoyed the central location and walking distance to Union Square, China town, financial district, etc.  Staff was friendly.  Workout area was pretty good - 2 treadmills not working and lots of people wanting to use them.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Omni hotel is very kind and excellent.
Excellent courteous professional staff. So helpful and understanding. We would definitely be back when we visit San Francisco. Location can't be beat.

review.title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Stayed for four nights. Staff was fantastic, competent, and quick to handle any questions or issues. Location is excellent, far enough from the touristy stuff to be out of the way, but close enough that those areas are in walking distance. Will stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Middle of the financial district on a cable car line. Walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy, the wharf.

review.title: Lobby is beautiful but basic rooms disappointing
review.reviewText:
The lobby of this hotel is very nice, however the niceness ends there.
The negative:  Our room was not clean. There was a comb full of hair, and bottle caps stuck between our mattress and the head board. I found it because I always check every hotel I stay at for bedbugs. There were also a pair of false eyelashes on the floor next to the bed. Makes me wonder if they vacuum at all. Everything in the room costs money to consume. Two bottles of water 7.50 each! 15.00 for water? Drinking glasses were next to the bathroom sink, not wrapped in plastic, not very sanitary. Be aware that in this day and age they charge for the basic necessity of wi-fi, 14.95 a day. TV remote did not work unless you were literally 2 inches from the TV. And this is the second time we have stayed here and both times the room was not very clean and TV remote did not work well. The only reason we stayed again was that I got an excellent deal so we thought we would give it a second chance. I won't stay here again. They have a shower curtain in the bathroom which is very "Best Western" looking. Something else very disgusting was that there were long black hairs found on our pillow cases when we opened the bed to check it. 
The positive: Room air conditioning was quiet and they must have put an air freshener in it because it smelled good whenever it came on. There are also ample plug outlets for all your gadgets
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby, door attendants, ample outlets for tech gadgets on your room.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wi-fi, full explanation of what is complimentary in your room and what is not, clean the rooms more thoroughly.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice for the price. Location was not great for getting to the tourist attractions, seems better for business travelers. Staff was somewhat nice, but not informative on restaurants to take kids to within walking distance.

review.title: Security was rude
review.reviewText: A small group (3) of us were visiting the San Francisco area from the Washington, DC area for a 49ers football game.  The hotel allowed pets- which wasn't a problem.  We heard a dog barking next door...again not a problem.  Since we were on east cost time we were up around 4am.  A knock on the door came and it was security demanding that we open the door.  We refused because we were startled and unsure why he would be knocking on our door.  He again demanded that we open the door.  He proceeded to tell us that there was a complaint with our noise level.  There was no television on and no radio on...just the occupants talking. I would think that a hotel of this caliber and price would have a different approach to addressing a noise level aside from sending a rude security officer. This security guard was beyond rude and we asked to be moved since apparently the occupants with the dog were bothered.  The security guard was rude and disrespectful and his approach and demeanor was uncalled for.  We will not visit the Omni Hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing was open on the weekend that was in walking distance.

review.title: San Fran hotel review
review.reviewText: Amazing city, pretty good hotel. I was surprised to see this ranked #2 on trip advisor considering there wasn't really anything amazing, but there was nothing bad to report either. It's in the heart of the financial district so I recommend for business but maybe not so much for pleasure. It has a cable car right out front which is cool, no store in the hotel, one restaurant/bar which was pretty good. It was about a 25 min walk down to the piers which is where all the touristy action is. Good place, not great but definitely not bad either.

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: The wife and I visited San Fran for a week and had a great stay. We did stay at the Omni hotel in the financial district. The hotel was really nice the rooms were large and the staff was amazing and very accommodating. The one issue we had was the BEDS. They were horrible. They had no support and I tried to upgrade the room to a memory foam mattress, not an option all beds are the same. We were moved to the fifth floor were they were trying out new beds and the staff put plywood under are mattress and it helped. The first night sleep was horrible and better after we switched rooms. The Omni isn't a cheap hotel and would have gladly paid an extra hundred a night for memory foam it just wasn't a option.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants around the area bring lots of cab money.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everithing.  Parking expensive
review.reviewText:
Valet Parking  tooooo expensive.   $ 52.00 plus taxes per day.  
Food toooo expensive ..... $ 21.00 plus taxes and service for a cobb salad.  
Prices to High for a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel in great location
review.reviewText: This was our first time staying at the Omni San Francisco.  The hotel is gorgeous, in a great location, and the entire staff was fabulous.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Every staff member was friendly, courteous and extremely helpful.  I would highly recommend this hotel and I will return for future stays in San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I could think of.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in the financial district, cable car right outside door, close to Chinatown, North End and Ferry building.

review.title: Fantastic hotel with excellent staff
review.reviewText: We just returned after a week at Omni hotel, a great place to be and we would return to this hotel again. Is well situated and near all the amenities. Very quiet and the house keeping is outstanding. Our room was near the lift but no noise at all. We had a fantastic time at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything about this hotel is great.
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes walk from the Union Square and the Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very elegant hotel , city centre
review.reviewText: We booked from the UK so that we could have one night in the city. Although the hotel had great reviews we were un  prepared for what we found. Very very up market hotel which we had not picked up from the booking site. It was amazing , lovely. We did not use any other part of the hotel just the bedroom.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit more info, what's inc in the price, the fact that they take deposit against any expenditure you may not pay for??!
review.locationRemarks: Central location lots to do. Exploratorium, all the piers, cable cars, shops

review.title: excellent hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was wonderful. Every single person working there was friendly and helpful. We felt very welcome.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were very nice. Always spotless. Great restaurant. Very helpful staff. Helped with directions, transportation, and anything else we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: I would not change a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stop was right at our door. Lots of places to eat. Cabs available if needed. China town very close.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel in walking distance to many places! The bed did hurt our backs a little bit but we are used to a firm bed at home. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We signed up to be Omni Select Guests which gives you free wifi with your first stay!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: My only complaint, is that the HVAC unit was a little too loud which made it hard to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint, is that the HVAC unit was a little too loud which made it hard to sleep.

review.reviewText: Great staff. Clean facility. Very well located.  Would recommend and would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel for business as well as pleasure
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent!! Very clean hotel, walking distance to ballpark, shopping, and restaurants

review.title: Excellent Hotel in the Financial District
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a weekend with my teenage daughter after looking at Stanford and UC Berkeley.  This is a very nice hotel with luxury amenities.  I highly recommend signing up for Omni Rewards which will get you free wi-fi and  a discount on parking.  There are some parking garages nearby, but they were not open on the weekends, so we just valet parked.  This is the best option for parking and just budget for it if you are bringing a car.  The location is convenient for getting around San Francisco and the hotel staff is top notch.  I would highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: My daughter especially liked the milk and cookies that were left in the room every night.

review.title: San Francisco's Financial District's Hotel Bests
review.reviewText: The Omni Hotel in San Francisco is the location of choice for many in my work group - and I completely understand why. The location is ideal for access across the Financial District, Union Square, Market Street and Chinatown. The building itself has the look and feel of a luxury hotel in its heyday - mixed with many current amenities. The restaurant downstairs, Bob's, provides some of the best steaks in the area as well as a menu of other options that will appeal to many. It is the staff, however, that completely pushes this hotel over the top when it comes to feeling taken-care-of in San Francisco. Every person I interacted with was friendly, complimentary, accommodating and tremendously responsive. I happened to celebrate my birthday in the hotel while I was on a busines trip. My family made a special request to help me celebrate and the hotel presented me with a delectable tray of chocolate-covered strawberries! What a treat! From the Bell Hops, Valet Car folks and Door people to the Cleaning Crew and Front Desk, the Omni's staff is above reproach.
review.positiveRemarks: There is very little to NOT like! Number 1: ITS STAFF! Its location, its look and degree of general in-room comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: As my one thought for a recommendation, WiFi is an extra charge to the room unless you are a higher level Omni Select Guest member. Make it free...
review.locationRemarks: Central to the Financial District. Walking distance to Chinatown, Market Street, Union Square and easy access to the waterfront via cab.

review.title: Not that great hotel
review.reviewText: I wanted to stay at omni hotel because they are part of gha and had styed in some of there hotels in past but it was very dispointing!! Bathroom and bed room needs a lots of work!!! Door men try to make us take a uber for $30 which end up costing us in a regular taxi $11.20 only .

review.title: Beautiful, high class experience
review.reviewText:
Omni is a beautiful hotel and the room I stayed in was large and well appointed. The fitness center was clean and has nice equipment. 
The staff was accommodating and friendly. Every staff member I walked past greeted me, asked if I needed help, or opened a door. It was a lovely experience and a great way to begin and end my very busy work days. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great visit to San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Even though we were a late arrival from the airport, we were greeted at the door by the door men with a warm welcome.  All the employees were very friendly and helpful.  Anytime we had a question about where something in the city was located we always received help from the concierge.

Our room was very comfortable.  Enjoyed our stay very much.

Located on cable car line.
review.locationRemarks: China Town is within walking distance.  Convenient to tour pickup for Viator tour cable car.

review.title: Warm and upbeat ambiance; nice staff.
review.reviewText: Was visiting San Francisco on business.  The staff made this stay exceptional.  They were welcoming upon arrival; consistently checking with me as I passed  through the lobby multiple times per day about my stay and smiling warmly all the time.

review.title: Nice hotel!  Good location
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel were all very helpful.  The concierge was extremely helpful with directions and transportation to Palo Alto.

review.title: It was nice . . . . .
review.reviewText: A nice hotel.  Beautiful accoutrements, but the room (at least our room) was small, given the price.  Both the bedroom and bath were clean, but I was disappointed in the lack of ventilation.  The day was very warm, so the air conditioning came on often.  It woke me up frequently . . . .resulting in a very poor night's sleep.  The bar downstairs is nice . ..we had a cocktail before our wedding venue.  I wasn't super pleased, nor terribly disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: I asked for a "view" room.  We were given the 6th floor . . . . .hardly a view.
review.locationRemarks: Convenience for the pier, where we were heading, was excellent.  We loved the valet service . . . . .only way to go.

review.title: great location.  Very clean
review.reviewText: Great all around stay.  Very clean  and well appointed rooms.  Staff was awesome.
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square, Chinatown, Great eateries.

review.title: Nice hotel with a nice location
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel, clean and close to everything. My only disappointment was paying extra for a room with a view..... It did not have a view.

review.title: Average is as average does
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Omni because if the soft rate on Expedia. Luckily it was only for a few hours. In a city of immense character and charm, the Omni is unfortunately situated in a Dead Zone. I walked one block this way, one block that way and didn't say anything ahead. I finally hopped in a cab. Maybe I should have named this review "Desolation Row."

review.title: Very pleasant experience
review.reviewText: OUTSTANDING customer service!   Would definitely recommend.  Very clean and bedding was extremely comfortable, Omni did not skimp on quality...great location!!  Omni has gone above and beyond with staff quality...always there to meet your needs!!
review.positiveRemarks: Customer service, location, and quality of accomodations.
review.negativeRemarks: HVAC seemed to struggle with humidity management.
review.locationRemarks: Close to China town, union square, mad market square

review.reviewText: Great for The Ferry Building farmers market. Pay for the valet, it's worth it.

review.title: Nice hotel in financial district
review.reviewText:
good location for seeing and walking to main sites in san fran.
friendly hotel staff and clean rooms.

review.title: Fabulous hotel with the best customer service.
review.reviewText: This hotel is one of the best.  Probably the best staff I have ever experienced.  From the time we got out of the cab at the front door until the time we checked out, the staff would open doors for us, great us personally, assist anyway they could, etc.  We had a slight plumbing problem when we woke up one morning and told the front desk when we left for the day.  They were there and everything fixed within an hour.  On Friday night we were heading out for dinner and cabs were hard to come by.  The doorman, guided us over to a limo that they keep at their disposal during busy times.  The limo took us to our restaurant at no charge.  Unbelievable. Whoever trains their staff should be commended.  Wonderful hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It is in the financial district which is a bit removed from the shopping and restaurants in the Union Square area but the pleasant experience made it

review.title: Nice hotel, but don't expect much complimentary
