review.reviewText: It might be because I am not used to hotels, but I think it's pretty appalling that people in the lobby can access wifi for free and I have to pay $20 a day. I was also amazed that a bottle of water left in the bathroom cost $8. Not to mention the $60 per night valet fee. I don't like the feeling that every dollar that can be extracted from me is being done.

review.title: Omni......Quality, Quality!!!
review.reviewText:
From the moment when we arrived at the Omni......I knew it was to be a great place to stay....It is in the 
financial district....which means, lots of banks....normal hrs....and minimum noise......hustle and bustle....
The staff were very friendly and accommodating....Our room was spacious.....very clean and well maintained. 
We were provided our choice of beverages for the early morning at no cost.......delivered to the room on time...
just a knock on the door......and there it was.......We did not eat at Bob's Steak House......In SF, there are so 
many places to chose from.....Chinese, Seafood, Steak Places, etc.......What else can I say......the word 
Omni speaks for itself....Quality.......Sure, its costly.....but I prefer quality over budget cut anyday.....
review.locationRemarks:
China town is two blocks away......The hotel is located in the financial district.....lots of ATMs.......Lots of 
restaurants nearby.....

review.title: Excellent Hotel with a great location.
review.reviewText: Great Hotel for families that want to get a taste of downtown San Francisco, and the surrounding area.  The hotel staff was friendly and informative.  The accommodations were tasteful and always clean.  The hotel was in walking distance to so many attractions, and if we couldn't walk there, we could catch a cable car right outside the hotel entrance.  The whole family enjoyed the accommodations and would stay there again.

review.title: Convenient location, very good amenities
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful when I needed to change my reservations at the last minute.
review.locationRemarks: 6 block walk from Moscone Center and many excellent restaurants.

review.title: Upscale and a good central location
review.reviewText: Nicely appointed rooms, great attentive staff and restaurant/bar.

review.title: Good Hotel in the financial district.
review.reviewText: My impression of the hotel was quite positive.  There were doormen at the ready to take my suitcases when exiting the taxi and to open the entrance doors.  The lobby was relatively spacious and well appointed.  The hotel also had a large bowl of apples and cold drink available to those that so desired.  The staff at the desk were professional and helpful in answering questions about city tours, nearby restaurants and the like.  The room was everything that you would expect from an upscale hotel, but it was not particularly spacious.  The king sized bed was quite comfortable.  The cleaning staff were pleasant and did an excellent job.   As my stay progressed my initial impression was only confirmed.  The doormen were always pleasant and asked if I needed any service.  I felt like they really wanted to be of assistance (without expecting to be tipped - although I did tip upon arrival and at departure).
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location in that it was close to shops and restaurants and public transit.
review.negativeRemarks: The "gym" could be larger.  There was very little room to use the free weights that are available and insufficient room for 2 people to do stretches.
review.locationRemarks: A cable car line runs right in front of the hotel and Union Square (with its shops and restaurants) was within easy walking distance.

review.reviewText: We stayed for 7 days and had a wonderful experience at the Omni.  From the quick check in--no waiting, the cleaning service leaving us notes hoping our stay was going well, to the doormen who always had a smile and a helpful suggestion.  While there we celebrated our anniversary and when we returned to the room for the night we were pleased to find they had brought in champagne, strawberries, and an anniversary card with a personal note.

review.title: Nice rooms, great staff.
review.reviewText:
Staff excellent, very helpful, rooms great size, facilities very good. Location convenient.
Would stay again, highly recommended.

review.title: Elegant hotel in financial district
review.reviewText: Great hotel near Chinatown, Coit tower and other SF attractions. Easy taxi ride to Golden Gate Bridge. A staff are friendly, helpful. Great dining within short distance - try out Beldan Place for great selection of food. Beds were comfortable and decor elegant. Free wifi in lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, Chinatown, duck tour at Fisherman's Wharf was great fun. Walking the golden gate bridge is a must. Can walk to Fisherman's Wharf ~ 40 min.

review.title: Great Hotel - close to Everything
review.reviewText: We thought this hotel was everything we had read about it.  The staff was knowledgeable, helpful, and most professional.  Many times they came to us to ask if we needed anything; we did not even have to approach them.  Also, the location was perfect for us.  It was right on the cable car route, but yet it was quiet and peaceful.  Will recommend this hotel to our friends who are planning a trip to San Francisco in the near future.
review.negativeRemarks: My husband, who has a bad back, found the mattress a little too hard for his liking.
review.locationRemarks: Like previously mentioned, the cable cars run right by the hotel so it is very convenient to pick them up right on the corner.  Close to restaurants.

review.title: Overpriced parking
review.reviewText: They charge $60 per night (with tax) for valet parking with no warning of this price. We would have used public parking a block away had we known this.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Every single staff member was so polite and helpful we practically discussed it the entire stay very impressed

review.title: Nice hotel in financial district.
review.reviewText: Great location, nice staff and clean hotel. They do not offer free wifi or free access to internet in business center. The only minor complaint in an otherwise great hotel.

review.title: Intimate lovely setting
review.reviewText: Although it had big hotel amenities it had an intimate quality to it.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, amazing staff, terrible room
review.reviewText:
First and foremost, the staff is amazing.  Helpful, courteous, supportive, and very nice.  From the bellmen, to front desk, and executive sous chef, who by the way, saved this review for me.  
Check in was fine, but the room was a mess.  It was already so late and we didn't want to move rooms because my husband and daughter were so tired....there were oily handprints and palm prints on both headboards....did not look like an error with the cleaning process:/, but that previous guests had fun.
The remote was also so oily, we actually had to complain then to replace the remote...ewwwww, and I was so embarrassed to go down to the front to explain.  They were apologetic.  I asked to waive the valet fee for the inconveniences.  No problem there.  Went back upstairs to take a shower.  Finally...then I looked at bathroom floor and it looked like a little dried blood or vomit:(((( so gross.  I put on clothes again, wet hair and all down to the front desk again!!! There was the executive sous chef talking with staff...he asked what the issue was.  I explained from the beginning, and he had our room service comped, and sent up a very nice tray with champagne, fruits, chocolates, and Fizzy water.  
This sweet man is what is saving this review along with the kind and helpful staff at the hotel, which leads me to believe this is not "standard."   If there is a next time I hope the room lives up to their reputation and reflects the employees exceptional attitudes.

review.title: Great hotel from a to z....
review.reviewText: This was our first time to San Francisco and we will definitely be staying at the Omni when we go back. From the time the bellman opened the door, welcomed us and offered to take our bags to the second we checked out we received first class service and attention. They even checked us in early without us even asking which was refreshing to see. I would definitely say for the price this was more than worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: More consistency in the staff's style of cleaning. Both are very good, but we could tell when a different person did our room.
review.locationRemarks: We found great eateries, an awesome cigar bar, easy access to the Bart, coffee shops, retail, banks and a Walgreens.

review.reviewText: It was a good week just needs better cheaper parking avaiable
Everything is great and even the parking service. It may be the most cheapest parking in the financial district.
Fabulous staff always attentive but never overbearing.  Clean facilities, great mattress on bed and large room.  One of the best in the country

review.title: Too expensive for what you get
review.reviewText: Not much to say. It was a basic hotel where you paid for parking (33 dollars) and you got a small room with no view, small TV and dissapointing bed. Would not pay to stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Union Square

review.title: Best rate found for a top notch Hotel in Downtown
review.reviewText: For a one night stay it was great. The hotel is very elegant and at a great location. Rooms are nice, your typical nice hotel. Nothing really stands out though.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very elegant and had great customer service.
review.negativeRemarks:
In room WiFi should be included in the hotel rate and all the taxes they charge. 
The all day Valet with in/out privileges was used to its max.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to The Ferry Building which also has a great marketplace, Chinatown, Bart, Trolly Cars. Located In the Financial District.

review.title: Excellent hotel, staff are amazing.
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, staff very helpful and friendly.  Hotel not too far from Union Square.  Rooms comfortable.  If you want excursions ask Mark the Concierge he is very knowledgeable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff can't do enough for you.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, just next to Chinatown.  Easy to walk to Union Square.  Located in the Financial District.

review.title: Omni San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was fancy, but the beds were small, and there were no amenities such as a pool or fitness center. For the price, I expected much more.

review.title: Visit to SF
review.reviewText:
Great hotel close to china town and the cable cars. 

Beds were far too soft and we didn't get a good nights sleep. 

Overall I would recommend this place.

review.title: Great facility and staff!
review.reviewText: This hotel is not only close to everything, but the staff is extremely helpful. The concierge staff in particular was first rate. Everyone at the hotel went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were well-appointed, comfortable and modern. The staff was so friendly that even people who were obviously off duty took time to greet us.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is just up the street, Little Italy is around the corner, and the piers are a short walk and a trolley ride away.

review.title: Great location close to all sites
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience for a 3 day weekend stay with our teenage son.  Hotel was in a quiet location which was great for night time sleeping but was also walking distance to all the terrific SF sites and quaint neighborhoods.  Rooms were a comfortable size and check in and hotel staff was exceptional.  We were there on the weekend of the SF Marathon and a big movie filming and despite all the hub hub, the accomodations worked perfectly.  Really enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great room, firm mattresses, perfect temperature for sleeping.  Great tips from the door men on things to do.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Little Italy, Fisherman's wharf and movie theaters were all walking distance.  Cable car stop just outside the front doors.

review.title: Centrally located close to everything we wanted.
review.reviewText: Walked to China town, mass transit was close. Trolley ran down the street in front of the hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel and staff
review.reviewText: We had a great stay.  Great location.  Laura at front desk helped print out Tix to AT&T Park and gave hints on travel.  Darrel at front door was also very helpful.  Hotel was clean and luxurious.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: We had six people in my group, so we had two rooms, each with 2 double beds. It was a little tight fitting two people in a double bed but it was manageable. Of course, that has more to do with the size of beds, not the hotel itself, but just an FYI, since there is not room for a roll away if you have 2 double beds. We had 8 people in the room at one point just hanging out, and it was not a problem, so the rooms were differently big enough. One thing I found strange was there was no fan in the bathroom. Wasn't a big deal, but just thought it was strange. Staff was very nice, and very quick to accommodate a couple requests we had. The location of the hotel itself, is pretty good. It is in the financial district, so it is a little bit limiting in terms of food options right around there, but we went to dinner at North Beach which was about a 5 to 10 minute walk away so not a big deal at all. Everyone in my group had a positive experience, and I would stay here again.

review.title: Very elegant
review.reviewText: I stayed once at the San Francisco Omni several years ago when traveling alone and enjoyed my time there.  Very elegant and comfortable, very friendly and accommodating staff, and very quiet on the weekends.  But this time, my fiance' and I agreed that a pool/hot tub would have been nice, and a view of the Bay would've been glorious!  So although this is a top-notch facility in many ways, it doesn't meet your needs if you're looking for a romantic retreat in the City by the Bay.  Otherwise, the price is right for the quality of hotel and we enjoyed our stay immensely.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, elegant, comfortable bed/pillows/linens and friendly, accomodating staff
review.negativeRemarks: Better quality iron in the room
review.locationRemarks: Many attractions, such as Ferry Building, ATT Park and Union Square close by

review.title: Excellent Stay, Convenient Location, Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: Had the pleasure to stay for only one night.  We're a couple staying overnight and were treated to a very nice large room that was clean and wonderfully furnished.  This hotel is close to everything.  The Ferry Market Building was just a short 10 minute walk were we were able to go to the Hog Island Oyster Bar, a favorite place for seafood.  This place was also so close to Chinatown.  The staff were so helpful, from the valet to the reception desk.  My husband is a diabetic and woke up at 1:30 Am and had a low blood sugar attack and he went down to the front desk and was helped by David T. with a glass of orange juice and a cookie to alleviate the symptoms my husband was suffering from.  Many thanks to this super employee for helping my husband out.  In the morning another staffer by the name of Kyle H helped us to get our wifi charges waived after verifying that we were Select Club members.  Many thanks to him also and finally the Valet staff were very nice.  Thanks to Jerome and Mark for helping us.  Great  experience at Omni.  We'll likely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful location and so clean and spacious rooms.  One can even specify preferences for a high floor or corner room.
review.negativeRemarks: To save money on utility bills, the hotel can replace the incandescent lamps used, for the more energy efficient compact fluorescent lamps and LEDs.
review.locationRemarks: The Ferry Market building, Chinatown and fishermen's wharf are easily accessible from this place.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, close to everything in the city. Staff very welcoming upon entrance and exit of hotel.

review.title: Good, but not great.
review.reviewText: This was a comfortable hotel with traditional decor and a so-so bathroom.  The location was central, but in the not-so-interesting financial district.  Because of the close nearby towers the rooms had no views and not much light.  Staff was friendly and available.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the nearby Ferry building for lunch and a walk along the Embarcadero.

review.title: Mini Family Trip
review.reviewText: Everything was great from the time we arrived until the time we departed. The staff was always helpful and friendly. The room was clean and there was a note from housekeeping welcoming us. We all love the hotel. They went out of their was when my kid asked if they had a pool. They said no but a few minutes later, house keeping came to our room with milk and cookies for my kids. That was awesome.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! The staff was always great and helpful. The room was very clean and the beds are comfy.  The location of the hotel is great as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. Best Hotel we've stayed at.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great. China town is a few blocks away and union square is a ten minute walk. From there, we took the trolly to fisherman ward.

review.title: A great hotel to stay when there is a bargain
review.reviewText:
Historical building in the high end downtown of SF, with all comforts of a 5-star hotels.
Standard room (where I stayed) is spacious and with rich-looking furniture.
Bathroom is clean and with pretty new accessories.
I had limited interactions with hotel personnel but I didn't have impression of warm/proactive approach; let's say that is what is expected in any other 5-star hotel.
Rack price is very expensive although aligned to similar accommodations in town.
I enjoyed a promotion so my value for money was great.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at OMNI. It is very close to catching a trolley but located in the city close by many things that we walked pretty much everywhere.

review.title: Very nice hotel in financial district
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Very clean and large room. Good location. Close to BART station.

review.title: Great Hotel in the Financial District
review.reviewText: Went to San Francisco for the week of July 4th for a vacation. The Omni was wonderful!! We had 3 rooms, all next to each other, and no issues with any of them. Beautiful hotel, wonderful customer service. Rooms were roomy and very clean. Within walking distance of pretty much everything. If you don't like to walk taxis are easy to find. The hotel is close I to China Town, Union Square, and Little Italy (North Beach). Rented a car for a few days, FYI parking at the hotel is expensive. There is a parking garage down the street that was much cheaper. All in all our stay was fantastic. Would definitely stay there again..
review.locationRemarks: Located in the Financial District. Easy walk to China Town and Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Great staff, everyone from the lobby to the valet parking was very good.
Great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location (steps away from Chinatown).

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location to everything you want to see and all the good restaurants.  Hotel staff very friendly and nice.  The Hotel was very comfortable and clean, hotel lobby was very nice.  Definately worth staying at, best place I've stayed in SF!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown and Union Square within waliking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel's location was within walking distance of many if the places we wanted to visit in SF

review.title: Nice but expensive
review.reviewText: Rate in expedia is the lowest among the 4 star hotels. The catch is, hotel charged me about $60/night for parking.

review.title: Best Doorman in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The doorman Daryl made our stay from the moment we arrived until the day we left.
Great hotel in the heart of the city.  Walking distance to BART, great staff and super comfy bed.

review.title: Nice hotel in a convenient area
review.reviewText: Coveneinelty located for our stay which was to do some events on the Embarcadero and dinner at Millenium and Kokkari. The staff was excellent  and the hotel was  comfortable. Wouldn't recommend their restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Walking distance to Union Sq, Ferry building and a lot of good restaurants

review.title: The perfect hotel.
review.reviewText: Fantastic guest services, large clean and modern rooms, all in a classic style hotel. It is in the financial district, so it is quiet, but it is on the street car route. 2 blocks to China Town and 4 blocks to the Ferry Building on the wharf. This is the place to stay, and I am very picky!

review.title: Omni San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were booked into a room with a king size bed. The room overlooked California Street although, as we were on the 14th floor, not much of the street was visible! All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: From the moment you enter the Hotel, everyone has a friendly smile and greeting. Nothing was too much trouble.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is just a few blocks to the shopping areas of Market Street and the Ferry Building.

review.reviewText:
Incredibly efficient staff!  Stayed six days and every day seemed to be better than the previous.  Immaculate setting, staff is very knowledgable/helpful/professional.  
We will return to this hotel in the future.

review.title: Ultra Chocolate Tour
review.reviewText: Hotel was conveniently located so that we only had to walk two blocks to the start of the tour.  And, we ended up two blocks from the hotel!!!  Six Chocolate shops plus a great hotel made it a wonderful experience.  Everyone should do it!!!
review.locationRemarks: Actually, one block from the hotel is the oldest restaurant in SF.....Three restaurants together that are superb.

review.title: nice hotel close to shopping area
review.reviewText: It's a great hotel, and staff are really nice. but my room is located at the lower level, and I can hear noise from the street at night time.
review.locationRemarks: union square

review.title: Great Hotel Grreat location
review.reviewText: From the moment we stepped in the lobby We fealt very comfortable . The staff wAs warm and welcoming . Kyle went out if his way to accomdate us . We loved the food in the bar and the fact the stayed open till midnight .

review.title: Small issues tarnish otherwise lovely stay
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed in the Omni as the last leg of a 2 week trip and other than a couple of issues we very much enjoyed our stay.

The hotel is well appointed, clean and the staff for the most part were very friendly. The Omni is situated in the financial district which is actuallya very central base from which to explore the city, of which there is alot to explore.

The only drawbacks were as follows, the first evening when my wife and I were craving some good honest BBQ food, we approached the reception as the conceirge was away from his desk and the treatment we received was frankly outrageous. We left feeling as though we were somehow lesser mortals than the gentleman behind the desk and that our enquiry was so far beath him it hardly warranted his time, which was not being taken up by anything else. The one reassuring fact was his colleague seemed to be cringing with embarrasement at this guys attitude.

The second issue was when we took advantage of the Omni Car servcie to drop us at the airport for our flight home, the service cost $55 but despite us advising we were flying to London with Virgin Atlantic the driver dropped us off that the domestic terminal meaning a 15 minute walk to the correct International terminal. By no means the end of the world but for an additional service that is charged for it was a bit irritating.

To finish on a high the conceirge and doormen were some of the friendliest and knowlegable people we met during our 2 week stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to San Francisco sights, Doormen were really friendly
review.locationRemarks: So much to do that there is not enough room to list, we were there 4 days and came away not having seen everything we had wanted to. A great city.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Great location for a night out. Walked to comedy club and and North Beach restaurants. Hotel itself was beautiful. Awesome room and staff!

review.title: Beware how you book your room ...
review.reviewText: We booked for a wheelchair-accessible room with walk-in shower and two double beds. Ended up with a standard room with one bed and bathroom with tub. Fortunately, my 93 year-old mother can still walk short distances, so we were able to deal with the shower situation; but a completely wheelchair-bound person would have been out of luck. The room itself was clean and well appointed. We are giving the desk staff just an "OK" rating because they did not seem at all concerned that our reservation was incorrect. The miscommunication was attributed to Expedia. A little more apologetic approach would have lessened our disappointment--they were aloof and what you might call "stuffy." We don't travel frequently and this weekend was a big deal because we were attending a family member's wedding. The hotel itself is beautiful. The air conditioning in the room was a bit chilly--even after adjustment--but not so bad that we would downgrade the overall experience.

review.title: One of the most beautiful hotels!
review.reviewText: The hotel is incredible. Staff were so helpful and even offered to charge our phones for us after we admitted to forgetting our chargers! The room was large considering what you usually get in SF. The only down side was that our room faced California so the noise outside could be heard in the room. The windows don't block much. That, however, was not even close to being enough to downgrade my evaluation. The bathroom was spotless with high ceilings and a big deep soaking tub. Just an incredible experience!
review.negativeRemarks: The windows. We could hear people on the street below and the cable cars

review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean and in a nice area of the city. Our family of 4 (with two teenagers) felt cramped the first night in a regular room with double beds. However, the hotel staff was great at getting us in a new room that better met our needs for the rest of our stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Great service, great location, great rooms with a lot of space for San Francisco. Walking distance to China town, Ferry building, Union square, Market streat,... Just for your information, parking is valet only for the hotel and is paid separately.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Amazing! Gorgeous hotel, with A1 service.
review.reviewText: The fod was amazing. The beds were so comfortable in the huge rooms. Will definitely visit again as soon ax possible.

review.title: Loved the Omni
review.reviewText:
I usually stay at the Westin while in SF, but this experience will make me always look for rooms at the Omni!
The staff is friendly and efficient, the beds were REALLY comfortable, great showers, super clean rooms, free coffee in the bar lobby in the mornings.
review.negativeRemarks: Come on, Omni. Don't charge for the wifi. If Super 8 can have free internet, so can you.
review.locationRemarks: Right on California in the heart of the financial district. Close walk to lots of restaurants, the museum district, etc.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was pleasant in every way. The staff was always welcoming, friendly and went above and beyond anything that we could have expected. They made our stay feel like home away from home. My husband and I were treated to a complimentary bottle of champagne for our anniversary. I can't say enough good about this hotel and the service provided.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the cleanliness, the lobby decor - the general feeling of being welcomed and remembered.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and within walking distance to many of San Francisco's attractions. The only driving we did was to Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Quiet, high-end hotel
review.reviewText: The Omni is a bit off the tourist path which made it a peaceful and quiet reprieve from sightseeing.  It is centrally located and along a trolley route which makes it pretty easy to get around the city.  Trolley bells were really the only noise we heard at night and it was quite peaceful.  Just be prepared that everything around the hotel closes early so you'll have to travel a bit to get food or entertainment.  Surprisingly, hotel was kid-friendly.  I took my 5 year old daughter and she was greeted with a kids travel backpack with goodies at the hotel.  We also received milk and cookies every night!  My one complaint (more Expedia's fault than the Omni's) is that Expedia described this hotel as having a pool.  It does not.  That was a big disappointment for my daughter.  But to the hotel's credit, they called around to find a hotel which would sell us a day pass to their pool and we were able to go swimming.

review.title: Great hotel for the Bay to Breakers.
review.reviewText: Great place and great staff. The staff was great at suggesting places to eat, things to see and do.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is central and the staff is very helpful in suggesting things to see and do in the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe offer free WiFi in the rooms?
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect because it's close to the starting line for the B2B.

review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly service. Parking was too pricey

review.title: Great luxury hotel in heart of SF
review.reviewText: Perfectly located, great amenities and excellent customer service. Definitely a "surprise and delight" customer experience during my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Food excellent. Front desk, room service, bell staff, and valet service all outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: Some dust bunnies behind the night stands when I plugged in my medical device, otherwise room extremely clean and functional. Very nice standard room
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in financial district. Very important to me as I was able to walk to first business meeting in morning.

review.title: Champaign greeting!
review.reviewText: Such a polite and courteous staff. We were welcomed by a glass of champagne and they had morning Starbucks coffee. Valet gave us precise directions as we headed out of town. Would certainly stay again.
Great location & staff. We could tell that the staff took personal pride in the hotel. The kids loved finding milk & cookies each night!

review.title: Class Act in the SF Financial District
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable stay. Pro staff even while we were letting our "inner hippie" out for this trip. Never lacked for anything. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful staff. Great location. Cushy rooms.

review.title: class hotel because of its location
review.reviewText: staff great location perfect.a bit noisy at night may need double glazing trams start early.

review.title: Close to everything in S.F.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Celebrated an anniversary, made it memorable.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, friendly front of house staff. Room was a little bit gloomy but comfortable and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a rowing machine to the gym. Wifi is kind of free, I joined their loyalty plan but still got charged for wifi.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location! Marc from concierge is very helpful.

review.title: Good hotel very pleased
review.reviewText: The whole experience of the start of my holiday in California was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting in bob' restaurant, it was terrible so dark.
review.locationRemarks: The location was very good, easy walking distance for most things.

review.title: Great downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel to be a tourist. Very helpful staff. Good service
review.locationRemarks: Near china town and embargo dear. Good dining

review.title: Excellent Experience in the heart of the City
review.reviewText: It was our first stay at an Omni hotel and we were so impressed by the friendly, helpful, and caring staff from our arrival. Everyone went above and beyond and exuded genuine concern that we were taken care of. The room was cozy and relaxing and we will definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The service, friendliness, location, and comfort.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Embarcadero, Union Square, Many restaurants, Chinatown and entertainment venues.

review.title: Welcoming All Around!!
review.reviewText: Great friendly staff and smiling faces everywhere! Bobs steakhouse is excellent, rooms are spacious and comfy. Front desk and everyone very welcoming and helpful. Nice to come back to at the end of the day! Will stay again!

review.title: GREAT HOTEL CLOSE FOR EVERY TASTE.
review.reviewText: IT WAS WALKING DISTANCE TO ,SHOPPING,FOOD,PIER 39,AND ANY TYPE OF SIGHT SEEING THAT YOU COULD THINK OF.
review.positiveRemarks: STAFF,BAR RESTAURANT,CLOSE TO MANY AMMENITIES,COMFORTABLE AND CLEAN ROOMS.
review.locationRemarks: SEE ABOVE

review.title: Nice area and close to many places of interest.
review.reviewText: Staff was very kind and helpful. Gave us great ideas of places to visit. Hotel was very nice.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to almost every place. The only place we did not walk was to the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Daughter's first trip to SF
review.reviewText: Simply perfection in every aspect. Safe. The highest level of service I have ever experienced in SF. Convenient to everything downtown. Only drawback was we could not have stayed longer. If heaven exists, it must be like a stay at The Omni. Thank you for the glimpse!

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Everyone was super friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the hotel

review.title: Centrally Located
review.reviewText: The Omni is right on the cable car route up and down California Street. Great concierge will help with choosing restaurants and attractions fitting guest preferences and will give directions and options for getting there. Champagne on Friday and Saturday nights.

review.title: Favorite SF Hotel
review.reviewText: We celebrated an Anniversary and loved the thoughtful Champagne and Strawberries, along with lovely card.
review.positiveRemarks: I have stayed at The Omni SF many times. It is my favorite. Great location and warm and welcoming staff.
review.negativeRemarks: This year, I stayed in a Suite which had fabulous lighting. Some of the Deluxe Rooms do not - and the Bathrooms Lighting could be brighter in those R
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT!!!

review.title: Great hotel in heart of downtown
review.reviewText: Very conveniently located. We walked to dinner on Green Street. Very friendly and accommodating staff.

review.title: Customer Service was Phenomenal!!
review.reviewText:
I cannot say enough about the excellent staff at the Omni San Francisco! Our stay was extremely comfortable, the hotel was lovely, great location, but the staff was exceptionally wonderful, accommodating and helpful!!
I will definitely stay there again!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: room is littile bit small,and not very bright during the day time.
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to union square and the habour

review.title: Average downtown hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights in 2 rooms. Can't figure out why this hotel is so highly rated. Average room size, average lobby, average service, $30 parking, $15 internet, $7 bottles of water. Nothing exceptional.

review.title: Best hotel staff!!
review.reviewText: I have never stayed at an OMNI hotel before; they have the best staff working right at this location! It was my first visit to San Francisco and they made me feel right at home! I am already planning my trip back to San Fran & am staying at this hotel without a second thought! When I got home back from my trip; I included the hotel's staff in my exciting stories I had to share!

review.title: Very nice hotel in the heart of FiDi
review.reviewText:
We had a nice and uneventful trip to the Omni SF. The room was comfortable and well appointed. This hotel is on par with any of the other luxury brands.

The valet had some issues. Make sure they leave you with the stub of your valet ticket - our car was lost for some period of time. They really wanted it to be my fault as I didn't have the ticket... They found it though.
review.locationRemarks: It's in FiDi and walking distance to just about everything.

review.title: glen ellen
review.reviewText: excellent location, great staff, beautiful spot. Lighting in room insufficient. Decor weird (a painting on a mirror?), and the combo heating/AC unit very loud. Very delicious home made cookies and breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: lighting in room, decor in room, noisiness of heater

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: While the service was excellent, the hotel is a bit dated. Loud rooms, and a dinosaur aged heating/air system. Elevators feel like they need some work.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Good experience with the old tradition feel but with elegance
Only complaint was the staff should leave their coffee out alittle longer people do sleep in till 9am
Otherwise good value when it is discounted rate not worth full price but then very few are worth 500-600 a night unless in paradise

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Centrally located. Clean surrounding areas. Hotel staff is courteous and helpful. Hotel nicely decorated. Bob Steak Restaurant inside hotel is excellent, great bar. Rooms are clean and spacious. .bed is soft and comfortable. Overall We had a great experience at Omni hotel and we highly recommend it.

review.title: Wonderful Staff
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Omni while in San Francisco for my Uncle's funeral. This hotel made a tough time a little easier. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. We were always greeted with the door open and a smile, and we always left with the same. Upon check in the man at the desk asked what brought us to town. We told him it was for a funeral and he was so compassionate. A little while later a complimentary tray of appetizers and bottled water arrived at our room with a Sympathy card hand written out by about 50 staff members sharing their condolences. So sweet.
The room was spotless and housekeeping was there as soon as we left to make the beds and straighten up.
The restaurant downstairs, Bob's, was great as well. Food delicious and wait staff pleasant.
The gym was also spotless and hosted complimentary flavored water, earphones and newspapers.
If I had one tiny thing to complain about it would only be that the water pressure in the shower was not the best but everything else was so good it didn't bother me.
I would recommend anyone going to visit San Francisco stay at the Omni Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the shower
review.locationRemarks: Shopping district, Fisherman's Wharf, Ferry Building, China Town

review.title: Close to cable car line, good location
review.reviewText: The Omni has a wonderful lobby, but the rooms were ok at best. Average size, no view whatsoever, and small bathtub. I know you have to take everything in San Francisco with a grain of salt, but the room was on the 16th floor and still only overlooked an abandoned office 50 feet away. for $200 per night, it felt we could have done better.
review.negativeRemarks: prices. it cost $75 for three glasses of wine and a cheese plate at the hotel bar.

review.title: Omni Hotel
review.reviewText: 2nd time already in OMNI - SF. Very good hotel, excellent location!

review.title: Great location on cable car route
review.reviewText:
When we checked in the girl on reception was very helpful & informative. She even signed us up for the Select Guest programme. This had lots of benefits including free wifi in our room.
The room itself overlooked the street & was on the 6th floor. The only slight niggle was the street noise in the morning. Not bad enough to bother us too much & much less over the weekend. Being in the financial district all the offices were closed.
Our bed was large & comfortable & had coffee making facilities.
We didn't eat in the hotel as it was quite expensive & there was lots of choice within walking distance. Plus the cable car stopped outside the door & we went to Fishermans wharf & Chinatown .
All the staff including the doormen were cheerful & pleasant. They even provided umbrellas for the few wet days we had during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Friendly staff. Nice relaxed atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Just keep doing what they are doing.
review.locationRemarks: In Financial District. Near Chinatown . Cable car stop outside door. Restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Weekend getaway in SF
review.reviewText: We love the Omni in SF. The staff is gracious and it is close to our favorite resturants.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Great staff. Clean room. Great location. Helpful valet.

review.title: High Class Hotel, Very Dirty.
review.reviewText: Every time we change to another room, its more dirty. They do try their best to make up for it.
review.positiveRemarks: None at all, maybe good location but not for the things I'm there for.
review.locationRemarks: Bus ride, explore China Town. Walk the piers.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
This is a gorgeous hotel. Has good attention to detail and service is attentive.

Use of stone glass wood and steel give the room a solid and oppulant feel

review.title: Great hotel, excellent service
review.reviewText: This was a great find. The staff from the doorman, to reception, to housekeeping were all very courteous and responsive. It was a pleasure to stay here

review.title: Three nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel, the staff were very professional and helpful. The hot apple cider in foyer on arrival was appreciated. The beds were extremely comfortable and there was an excellent gym.
review.positiveRemarks: Gym, comfortable beds and grand decor
review.locationRemarks: We used public transport from airport to hotel. It was just a short walk to Chinatown

review.title: Beyond Excellent
review.reviewText: Incredible experience at the SF Omni. We arrived at 5:30pm and had to be at the venue we were performing at by 6:15pm. Hotel staff met us with complimentary champagne at check in and helped us get our luggage up to the room quickly. After washing up & changing, the staff helped load our instruments and music equipment into a Cadillac SUV Limo driven by hotel staff and essentially chauffered us to our show and got us there right on time. Rock star treatment. Also, we were driving a car hauling a uhaul trailer, which they valet parked for us for free. After returning from our show late at night, the concierge recommended a great restaurant within walking distance and the food was 5 star quality. Check out was easy with complimentary Starbucks coffee and they brought our car and trailer around for us, and provided us directions to the airport. The staff was very helpful, pleasant and friendly. The hotel and rooms are definitely in the 5 star category. I've stayed in a lot of hotels, including luxury hotels around the world, and this hotel & staff were truly one of the best in the world. A nice little slice of heaven right in the heart of San Francisco conveniently located for all business or tourist activities.

review.title: Big Weekend in the Financial District
review.reviewText:
Good deal on a lovely hotel, right in the heart of SF. Great front desk man, Michael (?) made my weekend stay with my son for his 12th birthday extra fun... Michael provide maps, commentary, suggestions, and encouragement that make a good stay great.

We had room service (pizza!) and everything about the hotel and room was first class and perfect. Great beds and linens, comfy room, big bathroom with lots of courtesy items (my son had a field day with the little containers of stuff) and generally just a lovely experience.

Only annoyance was parking, but hey, it's the heart of San Francisco. St. Mary's garage a 1/2 block away is open 24 hours, a bit less $ than valet, and served just fine, once we figured out how to get to it on the one-way streets.

Great location, cable cars out front, walking distance to many attractions (Chinatown, Cable Car museum, waterfront...) and a first class hotel. Thanks Omni and Michael for adding a great touch to our weekend.

review.title: Everything I expected
review.reviewText: Very nice, classic hotel. Deserves the praise it gets on TA, which is the reason I booked. If free wifi is important to you, sign up to Omni's Select Guest programme and you will get wifi, coffee delivered to room, etc. No criticisms at all.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText:
We had a terrific experience at the Omni from the moment we arrived! All staff we encountered provided excellent service and went the extra mile to make sure we had a great stay. The room was very clean and spacious, and the bathroom was really nice too.

Our favorite amenity was the complimentary morning beverage service each day, which we received by signing up for their loyalty program. We also received wifi, bottled water upon arrival, shoe shine and pressing service. We called ahead the night before our arrival and they signed us up then, and were able to assign us a very nice room as well!

The hotel is two blocks from the Montgomery St BART/Muni station so we took the train from the airport and used it a few other times during our trip. We didn't get a chance to take the cable car but there is a stop on California St right in front of the property.

My wife and I both work in the hotel industry so we came with high expectations and were very impressed!

review.title: Great stay, great location
review.reviewText:
We loved staying at the Omni during New Year's. We planned on staying 3 nights but extended to 5 nights as we were unable to fly home due to snow. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Even when we had checked out and then found out or flight was canceled, they immediately found us a new room. The staff is cheerful and eager to please.

The lobby and rooms are inviting but the best thing about this hotel is the location.

Because it's in the financial district, it is quiet after business hours. It is a short walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Market St., The Embarcadero, The Transamerica Bldg, The Fairmount and Top of the Mark are just a few blocks up a (Large) hill. There is a cable car stop on the corner and 1 block away are buses that run through every part of the city. We hope to be back and stay there again next year.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are a generous size with a large and lovely bathroom. The bedding is excellent quality and we slept soundly.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV didn't seem to be HDTV. The picture wasn't very clear. I am not sure if that was the television's fault or the connection?
review.locationRemarks: It is a short walk to Chinatown, Little Italy, Market St., The Embarcadero, The Transamerica Bldg, The Fairmount and Top of the Mark, lots to see near

review.positiveRemarks: reasonably nice hotel in financial district - close/convenient location to shopping, sightseeing, restaurants etc. comfortable but predictable rooms
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant - Bob's steak house - was horrible. poor service, bad overpriced food, limited menu, a la carte for everything but slabs of meat

review.title: NICE HOTEL AND GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: FRONT DESK CHARGE ME FOR A FREE WI-FI NO FEAR!!!! EVERYTHING ELSE IT WAS GREAT, NICE PEAPLE AT THE ENTRANCE!!!
review.positiveRemarks: I LIKE EVERYTHING BUT WHEN I MADE THE RESERVATION THE WI-FI WAS INCLUDE AND WHEN I CHECK OUT I WAS CHARGE FOR THE WI-FI NOT HAPPY
review.negativeRemarks: NOT CHARGE FOR THE WI-FI EVEN WHEN THEY ARE SAYING FREE WI-FI
review.locationRemarks: GRAET LOCATION

review.title: Great location, room and staff!
review.reviewText: This was everything that I needed in a hotel. And, the concierge was especially helpful.

review.title: Noisy air conditioner.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nicely located and the staff were very nice. The room was a bit small, but clean. The A/C was very noisy. The noise it makes every time it turns on kept me awake most of the night. The shower has no water pressure.

review.title: Convenient location, comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText:
This was my second stay at the Omni and it was a much better experience than my first stay. Check-in staff was friendly and welcoming. Getting a taxi was quick and easy. The pressure of the water from the shower head was fantastic (on the stronger side) and the beds/pillows were comfortable.

On a side note, I am a breastfeeding mom spending the night away from my son. Since I had to pump every few hours, I recommend bringing a cooler to store the breastmilk, instead of using the in-room fridge. The in-room fridge wasn't cool enough to safely store the milk.

review.title: Great Location, close by to China Town..
Very nice hotel in central location
review.reviewText: We were four of us in one room so it was a bit crowded and the rooms were very compact and being strict vegetarian there was very limited choice for breakfast. Overall had a great time @ Omni hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly and helping staff. excellent location. Only negative part was breakfast. Not much choice there. Otherwise it was all good.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, very close to shopping area. Also the famous TRAM line is just outside.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We have a good trip, and we are satisfied in this hotel. Good view point, we can see very nice view. It closes to China town, and it is convenient for transportation.

review.title: short but good stay
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a night before traveling to LA. The hotel was great. The location was great. The bar closed early on Friday night which wasnt great since I was coming in from a late flight but we just took advantage of the minibar in the room. The we took the hotel car to the airport instead of a cab and it was a nice ride but the car did have the slight odor of vomit but you could tell they had cleaned up bc the car itself was very clean and nice. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was nice and I liked the large bathroom.

review.title: Always good
review.negativeRemarks: Tub had a mark so did not feel comfortable taking a bath.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Walk to the Farmers Market at Pier One. its fun!

review.title: Great service, great deal through expedia
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and professional. The king size bed was very comfortable. Great location with the trolly stopping right outside the front doors.
review.negativeRemarks: 17th floor (top floor) windows are tiny and take away any possible good views. I was pleased with everything else.

review.title: Very nice hotel, w/in walking distance of Union Sq
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Well located.

review.title: Downtown
review.reviewText: everything is good except parking fee

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: The Omni is as promised by the hotel and also the reviews. It is beautiful, well kept and the staff is impeccably trained.

review.title: The best front desk staff ever!
review.reviewText: Thank you very much for accommodating our family. We appreciate your kind assistance.
review.positiveRemarks: The people. All employees were very kind, friendly.
review.locationRemarks: China town rocks!

review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend getaway. We thought the location was really convenient because we could walk or take public transportation to nearly anywhere in the city and we didn't have to deal with the crowds that are always down by the wharf. The hotel itself was very nice and comfortable. Our only complaint was the noise level. Our room was on the 6th floor and we could hear a lot of traffic noise, including the cable cars that go right by the hotel. In addition, we could hear everything that went on in the hall. With that being said, we would still stay here again. The staff was super welcoming and helped us find a great place to eat on Christmas day.

review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location; clean room and bath; impressive lobby and facilities
review.locationRemarks: Ferry building is within 10-minute walking distance. Many restaurants and wine bars in vicinity. Within easy reach by tram of Fisherman's warf.

review.title: Very comfortable room. Good size. Great bed

review.reviewText: Great, warm, and comfortable stay. Staff are very friendly. Bed is very comfortable. Very clean. Very nice location !!

review.title: Very nice hotel in the financial district
review.reviewText: This is a top of the line hotel right down town. Room are large, clean, and the hotel has great service. Parking however is very expensive. They charge $50 a day Sunday-Thursday and $38 Friday and Saturday. Forget that and go park at the Portsmouth Square Plaza Garage or several of the other parking garages around the area for about $30 a day.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a top of the line hotel right down town. Room are large, clean, and the hotel has great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking however is very expensive. They charge $50 a day Sunday-Thursday and $38 Friday and Saturday.
review.locationRemarks: A lot of places within walking distance

review.title: Ok for business, not great for vacation
review.reviewText: The two double bed room was small. Expected there to be more room to relax but there are just the bare necessities. They also have a strange rule of only allowing 4 people in the room at one time, even if the extra people are only entering for a couple hours. Lastly, valet park was not efficient at all. It took them 20-30 minutes to get our car when they told us it would like 5-10.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good.

review.title: Really nice hotel, close to the Embarcadero
review.reviewText: We stayed on New Years Eve. We had a great time and were able to walk to the firework show and back.

review.title: Great Value, Nice Staff
review.reviewText: Exceptionally nice and helpful staff. Real people -- with manners! Very clean rooms and really comfortable bed! Great value for the location and quality. Had a very nice time there -- for a second time ! (Stayed there a few years ago with the same experience). We'll go back again.
review.locationRemarks: within walking distance of union square --- taxi ride to theater district. Had a great evening out at Biscuits and Blues.

review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. We intend on coming back.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText:
All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was of average size and was clean. We were not provided turn down service on the first night, but we got it on the second.

We stayed at this hotel for our anniversary a few years ago. On that trip, we were treated to an amenity of chocolate covered strawberries and a heart made of rose petals on the bed. This time, our 34th anniversary, there was no acknowledgement of the occasion. We were upgraded to a high floor and I think there were extras available, but no one told us what was included. We found out accidentally that WIFI was free on that floor. Maybe we were upgraded because it was our anniversary -- we don't know.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't care for the cost of the extras: parking - $52 a night, WIFI - $14.95, bottled water in the room - $7.95, spray starch in the closet - $2.99
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Chinatown. On the cable car route.

review.title: Sweet staff made us feel like royalty.
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for 3 days and the hotel staff were above and beyond nice. From the valet to the housekeeper... You really pay for what you get. We enjoyed our trip. The $52 parking is steep but it is the going rate for staying in the city.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: From the first step that I took into the lobby, I noticed that the stay was gana be great. The hotel service was good, staff is very friendly and helpful, and the hotel room was comfortable. Overall, it believe I made a great choice when I booked my nights at the omni is San Fransisco. Highly recommended to those looking for a good nights rest in the city.

review.title: Feels special, upscale, and homey all at once
review.reviewText: It was truly fabulous, all the little touches were really nice and we always looked forward to coming back to the hotel! Beautiful lobby, friendly, welcoming staff, spacious rooms, cookies at bedtime, this place was amazing. Kids are made to feel extremely welcome without losing the upscale feel. At Christmas, they had a large mailbox titled "mail letters to santa here" with a bunch of santa letter templates and envelopes close by. Super sweet.
review.negativeRemarks: I thought the restaurant was a little expensive and the breakfast there was only ok. We just chose to eat elsewhere

review.title: Hotel is good,but expensive
review.reviewText: The hotel is very good, have a good location,clean room,and qualitied service. but it's a little expensive with parking USD60 per night USD20 for WIFI.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
Clean, pleasant staff, comfortable stay. Great customized service thru Omni's guest program.
My only complaint remains if you book thru Expedia (or any other travel site) you don't get Omni loyalty rewards for the stay.
I stay at Omni for work regularly, the least Omni could do is reward me for staying at an Omni on a vacation/personal stays as well. Other than that gripe, we loved our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Gaslamp district has lots of places to dine and drink. A very pleasant area of San Diego

review.title: very comfortable
review.reviewText: great hotel but parking too expensive

review.title: Location wonderfull ,easy access, lot off restaura
review.reviewText: Every thing is nice and location ,price is high if I can say ,(why). There is no place for ladies to put there make up stuff ,Bathroom ' s are very small.if you can say 4* or 5* but big issue. Bathroom ,I didn't like it, there is no place you can take a shower but where you put your changing clothes ? Other thing was no issue here,drink all day. Apple cider juice free and nice cookies ,fitness area very nice too.I will recommend but issue is the bathroom ,ya one more issue ,bathroom sliding door "O boy" so hard to open & close,you need to be very strong to use it (yes)
review.negativeRemarks: Sliding bathroom door,(lighter). Ladies hang outfit ,in bathroom area, need more room ,for dressing area
review.locationRemarks: China town access nice bus service, access restaurant ,other all is wonderful prime location I can say.nothing is far from this location .little ItaWh

review.title: 3* only for the staff.
review.reviewText: Although staff were nice and friendly yet they were confused with their info. The front desk told us some misleading info about Parking. The Valet Parking attendance said we cant park at d curb , n other one said we can for a few minutes...which is which? We ask front desk if theres microwave we can use and they said ask the restaurant at the lobby. And so we did, restaurant staff said we can ask front desk and theyll send 1 up to our room. We didnt bother going back again to front desk. Felt like cant trust their answer. Later we called operator from our room re microwave and he initially said he cant but operator called us back and said theyll send 1 up in our room. Oh well at least we got what we needed. Finally at check out front desk said we pay the Valet attendant for valet parking, when we got our car, attendant said hotel will charge it to our credit card! They need to have their info right and not confuse the guest. Maybe its the holiday brain freeze. Otherwise the hotel is gorgeous n classic.

review.title: Perfectly awesome staying for my family
review.reviewText: This hotel is one of the finest one I've ever stayed. Great location for shopping and dining! My family really enjoyed all the staffs' wonderful service and warmhearted attitude. The room was greatly clean and tide.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff's wonderful smile and kind attitude. Perfect location for shipping and dining.

review.title: Holidays in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for location and based on reviews on Expedia. This turned out to be a great property in a wonderful location and the hotel staff were top-notch. This was a an annual holiday vacation with 2 kids and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. Hotel in elegant, charming, comfortable and everyone at the hotel from front desk to housekeeping made us feel important and welcome. Would recommedn this hotal to anyone wanting a great experience in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was great. Hotel was elegant and still very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The wireless inetrnet connection had a few bugs, but we called tech support and he was able to help us and make us feel like he cared about resolving
review.locationRemarks: While this is in the financial district it is opn a cable car line, 5 easy blaocks to the tram system, and within easy walking distance to many attrac

review.title: Christmas trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: We traveled to San Francisco just before Christmas to spend a few days with our daughter. The hotel was wonderful and we enjoyed our stay very much. The room was quiet and comfortable and the staff professional and knowledgeable. The view from the room was nice too and we could see the bay over the rooftops. We had breakfast in the restaurant and the food was good, although pricey, which is typical for San Francisco. We'll definitely stay there again when in town.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a fine older hotel with a great ambiance.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in the business district but there was plenty of small retail shops nearby.

review.title: Excellent hotel with a couple of small problems.
review.reviewText: We greatly enjoyed our four night stay at the Omni and I would have given it 5 stars across the board but for a couple of problems. The biggest problem is the housekeeping staff. They have not been properly trained and so we had daily problems such as used cups not being replaced by clean ones; new plastic liners were not put into the ice bucket; surfaces were not wiped clean of dust; tea bags were not replaced; though we had a quiet sign on our door but the housekeepers talked so much and so loudly in the hallway that I had to get out of bed to ask them to speak more quietly; there was one bathrobe, not two, in the closet, and that one was not clean; etc. The room service staff also needs some training. We ordered breakfast and we didn't get the right silverware. Aside from the housekeeping and room service staff, there were a couple of expenses we felt were excessive. We were charged $13 for a single bag of M&M's taken from the snack cupboard. The in-room movies are $15 per and the water bottles are $7.50. On the positive side, the hotel is beautiful; the rest of the staff - doorman, front desk, etc. - were all terrific in every way; the room was very comfortable, sunny and pleasingly furnished, and the location of the hotel is perfect for walking to countless restaurants, museums, and other city adventures. Overall we would definitely return and would recommend the Omni to our friends, because the experience created good memories despite a few minor shortcomings.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, close to Union Square, Chinatown, Ferry landing for Alcatraz, and the financial district. Staff was excellent, professional, and helpful! Would absolutely stay there again.

review.title: Great central downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with great service. We were very pleased with our stay. From the time we drove up until we left the staff were outstanding. Nice rooms and an excellent location to get around downtown, Chinatown and North Beach by foot. Cable cars right out front.

review.title: They do everything right.
review.reviewText: Quiet, very comfortable room, very pleasant staff, everything was perfect.

review.title: Nice hotel, average higher end business hotel.
review.reviewText: Food and bar are second rate. Avoid eating there especially considering how many great options are nearby. Cafe la presse being a great one for breakfast.

review.title: Wonderful accommodations and accommodating staff
review.reviewText: Our stay here was more than memorable. The hotel is first rate, as is the entire staff. All very helpful and friendly to obvious out of towners. They were willing to take the time to help us navigate this beautiful city to our fullest advantage. I got what I feel was a great rate, too, through Expedia. Stay here. You won't be sorry.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambience, the location, but mostly the staff.
review.locationRemarks: We were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown and the main downtown area. A cable car line runs right outside the hotel.

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: We were in SFO for the weekend after landing from Australia. Waltzed in wearing clothes that had been slept in, bedraggled and tired at 11am to the Omni hotel. The lobby is so beautiful and the staff so welcoming that we did not for a moment remember the state that we arrived in - we were just in awe (to put in a reference here we paid less than friends did for their room at the Hilton on Kearny and their experience was only a fraction as good as ours). The room was ready early for us, just like we asked, and are they ever gorgeous rooms. Definitely sign up to their club membership as you get free Wi-Fi, coffees delivered in the morning at your choice of time, welcome waters, turn down service (and the list goes on). I was looking for something slightly out of union square area to avoid Christmas traffic, the area was mostly quiet after hours so you could get a reasonable sleep, beds were comfortable, choice of pillows. Bathrooms were incredible with marble. Oh, and bathrobes in the closet. Hairdryer, absolutely everything you could want! Only a few blocks out of main tourist area, definitely worth the stay. Plus, hot apple cider and gingerbread men in the lobby at night.
review.locationRemarks: Financial District, union square is close, near BART line and Ferry Building.

review.title: Great hotel, central location
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel, no complaints whatsoever.

review.title: Nice Hotel! All Staff attentive to your needs.
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience. Can't say enough about the staff and Management! The hot cider and gingerbread cookies were just the right touch. I could not find anything I did not like. The hotel and Staff are trained in old school customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Location was spot on for all Dining and Shopping

review.positiveRemarks: Great Customer Service in all departments. Tara at front desk very helpful, and loved Darrel the Doorman!

review.title: Downtown financial area. Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was just over night but everyone was friendly. Easy check in and checkout as well
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to an event we were attending

review.reviewText: The doormen were the best, so knowledgeable!! Great location!! Reservations so easy.
review.locationRemarks: Union square was the BEST shopping!!

review.title: A little too far from Union Square
review.reviewText:
Room was smaller than we expected. Had no view.

We arrived late so slept in and didn't leave the room next day till close to 2 pm. When we came back at 6 pm our room hadn't been made up. I called to request service and they said I'd had the privacy sign out till 5 pm. I told them that wasn't true, that I'd removed it at 2 pm when we left. They came to make up the room but someone wasn't telling the truth about the timing.

review.title: EXCELLENT Hotel!!
review.reviewText:
A genuinely lovely hotel...staff were top-notch. The fitness center is the absolute BEST of any place I have stayed and that includes several 5-star properties. The concierge and front desk staff did everything they could to ensure our stay in San Francisco was great!

Room specifics....the bathroom was EXCELLENT, heat lamp, high ceilings, spacious, etc.,
The bed/pillows were as comfortable as mine at home...which is a high compliment, indeed!

Book this hotel....you will be VERY happy!
review.negativeRemarks: TV could be a little larger but who goes on vacation to watch TV!?!
review.locationRemarks: Extremely convenient...right on the cable car route. Can walk to Chinatown, Ferry Building, Embarcadero, etc. CVS is only a block away.

review.title: Friendly Staff, clean room
review.reviewText:
My stay in Omni hotel was overall great.
Room was very clean and staffs were very friendly and helpful.
It would've been better if hotel offers variety of amenities and free Wi-fi.
review.locationRemarks: Omni hotel is in the center of SF downtown and pretty much close to all attractions nearby. China town is a block away as well as market st.

review.title: Omni - The lobby staff friendly
review.reviewText:
The lobby staff greeted us by name for the next four days. It really made us feel important
and valued. The room and service was outstanding..... everything that you think an OMNI would be.
review.locationRemarks: It is San Franscisco, with wonderful bus system.... everything is near by !

review.positiveRemarks: Great location, great service--expensive but worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: 14.95 for wifi access is pretty steep
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, business district, embarcadero, lots of Irish bars and Tadich Grill within easy walking distance. trolly stops outside.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great, very friendly and exceptionally helpful when we asked for things to see and places to eat. Being located right on the cable car track is perfect to get around. Awesome experience all around.
review.locationRemarks: Right on the cable car line. Pier 1 (Ferry Terminal) walking distance. Union Square walking distance. Fisherman's Wharf short Cable Car ride away.

review.title: Good hotel close to Union Square and tram stops.
review.reviewText: We were a group of nine with four children aged 6-12. Staff were fantastic and went out of their way to forward on personal belongings inadvertantly left in room. Food at Bob's Bar up to usual American expectations in regards to quality and size of meal. Rooms clean and big enough. All in all a great hotel to use as a base to explore attractions like Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf within walking distance.

review.title: Clean and decent hotel with staff very helpful and
review.reviewText:
Brilliant location within easy walking distances to Financial District, Market Street Station for ferry catcing and trams to Fisherman,warf, cinemas, malls, market Street, China town and little bit more walk if you can to Cal train station to
P.alo Alto, San Jose etc with reasonable train fares and good services
San Francisco beautiful city to walk, good and many nearby places to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to find from 4 directions. We did not have breakfast in hotel being vegetarian but gave us tea coffee honey free daily in room
review.negativeRemarks: Difficult to find any faults. everything was good
review.locationRemarks: See my review above

review.title: Great hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Although its in the financial district without much for tourists in immediate surroundings, Its still located central to everything I wanted to do, so it worked out. And The Omni itself and its staff were excellent.

review.title: Dissapointed
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at the OMNI in Charleston SC....oh so much cleaner. Room more up to date, never wiped the desk or tv table.
My daughter asked for a small tea, well, she received hot water, enough for 2-3 cups...one tea bag. So I called, asked for 2 more tea bags, and was charged 12.00 for the tea, not to mention 18% gratuity...plus room charge!
Never again.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location to be able to walk
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the Omni Hotel in San Francisco to anyone. The staff was very accommodating, the location was terrific for walking around the city, and the rooms were clean and nicely appointed.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel is in Financial District within 10 minute walk to Chinatown and 15 minutes to Union Square. We arrived early from Las Vegas and were upgraded so we could settle into a room immediately, nice touch and greatly appreciated. Hotel is well maintained and everything was squeeky clean. Staff were so helpful with maps and directions. Hop on Hop off bus convenient so FIsherman's Wharf and other attractions were easily accessible without need for Taxis.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining Room wait staff expect their 20% tips but could try to be more friendly and engaging

review.title: Top of the line staff and room! Costs? OUCH!
review.reviewText:
Thank goodness this was a business trip and they have to foot the bill. I ordered a rib-eye steak which was done to perfection but for the price and a drive to Costco I could have fed a family of five.

Of course the staff was top notch, exceptionally polite and accommodating. The iron worked like new and more importantly, the ironing board actually had a decent cover.

Minor issues: The fabric chair looked like it was time to clean and the room temp was comfortable sitting at the desk but I should have turned it down a notch as the beds were really warm. The W has better toiletries.
review.positiveRemarks: Was I the only person on this floor? Didn't hear a thing from the hallway or next room and my room was directly in front of the elevators.
review.negativeRemarks: Tell the city to quiet down, this ain't New York.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect business location. If I won the lottery, I would stay here as a tourist. Market Street, BART, cable car, the Wharf: all just minutes away.

review.title: Nice downtown SF hotel near financial district.
review.reviewText: Several family members were staying here, as part of a wedding weekend. Everyone was very happy with the accommodations and the service.

review.title: Handy for all local amenities
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Omni for one night after flying to San Francisco as part of a 12 day holiday in Las Vegas in order to take in Alcatraz prison. Well placed for sightseeing, especially Fishermans Wharf and Chinatown. Also well placed for local diners, restaurants and shops. One word of warning though: The area around the hotel is very hilly and is a little difficult to get around on foot if you are not fully sound in wind and limb. There are regular trams however to take you up and down the steep hills (as seen on TV) and they are an experience in themselves. The local people are friendly and helpful if you want to know any directions or which trams to catch and the local transport service BART (Bay Area Rapid Transport) has several stations which are easy to travel to based on the information given on the maps provided at all stations. You will have to buy a ticket before you can board the train but this is a simple enough process at the machines which give locations of all stations and prices.
review.positiveRemarks: Exceptionally clean with very helpful staff. Rooms very comfortable. Facilities include a chop house and bar. All rooms served by lift.
review.locationRemarks: As above. Handy for all places of interest e g Chinatown/Fishermans Wharf but not recommended for persons who have difficulty walking up steep hills .

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: A very comfortable, clean hotel with very friendly staff.

review.title: Nice hotel with cable car stop in front
review.reviewText: Everything was great from the moment we walked in the door until we left.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants nearby

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff
review.reviewText:
I was very impressed by the customer service, speedy response to my needs, and even the anticipation of my needs by Omni Hotel staff. They were incredibly attentive and helpful. The moment a question was asked, they had an answer. My comfort mattered to them.

The amenities were excellent. The cleanliness of my room, the gym, and the other common areas was exceptional. The food--delicious!! I highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

review.title: Nice SF Hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Facilities a bit old, but nicely maintained.

review.title: First Visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We stayed at The Omni Hotel following a visit to the beautiful and fascinating National Parks of Yellowstone and Grand Teton.
Had a very relaxing and comfortable stay - many thanks to all the staff. Great location too.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly staff, wonderful bathrooms and good restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Cycled over The Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito which is very pretty. Enjoyed looking around The Ferry Building and going on Cable Car.

review.title: Great hub for a tourist, stayed for our honeymoon
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. I can be a nervous traveler so I read a lot of reviews and booked the Omni based on that. It was worth it. The hotel staff was great. Front desk gave us directions/suggestions when we asked and were very sweet and wonderful about it. The door guys were great getting taxis, rooms were always clean. They sent us up a bottle of champagne when they found out it was our honeymoon. It's in the financial district so a lot of big buildings, not immediate view, but we were on the 15th floor and able to look out past the buildings and see the fog over the bay. It wasn't noisy. We slept like logs. The hotel is beautiful, didn't eat or drink at the attached restaurant/bar but locals said it was a great place for a steak and it always seemed to have people in it. Seemed classy but not stuffy. Comfy bed. Close to Chinatown, North beach/Italian neighborhood, Fisherman's Wharf, Embarcadero. We took the BART to the airport, got off at the Montgomery Street stop and walked a few blocks - very easy. Never felt unsafe in this area. We stayed Mon-Fri so I never saw the neighborhood on the weekend but I read reviews that the immediate area "shuts down" due to being in financial district?
