Can't comment on that but I can't imagine that would be a huge problem because you probably wouldn't spend a whole lot of time in that area anyway if you were sight seeing etc.

review.title: Great hotel, great staff
review.reviewText: We stayed here for my boyfriends 31st birthday. They brought us complimentary champagne and a little note for his birthday which I thoguht was very thoughtful. The hotel was very nice and unique and the staff was great. Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, but not many restraunt choices nearby.

review.title: Very enjoyable!
review.reviewText:
The front desk and all hotel staff that we met seems to be very friendly, professional, and accommodating.
The room was spotlessly clean. Very nice bed, and I also enjoyed their shower. Their toiletries are wonderful (especially hand lotion)
The decor is elegant. The valet parking is expensive but we parked nearby in public parking garage twice cheaper.
The location is great! It is quiet and close to everything. The tram that goes all of the way up and down, stops right in front of the hotel.
Across the street there is a wonderful french bakery: great for breakfast or lunch.
The only one negative: there were no view (our room was facing just another building).
Overall: a very beautiful, elegant hotel, spotlessly clean rooms, and professional and friendly staff made our stay very enjoyable!

review.title: Weekend away
review.reviewText: It was a very nice stay. Very helpful staff. Will return. Love the Nespresso machine in the room!
review.locationRemarks: It's the financial district. Be aware that most shops and restaurants close on weekend.

review.title: Within walking distance to China Town & Cable Car
review.reviewText: We couldn't have asked for a better location and the accommodations were fantastic. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and well keep. The restaurant offered a great selection of food on the menu. We would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: We could walk to China Town or hop on a cable car to get to Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf. If we wanted a cab, we had one within minutes.

review.title: Outstanding Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was great -- the room, the location and the service. The service was particularly impressive. From the doorman to housekeeping ladies, they were fantastic. One example will suffice. As I was walking through the lobby with a bouquet of flowers, a member of the staff approached me and asked if I'd like a vase for the flowers. I said "yes," and he was at my room within five minutes with a vase. Kudos to the whole staff.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Staff always helpful, courteous and pleasant. Facilities were clean. Food was excellent. Parking a little expensive.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco. Nothing else need to be said.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Rooms were large and very clean! Great location and friendly staff.

review.title: Family Time
review.reviewText: The front desk staff and door man were so helpful and enjoyable
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was awesome, and the housekeeping staff were delightful
review.negativeRemarks: I was unable to find the room service menu. It was tucked neatly away in a drawer
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect for what my family and I were doing. We were within walking distance to the Ferry Building where all our tours went in and put of

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Great experience. Friendly staff. Hotel is in excellent condition. Beautifully designed.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent condition. Excellent service. Beautiful rooms, hallways, lobby and fitness center. Staff was especially friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Great location because it is close to thee port, North Beach and downtown areas.

review.title: Omni nice if a bit stuffy
review.reviewText: The Omni has outstanding services and is spotlessly clean. The staff is outstanding and it's in a great location. The only downside for me was a boring view from the room, and the stuffy decor -- very grandma.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Good location
review.reviewText: Easy to access public transportation. Walking distance to several city attractions

review.title: Excellent experience
review.reviewText: Great centralized location, all parts of the city and sites accessible. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Would highly recommend!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location, staff, accommodations were clean and comfortable. I liked it all!
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants, shopping. Many landmarks within walking distance, and cable cars outside the door!

review.title: Great stay at the Omni!
review.reviewText: Excellent welcome by staff. Efficient check-in. Room was very clean with all the amenities. Bed was very comfortable. A great place to stay.

review.title: A little bit of luxury whilst on a road trip!
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our time at the Omni. Staff could not have been more helpful or pleasant. Great tips for restaurants and tourist buses. Good location and we loved the fact that Cable Car ran past the hotel. Very spacious room and comfortable bed. Would stay here again. Parking very expensive but thats San Francisco for you!

review.title: Great Say in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel in a great location. Easy walk to center of SF and tram stop right outside the hotel to take you to other destinations e.g. Pier 39. Great stay for us and wood recommend it for all types of travelers.

review.title: Great location !!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to Chinatown, cable cars and Market St. The area is very safe. I would definitely stay here again. The staff was very helpful and courteous.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Nice location and experience overall. Close proximity to restaurants, metro and alot of San Francisco attractions

review.title: Great stop downtown luxury hotel
review.reviewText: Had a quick overnight stay at the Omni. The room was beautiful, facilities were warm and inviting. The staff was excellent. Got hooked up with two great restaurants and was really pleased. Loved the location close to Chinatown and also good shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Near Chinatown and shopping. Was only there one day and able to see a lot nearby.

review.title: Great hotel, good central location, very nice room
review.reviewText: The hotel lost a couple of points because we didn't feel the door staff were as attentive as perhaps we had found in other hotels of the same star rating. Just a minor point, really. Everything was really very good.

review.title: excellent location, price and funcionality
review.reviewText: lovely business/tourism hotel, located in a very strategic part of the city so you walk in the city, the rooms are spacious and very comfortable !
review.locationRemarks: union square, financial district, chinatown and ferry building also market street that conects to the rest of the city

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: An exceptionally good hotel. Great location in San Francisco and very attentive staff, especially at the front desk. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Best Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The Omni is the best hotel in SF...period. Staff was exceptionally friendly and professional. They made us feel special and welcome from the moment we arrived. Rooms are well appointed, spotless and comfortable. Juan made excellent dinner recommendations/reservations and got us in at top-rated Zagat spot for local foodies. The entire staff was great...thank-you so much!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff - absolutely the best! Attentive service without being overbearing. Just right
review.negativeRemarks: Gym could use an upgrade - but that's it.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the financial district - take the Urban Safari Alcatraz tour and ask for Mark. Have breakfast at Cafe de la Press.

review.title: Omni stay
review.reviewText: Three days for business. Was close to my office, so met its purpose.

review.title: Over-priced; tries to nickle-and-dime!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very pleasant and well-located. But it's somewhat offense when you're paying so much per night to be charged ANYTHING for bottled water or Internet access, when many hotels that cost a fraction of what the Omni charges provide both for free. It's even worse when that water is $7.50/bottle and the Internet is $15/night (or $20 if you want "fast" speeds of 6MB - which might have been fast 5 years ago, but certainly doesn't qualify as fast in 2013).
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, good location, decent aesthetics
review.negativeRemarks: Stop nickle-and-diming your customers. It's offensive.

review.title: Great Hotel centrally located
review.reviewText: This was my first stay in San Francisco, and I am glad I choose the Omni. It is in the financial district but in walking distance to China Town and other attractions. The staff was great and the room was nicely appointed with a huge bathroom. Please remember even in July the weather is cold it was in the 60's down to the 50's and for this Southern Californian I was cold, so bring warm clothes. I would recommend this hotel and I suggest if you want a tour of the city take a tour on one of the hop on and off buses. Located near the Wharf I bought our tickets through Expedia. In 2 1/2 hours you see everything and you can hop off and back on when another bus comes by. A great way to get a glimpse of this beautiful city.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, great staff and good location.

review.title: The location was perfect.
review.reviewText: We were able to walk most of where we had planned to go. We parked our car and took a couple of cabs for our longer outings. It was a great spot and we would definitely stay there again. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our room was great -- roomy, clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint (which is minor) was that the lighting in the bathroom was glaring. It was difficult to relax in the tub -- the bright lights.
review.locationRemarks: Columbus Avenue was a short walk - City Lights Bookstore was great!. Lots of restaurant options nearby. China Town was just right up the hill.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Location is great as is standard of accommodation.

review.title: Great hotel close to the good stuff
review.reviewText: We stayed for the weekend, and had a fabulous time. The restaurant and bar is great with really good service. The moment the doorman opens the door for you it's a lovely experience. The check in staff are friendly and very helpful. I would definitely go back.
review.negativeRemarks: I really can't think of anything
review.locationRemarks: right in middle of so much....Chinatown, Little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square and so much more

review.title: great hotel...in san francisco
review.reviewText: everything was excellent!..the service was superb!! location the best...had a wonderful time..
review.positiveRemarks: location, cleanliness and most of all service
review.locationRemarks: center of san francisco..walking distance to great restaurants...

review.title: SF Weekend
review.reviewText: The front desk service was superb. All our questions were correctly answered. When needed, all reservations requested were fulfilled. The doormen were quick and friendly. The room was a premium and had all the amenities we needed.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel's location was very convenient relative to the ferry terminal, china town, and union square. Bob's steak & chop house was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The clothes iron was not up to par.
review.locationRemarks: Shoppimg at Union Square and China Town. Ferry to Sausilito/Larkspur. Good food along the Embarcadero.

review.title: Hotel in California Street
review.reviewText: We are a family of three and we very much enjoyed our stay at the Omni Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: We really liked the friendly staff - especially a couple of the helpful doormen.
review.negativeRemarks: The receptionists could be more helpful with general knowledge.
review.locationRemarks: The location is good for us. Close to Union Square, Market Street, the Piers, Chinatown ...

review.title: 1st stay in San fran
review.reviewText: Great location. Quiet comfortable room. Friendly helpful staff

review.title: Cool and quiet stay in active touristic city of SF
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. You can stay quietly and comfortly in this busy and clouded city. You can enjoy many things in out side of hotel, but can take a very relaxed staying when you are inside of this hotel. Clean room, comfortable bed, friendly staffs, kind survice at the restaurant. And convinient public transfortation. Near China town. Wonderful hotel!!

review.title: Great Location/Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and we didn't know where to go. Omni was a wonderful hotel and located near the best touring spots! Visiting Chinatown and North Beach area was awesome :) We rode 1 taxi to Fisherman's Wharf, but then realized that it wasn't that far that we could walk all the other times we went out. Thanks for making our stay so wonderful!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the location the most and the friendy staff

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Helpful and friendly staff at reception. The room was large (particularly for San Francisco) , bright and clean. Located in the financial district so the area is quiet on the weekends but good location for exploring the rest of the city.

review.title: Birthday weekend trip.
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, walkable distance from where we needed to go. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room very clean and comfortable and surprising very quite.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: A very pleasant hotel well situated in San Francisco

review.title: Charming hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We arrived earlier than 3PM check in and our room was ready. My request to have 2 adjoining rooms (for my children) and to be on a high floor due to the noise was met with a professionalism and a smile!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was attentive in every way. The concierge was extremely helpful and recommended the Swans for lunch and how to get to Golden Gate Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom lighting could be softened and ventilation could be added.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very convenient to Chinatown, Little Italy and to the Bart to get to the Oakland Coliseum.

review.title: Great hotel but around noisy streets
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and rooms were very nice. The restaurant and bar were good too albeit expensive ($16 for a vodka seems high). The staff was very friendly. If you looking for a quiet hotel that this is not it. the hotel faces two busy street with traffic going all night. Took getting used too but overall the hotel was good value for the money we spend.
review.locationRemarks: it faces two busy street but in the financial district and not too far from Union Square and other attractions.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, location and staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location with a cable car stop very close by. The hotel staff couldn't have been better and the doorman always went above and beyond. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of anything to improve
review.locationRemarks: Near a cable car, Chinatown and Union square

review.title: Great hotel in the city of SFO
review.reviewText: Had a quick over night stay en route to Napa Valley. Great bar, wonderful staff.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of many things

review.title: Located near all popular attractions.
review.reviewText: Basically, everyone in the staff was friendly. The restaurant in the hotel was convenient and the food was wonderful. My son received cookies and milk each afternoon but I have to say that I looked forward to it everyday as well, since they seemed freshly backed. The room was always kept clean by the staff and it was a very comfortable space to be in when I wished to stay in. The bathroom design was lovely and wish I had that enormous mirror at home.

review.title: Very upscale hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. My second experience in an Omni hotel and will likely try another Omni in the future.

review.title: june 13 flying visit
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful reception providing information and obtaining additional room equipment.
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Great Staff, Great Room
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. From the helpful staff to the clean room. We stood there for 4 days, and it was amazing. We were walking distance from a lot of things. Chinatown is right behind the hotel. The cable cars are near. The Union Plaza is also walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: The paking situation. They offer vallet, but it is pretty pricey. The other parking garages around there are just as expensive though.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: our family stayed this hotel for one night. the hotel is very conveniently located. walking distance to market place and to China town. very comfort hotel. very friendly staff. it would be better if they can provide free WiFi.
review.locationRemarks: close to everything. Bank, market street, shopping, eating and China town.

review.title: Close to Chinatown
review.reviewText: To start, hotel is fairly inconspicuous. I passed it on the first drive down California Street without realizing it. Then there was parking. The idea of paying $52 for overnight parking still bothers me, but then again, all the other hotels were charging similar rates. Fortunately, there were metered parking around the hotel which allowed for free parking overnight. It was located down the street from Chinatown, which worked out for dinnertime. Wi-fi is complimentary if you enroll into their loyalty program, but you need to call down to the front desk with your membership number. This number is found in their welcome e-mail once you enroll. I did not realize this until I checked my account later that night and found that I was being charged for the internet connection. They were nice enough to take this charge off my account once I informed them of my membership number.
review.positiveRemarks: Service was good. On check-in, the gentleman at the desk was proactive, asking and offering suggestions to make sure our trip was memorable.
review.negativeRemarks: Three elevators servicing this hotel. We were on the 13th floor. It got old watching the elevators open our floor packed. Advice: move those you can
review.locationRemarks: R & G lounge was essentially around the corner on Kearney street. Great for dinner, but the wait was extremely painful.

review.title: A jewel in San Fran!
review.reviewText: The Omni is the perfect place to stay for a holiday in San Fran. It is immaculately clean, quiet, centrally located yet away from the crowds and definitely has the most friendly staff in the city! We would stay here again without question.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the quiet rooms, exceptionally friendly staff, cleanliness and overall ambiance.
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district but only a few blocks from the action of North Beach and the Embarcadero.

review.title: The hotel, staff, services, and food were terrific
review.reviewText: My wife and I took our twin 11 year old grandsons to San Francisco to celetrate their 11th bithday. We stayed at the Omni. Its location, condition, services and food were excellent. I would highly recommend the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Its extremely high quality of services.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. It is within walking distance to most attractions.

review.title: city hotel
review.reviewText:
would have preferred a queen bed not a double
on a steep hill and lots of eatieries were closed due to the fact it is in a business district
review.locationRemarks: union square is about 8-10 blocks away and trolly passes by

review.title: Sooo Friendly!
review.reviewText:
Totally enjoyed Omni Hotel!
Every single last staff member is so friendly and helpful. Thanks to Maggie at the front desk who recommended some great restaurants for us. I didn't catch the name of the doorman on the morning that we were leaving but as he was helping us with our bags into the airport shuttle he was sooo chipper and friendly that I noticed that the others waiting in the shuttle had to check and see what hotel this was :-)
We love to walk so the location of the hotel worked out fine for us, although it is very close to China Town and Ferry Building.
Would most definitely stay here again!

review.title: Classy, comfortable and good location
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, made me feel like an important guest, beautiful room.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of rooms and customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect for the weekday business traveler. Not my first choice for weekend stay since it is in the financial district.

review.title: Great place to stay in the heart of SF!
review.reviewText:
My husband of 16 years and I had a rare chance to get away without kids for a night. We absolutely loved the Omni! It was clean and comfortable and had beautiful and romantic lobby. It doesn't have any of those extra amenities like a jacuzzi tub, but who cares, you are in a prime location and hopefully will spend most of your time outside the hotel! A prime location for restraunts, Union Square shopping and the ballpark is within a 30 min walk or short taxi ride.
Recommend !
review.negativeRemarks: The vale service was a little slow getting our car out of parking for us. I'd say we waited a good 20-25 min. Jacuzzi always gets brownie points too!

review.title: Great Hotel for the San Francisco Marathon
review.reviewText: Great accommodations and location for SF Marathon participants. We had a great time. This was my first trip to San Francisco. We're looking forward to returning.
review.positiveRemarks: Beauty, location, staff, morning coffee and fruit.
review.locationRemarks: The SF Marathon.

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Mainly the service. Staff was amazing. So helpful. Concierge was helpful and arranged for a car to take us to ferry building when we were late so we didn't have to pay for a taxi. Had the best steak I've ever had at the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping and restaurants. Close to ferry building also

review.title: Omni Hotel in San Francisco is the best.
review.reviewText: Were greeted by extremely friendly doormen. Very helpful and personable. Bellman promptly escorted us to our room after checking in with a very nice young lady at the front desk. Informed us of our amenities and surroundings. The room was wonderful. Very elegant and comfortable. The location was great, one block from Chinatown. Dinner downstairs at Bob's Chop House was delicious but pricey. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at and that's saying something because I travel alot... My experience with Omni Hotels has always been great but this one is by far the best yet. Five stars *****
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think of a thing I would change or that they could improve on. This staff is awesome.
review.locationRemarks: So much to do in so little time. Concierge Lex was very helpful. Chinatown one block away. Taxi is always at front or the Doorman will get one quickly

review.title: Stayed only 1 night - as pleasant
review.reviewText: Stayed only night - staff was great. Bed was comfortable but the room could have used an update.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Conveniently located in the middle of San Francisco, two blocks away from Chinatown.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi should be free in any hotel, here it is after they make you jump through hoops to become a 'preferred customer'. Do away with this nonsense.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText:
Great for our first time stay in San Fran. Staff were lovely and always willing to help - had a great recommendation for breakfast across the road at Bouchon which was excellent quality. Good location, close to several transport options but away from the hustle and bustle of union sq. We took the hop on hop off one day (got $5 discount vouchers through reception), Muni for buses and cable cars the next, or walked.

We were on the 14th floor facing the street, no issues with noise. Really comfy beds and decent sized rooms. Free wifi with guest membership was great (plus the complimentary morning drinks!). Just be aware that as this is in the financial district, places tend to
shut after 10pm and on weekends - even subway and mcdonalds.We got caught out one night during the week looking for a late night feed. However union sq and other options are 10 mins away on foot and there are ways to avoid the steep hills!).

All in all, loved it and the staff were great.
review.positiveRemarks: Well located with large, comfy rooms and friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for a first time stay

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the financial district. It is within walking distances of many good restaurants and stores. The hotel staff was friendly and efficient. It has a decent size 24 hour gym with several cardio machines and limited weights. The hotel has a full bar although it is a little pricey compared to outside bars. The valet parking was $32 on "sale" and the valet parking service was fast and polite.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, classy hotel, clean facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom had one sink which was kind of small. Difficult for two people to get ready at the same time.
review.locationRemarks: Recommend you go to the restaurant Chaya which is within walking distance.

review.title: Aways love coming back
review.reviewText:
Third trip to the Omni San Fancisco. Always treated well, and have stayed in suites to a simple room. All very clean, well maintained, staff always friendly...if they did not have an answer, they worked to get one. The ONLY thing negative about them is their insistence on charging guests for the internet, when use of the internet is unlimitted. We own and run a guest house in a country where the internet is not free, even our guests have free internet as a cost of doing business.
On my next trip to San Francisco the Omni will still be my first choice.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Charming hotel, very pleasant staff, location was convenient to everything we wanted to do
review.positiveRemarks: Central location in a nice part of SanFrancisco. Brought our family and spent 4 days walking and cable car and bus riding! Staff was always upbeat!
review.negativeRemarks: Double room was smaller than what we are used to so it was a bit cramped with 2 teens
review.locationRemarks: Great location in a nice part of Financial district which is walking distance to just about everything

review.title: Four night San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: The room was surprisingly spacious. The additional free amenities for Select Guest members was were a very nice addition. This was a first rate value in San Francisco when purchased with the air fare.

review.title: THE BEST!
review.reviewText:
There is not much more that can be said. This is a fabulous hotel with a great location around the corner from the Trans Am building, on the cable-car line and within one to three blocks of about 6 Starbucks (if that is your pleasure). Room and bathroom were all updated and brightly lit!

For breakfast you can also choose Cafe Venue (2 blocks and down an alley). Across the street and 1 block is La Boulange (fabulous Fr. bakery for BKFST or lunch) both only open M-F . . . After all this is the financial district! Cafe is 'you order, you pick up'. La B is also 'you order' but they deliver.

We had a wonderful dinner at Cafe Claude. The concierge made our reservation-3 block walk. Claude also has two other places on this alley-all three are worth the walk. On our last night
we ate at the hotel in Bob's Steak and Chop -yum!

If you dare to blend with the tourists and find yourselves down at Pier 39, do have lunch or dinner at Fog Harbor up on the second level . . . Window seat preferred. Very nicely appointed, white linens, fine china and crystal, and good service . . . A big step ahead of the other tourist eateries on level one.

This was our first stay at an Omni and we will definitely stay at others during our travels. They are service orientated and soon you practically feel like family. We are doing a 16 day trip around CA and upon our return to Frisco to catch a 'red-eye' the Omni will be storing our luggage while we drop off our city rental and kill some time.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and always happy to help.
review.locationRemarks: For San Francisco, the location is great. The cable car stop on the corner, or the 4 block walk to Market Street, made it easy to get anywhere!

review.title: Girls' weekend!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was extremely helpful. They recommended a great restaurant for lunch, gave us directions around the city, sold us cable car passes right at the desk, and made accommodations for a car to take us to the airport. The building was really beautiful and the room was huge. My only complaint is that the beds were a little hard. Also, be warned that the hotel is downtown in a big city, so we passed quite a few homeless people on our way back and forth. It was a bit uncomfortable walking there at night so you may want to budget for taxi rides after dark!
review.negativeRemarks: Neighborhood is a little scary at night
review.locationRemarks: Very urban

review.title: Great hotel for business travelers...
review.reviewText: Great location, excellent staff, good service and a pleasure to stay at.
review.locationRemarks: Financial District, Chinatown, Close to Pier

review.title: Great hotel for a business trip
review.reviewText: Quiet hotel in a great location for business meetings. While the breakfast was pricey, the food was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet rooms and an above average fitness room
review.negativeRemarks: Waiting to have my car brought out at departure
review.locationRemarks: Close to most everything in the business district

review.title: Classy hotel in the Financial District
review.reviewText:
The Omni SF is a classy hotel in the financial district. I stayed with my wife over a holiday weekend. The hotel is nicely located in a central area of downtown which helps get to all the sights quickly. The lobby has several crystal chandeliers, marble staircase, and gold embellishments. The staff is very attentive and service oriented. We enjoyed the tasty complimentary iced tea in the lobby and we also had a good dinner and great drinks in the bar, Bob's, while watching NHL on the bar TV.

The room was a well appointed king with marble bathroom, a cozy reading chair and a desk. The AC and black-out curtains helped us sleep well into the day each morning of our holiday.

I would definitely recommend and stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel for couples
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay here. Great service and awesome location.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco's Financial District
review.reviewText: Spent three nights at the Omni. Moved from a hotel near the wharf which cost almost $300 per night for a very basic, small and dated room. The Omni had luxurious rooms which cost us around $190 during a holiday weekend. Staff offered good, attentive service. Will definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice accomodations, but the service level of the staff is what makes this Hotel stand out.
review.negativeRemarks: Better attention to small details in the room. Some areas had dust-bunnies. Coffee maker did not work properly.
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Park, Alcatraz, Fisherman's Wharf, Market Street, Union Square.

review.title: Lovely hotel in wonderful location
review.reviewText: We were in town for my daughter's graduation. The Omni was perfect for us: centrally located, beautifully maintained, very comfortable, with a very attentive staff. And it didn't break the budget!
review.negativeRemarks: It was pretty perfect for us!
review.locationRemarks: We had a wonderful dinner in the Mexican restaurant Colibri, located on the other side of Union Square.

review.title: kaufman
review.reviewText: I would throughly recommend this hotel. It is well situated, quite and the rooms and staff excellent

review.title: Great Staff and Champagne -
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful, friendly and we were greeted with champagne during our visit. Our favorite doorman cheerfully offered to take family photos and always made sure that our transportation was available and timely. Very accommodating in every respect.
review.negativeRemarks: The double rooms are a bit small.
review.locationRemarks: Financial district location is very central and quiet on weekends.

review.title: Great hotel in the centre of San Fran
review.reviewText: Great location,worth paying extra for a better room,very comfortable with little street noise,room cleaner missed some little things such as coffee refills,desk staff,concierge ,doorman all excellent.Food was of a above average standard but a bit pricey.Great vibe in the hotel,had a sense of ownership by staff in a character filled ambience.
review.positiveRemarks: Tithe vibe and attention to detail
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking to Chinatown and nearby bars,15 minutes to walk to the Moscone Centre

review.title: Great location, Great Hotel! Will stay again.
review.reviewText:
Great hotel! Conveniently located in financial district and close proximity to market street which fantastic shopping and eats.

On a side note, If you are thinking about to San Francisco amd staying in downtown do not bother with renting a vehicle. Get yourself a multi day pass to ride the bus and trolley.
review.positiveRemarks: Awesome and knowledgeable service personnel! They were eager to please.
review.negativeRemarks: None. You get what you pay for in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location. Trolley is literally across the street and so is the bus stop.

review.title: Best hotel staff I have ever encountered!
review.reviewText: Our experience at the Omni San Francisco was absolutely fantastic. It is in a perfect location between the Financial District and Chinatown, so we walked almost everywhere. The staff was incredibly friendly, the room was clean and comfortable with a large bathroom. They had complimentary champagne in the lobby throughout the weekend, which was wonderful. Darryl, the doorman, was so knowledgeable about the city, and would practically throw himself in the street to get us a cab. Lex, the concierge, was incredibly helpful and gave us real and useful advice that made our trip run smoothly. Overall, a must stay!!
review.positiveRemarks: The beautiful lobby, and wonderful staff members.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location! Walking distance to Chinatown, Market Street, and the Embarcadero.

review.title: Great location, great staff.
review.reviewText: Great experience. Staff was unbelievable. Made our staff much better.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Fantastic location - 10 mins walk to the Ferry Building one way, and 10 min walk to Union Square and all the shops the other way.

review.title: Anniversary in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Hotel and location were great. Staff were VERY friendly and helpful.

When they found out we were in town for our anniversary they sent up complimentary wine, cheese and desserts.

Would Stay here again without hesitation!
review.locationRemarks: Great location - 2 blocks from China Town and near bottom of Knob Hill. Short walks to Union Square (great shopping); AT&T Park and Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: stayed in other Omni's hard to explain but staff seamed a little off , however the hotel is in the center of everything
review.negativeRemarks: front of house staff seamed to be inexperienced
review.locationRemarks: could not ask for a better location if you can walk there public transportation is at the door

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay at the Omni hotel in San Francisco. The staff was very helpful with directions around town and the valet service was great! The room was beautiful and we stayed on the 17th floor. We loved the views and being up away from the street noise. So thankful that we stayed at this hotel!

review.title: Friendly People
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok, very friendly people and good location near from Union Square. The decor is a little bit outdated but it nice to to stay here.

photos.caption: the lobby as seen on April 26, 2013
Inside room 1023 as seen on April 26, 2013
the lobby as seen on April 27, 2013

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It had a very inviting lobby and the doormen and front desk were warm and welcoming. Our room was huge and the bed was very comfortable. I liked that the hot water in the bathtub and sink got hot fast and whatever brand of shampoo they offered was decent. We were greeted warmly by both the doorman and Britney (sp?) who was working at the registration desk when we arrived late and was so nice and friendly and was a breath of fresh air. Didn't order room service but the menu looked pretty standard. Great location on the corner of California and Montgomery Streets, walking distance to the Embarcadero and to Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, clean, comfortable, inviting lobby
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom shower head was removable, but it was too low. no bathroom scale, slippery tub
review.locationRemarks: corner of Montgomery and California, close to lots of the great shopping areas.

review.title: Very nice hotel and location.
review.reviewText:
Didn't get any new coffee packets but everything else was great, so no major complaint. :)

The staff was very helpful with areas to see and locations of restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Location is in very central locale for getting everywhere, and the area is very safe right here.

review.title: Perfect location to everything
review.reviewText: The entire staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. They are also extremely friendly. Hats off to the doormen also!
review.locationRemarks: Location is great

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText:
Highly suggest signing up for the SelectGuest programm as you get free wifi and complimentary drink in the morning as well as 2 free pressing and 1 shoe shine...

Bar were a bit pricey but serving were quite generous so the price ended up being correct. I took a scotch at 18$ and was expecting the usual 1 once glass and the glass was closer to 3 ounces, i was quite surprised and happy and considered the amount paid was well worth what i got.
review.locationRemarks: near our office and the embarcadero. Lots of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Overall great hotel!
review.reviewText: Rooms were very noce and comfortable. Staff was super helpful and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, central to resturants, shops, sightseeing, convention center. No congestion in the entry of hotel, cars, traffic, people.

review.title: Good times!
review.reviewText: Great night sleep, very nice rooms, overall very satisfied!

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice and centrally located. Room was clean, and not smoky smelling as one I recently had at another hotel. The only item I did not like was the restraint stopped serving breakfast at 10:00am weekdays, my wife an I arrived at 10:30am. The only other item was the house keepers left 2 glasses that had ice in them that had not melted so I can only assume they felt we want to keep it when we returned 6 hours later.
Very friendly and helpful staff that remember their customers when the leave and always welcome you back later in the day.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Entire staff went out of their way to be helpful. Especially like Darrell the Doorman!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff! The hotel is also very beautiful.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all of downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent Location, Rooms and Staff
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Super friendly and helpful staff. Front desk clerk was knowledgeable and recommended excellent restaurants.

review.title: Something for everyone.
review.reviewText: This is a very pleasant, comfortable hotel with helpful staff. It is very convenient to the business district and to cable cars. I was aware of families, business groups, tourist groups, and individuals.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls could be a bit more soundproof.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent the weekend at the Omni San Francisco to celebrate our 47th anniversary. When we checked in, the desk clerk asked us the reason for our stay. We told her we were celebrating our 47th anniversary. She immediately upgraded our room for us. Thereafter, we received a complimentary bottle of champagne with a lovely note from the staff of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Courtesy of staff, great accomodations, and a great location.
review.locationRemarks: Location is supurbe. You can walk to everything.

review.title: Beautiful hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was large and well maintained. The room had a good sized desk and a nice reading chair with footstool and the bed was very comfortable. The front desk staff was wonderful and everyone was very helpful and pleasant. I loved that it was only a couple blocks from Chinatown and close to many things. I would stay at this hotel again. One tip - buy your own beverages including bottled water and put in the mini fridge. A bottle of water from the room is $7.25!
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the beautiful lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything but far enough away from the main tourist attractions to feel like you are getting away from the frenzy.

review.title: Family travel
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 days and 2 nights with my wife and 27 year old daughter.From the moment we arrived everyone was very friendly and helpful.The hotel is beutiful with clean and comfortable rooms. Great location,walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Farmers Market etc.Following the advice of other expedia travelers I joined the Omni frequent traveler program which gives you free wifi access , free breakfast beverage delivered to your room, free newspaper,etc
review.positiveRemarks: The people that work there and the clean and comfortable rooms

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great value for the price. Central location. Efficient and polite staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked not to have to pay for parking, should have been part of hotel charge.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Stay here!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, staff and location. Close to everything!
review.negativeRemarks: Price of the food in the restaurant attached
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for those not wanting to rent a car who want to see the city.

review.title: Fantastic stay!
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Omni. It was in a very convenient location, the staff were all extremely friendly and we thought the accomodations were very relaxing.

review.title: Great little getaway
review.reviewText: We love staying at this hotel. The staff from the doorman, to the housekeeping staff are very friendly and professional. We enjoyed the beverage service and fresh fruits they have in the lobby everyday.
review.positiveRemarks: Beverage service and fresh fruit in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: Located in the financial district just a block or so away from Belden PlaceClose to Chinatown, and an easy walk to the Ferry Building.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: great location and great value for money. They need to provide kettles so you can make a cup of tea

review.title: Nice Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Nice location, front desk is poorly managed, or maybe more accurately not managed.
Valet parking is very expensive but they do a great job.
I will still stay there whenever I am in San Francisco.
Very good room service.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff was only so so.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location

review.title: A grand hotel.
review.reviewText: Large, immaculate and well appointed room with magnificent high ceilings. Hotel gym excellent with a varied choice of state of the art equipment. We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking California St and the noise was minimal with the windows closed. Yes, you could hear the cable car, but this is the sound of San Francisco. Will definitely return to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: I had no fault with this fine hotel. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: Over priced adjoining restaurant and bar. $15.00 for an order of onion rings, FIVE dollars for a cup of coffee and almost $8.00 for a domestic beer!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Quiet, safe and near everything but without the overwhelming tourist vibe of Union Square.

review.title: home away from home!
review.reviewText: Luxury hotel, full of wow factor, the room was large, comfortable and felt like home!
Great place to stay in SF. Friendly staff and good rooms.

review.title: Great business hotel
review.reviewText: The last time I reviewed this hotel, I'd spent one night. This time I spent a week. I give it 5's across the board. I am 6'4" tall and I liked the high ceilings in the rooms as well as the nice high shower head and high shower curtain rod. The hotel has all of the "little things" down pretty well. The towel rods were all nice an solid. In some hotels you feel like you have to be careful hanging a towel lest the rod fall off the wall. Not the case at all with the Omni, nice, solid, well-anchored fixtures. And the lighting in the bathroom was good; as was the lighting in the room itself. In some hotels you either feel like the bathroom is a dark cave or else it takes five minutes for the lights to warm up to where you can see enough to shave in the morning. Not the Omni - good and bright as soon as you hit the switch. And none of those super-dim bulbs in the lamps either, nice, bright bulbs there too. The curtains did a great job of shutting out the exterior light when it was time to sleep. I got no street noise, but I had a courtyard? view (i.e. not street). And the staff was great! Very friendly and helpful when I checked in and the concierge did a great job of giving me a lot of options for a quick one-evening of playing tourist. Would I recommend it to a friend? Only as long as I were not travelling during the same time period. If there was any danger of my "friend" taking the last room then I'd tell him to go find his own hotel and let me have the Omni.
review.locationRemarks: Very good for where I was conducting my business.

review.title: Immaculate, friendly & great location
review.reviewText: Absolutely amazing. The staff went above and beyond to give us travel help and directions. Location was great. Hotel itself was immaculate. I would stay here again or recommend it highly.

review.title: best hotel in san francisco
review.reviewText: perfect location, very helpful staff and spotless room

review.title: The best hotel thay I've visited
review.reviewText: Everything in this hotel was excellent, we stayed for 3 nights with my wife. The room was almost luxurious, incredibly large and quiet at night. The bed, one of the best I've had in hotels. The cleaning is excellent, every day the room looked like new. Service very friendly, helpful, the best hotel I've ever been by far.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and the quite night.

review.title: Lovely Family Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful place to stay!!!! We would stay again in a heartbeat!!! Very friendly people.
review.locationRemarks: You have to eat at Mamas!!!! Wonderful food!

review.title: Pleasant Stay All Around
review.reviewText: Beds were very comfortable, staff very friendly, and centrally located to many of San Fran's top destinations.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: This is a really nice hotel. Great location, fantastic staff, nice rooms. Good size (not too big)

review.title: Great for business
review.reviewText: Well located and high quality. Rooms are a bit dated, but otherwise nice, clean, comfortable. excellent business hotel.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable two night stay. Staff was very courteous, friendly and helpful.

review.title: Perfect in every way!
review.reviewText: I just love the Omni! This was my second visit and I'll continue to stay here for business when going to this part of SF. They do everything right and if you sign up for their corporate club, you get free coffee delivered to your door in the morning and free WiFi. Simply perfect.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Very professional and clean hotel.
My only complaint is that there were no amenities for children like a pool or play area. THe food was also VERY expensive. And no disney channel, which the kids like to watch. Over all, the staff was very nice and helpful, just a few kinks that families with children may think are important.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Very lovely hotel, well located. We picked it because of the location between the Ferry Building (Saturday's Farmers Market) and Union Square as well as near the BART station.

review.title: fine hotel with extremely attentive staff
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a great location. We had special needs as we drove in and left a car for a short while and then flew out late the next day. The staff was very helpful with handling our bags and needs and even allowed a late check out. The concierge and front desk were free with info. regarding the area and amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Business district by China Town

review.title: great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location, very easy access to public transportation and within walking distance of Chinatown. Very clean, very friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Staff was great
review.reviewText: Service was excellent and people were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: cost of meals was very high
review.locationRemarks: central to many sights

review.title: Reasonable hotel
review.reviewText: Deluxe room is nothing special. Bobs is solid, good bar too
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Very nice hotel, quite.
review.reviewText: A very nice place to stay. Our room was very nice. Good room service. Friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Grat location for the things we wanted to do.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Nice room. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. It was also very quiet.

review.title: Excellent hotel overall
review.reviewText: Hotel is locating in the heart of SF. Inside the financial center but near to Union Square, China town, Little Italy. Very clean and quiet during e weekend. A bit more busy in the weekday. Very polite and helpful staffs. The only drawback is no free wifi or Internet connection.
review.locationRemarks: It's inside the financial district. No specific view but continence to nearby shopping and restaurant.

review.title: Glorious, Luxurious, Delightful!
review.reviewText:
I have done a lot of business traveling and have had a difficult time finding new accommodation at relatively reasonable pricing. While the Omni is not cheap, by San Francisco standards, it's a bargain at the price they charge.

The rooms are very good sized, especially for SF. The bed is extremely comfortable. All of the amenities you need are included, as well as good WiFi and free coffee.

Suffice it to say, I loved my stay here and am looking forward to the Omni becoming my go-to hotel for business travel in SF.

review.title: A Wonderful Treat for Couples
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a perfect location on the Bay side of San Francisco. Beautiful, clean, and friendly, the Omni was a perfect base point for both relaxing in the hotel, as well as, a great place for exploring the city. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, and inviting. Every experience with the staff was 100% positive. We will definitely be back!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed and pillows were super comfy! Our street facing room got tons of sunlight. Perfect for a romantic getaway.
review.negativeRemarks: Although I loved the street facing room, we could hear street traffic, including the cable car which could be quite loud.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great, San Francisco is a wonderful walking city, and the Omni is in the heart of it all.

review.title: Great Hotel for all.
review.reviewText: The entire visit at the Omni Hotel was wonderful. From Check-in to Check-out everything was smoothe.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpfulness of staff and cleanliness of hotel
review.locationRemarks: Financial District

review.title: Elegant & Affordable Gem
review.reviewText: Location is great -- easy access to BART, on a cable car line, walking distance to Chinatown, great restaurants, Ferry Building, and much more. Nice bar and restaurant within the hotel itself. Room was clean, quiet, & comfortable. One of the few downtown hotels I've stayed at where if you don't want the A/C on, you can actually open a window and not get blasted with street noise. Online discount made the rate a very good deal for SF. But by far the best aspect of my stay was the excellent staff & service. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk to the hospitality staff was extremely helpful and cheerful.

review.title: Great Hotel for the business traveler
review.reviewText: I booked this Hotel via Expedia as a package and was very pleased with the Hotel recommendation. The Omni Hotel is conveniently located in the Financial district. The friendly staff was excellent throughout the stay where I found the check-in and check-out process was quick and seamless. The room was very comfortable and quiet, although I should note that I was on a higher floor above the city traffic so guests may take that into consideration when selecting the room. Overall a good stay a business traveler on the go.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Great over all experience. Great Location...walking distance to embarcadero and Union Square... Very knowledgeable and friendly concierge
review.locationRemarks: close to transportation and main attractions

review.title: nice hotel great clean location
review.reviewText:
no complaints about the hotel. The room average size hotel room...i expected bigger from a luxury hotel chain...but I guess for a hotel in San Francisco its considered a good size room.
Pros-Great clean/safe location.2 blocks away from China town & 3 blocks from Union Square-department stores shopping center. Good coffee in rooms. Comfortable beds & pillows.
Cons-Hotel Parking about $30dollars per day. But parking is pretty expensive anywhere in San Francisco. No free internet for guests & no free water bottles either. Most luxury hotels give u about 2 free water bottles per day & free internet.
review.locationRemarks: safe and clean location

review.title: FANTASTIC!
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic weekend at the Omni Hotel. It began the moment we arrived at 9:00 am, when we were able to check in to our room upon arrival... how unusual! The staff are friendly and helpful. We were greeted on Saturday late afternoon, after a long day of fun and shopping, with a glass of Champagne... it was a really lovely touch! I had asked for a late check out the day we were leaving and they happily accommodated my request. I cannot say enough positive about the hotel and the staff! THANKS FOR A PERFET WEEKEND!

review.title: Great hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText:
A really nice hotel situated within the financial district. A short stroll away from some coffee shops, close to various cable car routes, and a five minute walk to Union Square and the Westfield Center for shopping.
The staff were very pleasant, our room was clean and comfortable and a good size.
We were also very happy with the hotel rate... Although non negotiable cancellation terms applied so be sure not to need to change dates etc.
We would be happy to recommend others to stay.

review.title: Excellent Family Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed there with my family over the New Year period. It was quiet and the service was excellent. As others have said I would recommend signing-up to their membership plan which is free and allows you to enhance your stay, for example, my son received cookies and milk at bedtime and we had a complimentary tea/coffee, newspaper service delivered to the room in the morning.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: excellent accommodations. Only slight negative was that room cleaning staff neglected to resupply coffee (in both our and our friend's rooms)

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great service, upscale hotel, muni car just on our street, very conveniently located.

review.title: Perfect for a gateway weekend.
review.reviewText: Very great place to stay. People can go without any doubt.

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and location. Only issue was that housekeeping forgot to restock the coffee pods when the room was cleaned and it took them longer than it should have to get ones to the room when called.

review.title: Central location in Financial District
review.reviewText: Vacationing with friends and their teenage daughter. Have stayed here several times. Excellent location in the financial district of downtown S.F. Walked to Chinatown, Japantown and a bit longer walk to the Piers. Lots of restaurants nearby, though on weekends most close. Hope to be back again soon. We all had a wonderful time and the hotel service is the best.

review.title: Great hotel for a family
review.reviewText:
I have never seen kind staff than this hotel's. On a rainy day, for example, they gave umbrellas to going-out customers and wiped rainwater of coming-in customers with towels.
Room is traditional and clean, and the location is good for downtown tours.

review.title: Great Businees Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and nicely kept. The valet and lobby personnel were friendly and helpful. The newspaper in the morning and complimentary starbucks coffee was a nice touch. The room very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I was surprised that parking was $60 per night.
review.locationRemarks: The location in the financial district and the close proximity to the Bart Station made business trip in and around the bay area convenient.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was great. Was in a great location.The rooms were clean and nice and quiet.
review.locationRemarks: It was in a wonderful location. Easy to get to all the sights

review.title: San Francisco City Break
review.reviewText: We were there for a family break. Great hotel. Great location. Great service. What more is there to say? Would return.
review.locationRemarks: Toronto

review.title: Great Hotel For Family Trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. The service was excellent.

review.title: gret hotel for families nd business
review.reviewText: All staff were personable and exceptionally helpful. Desk, Consenier, Room Service, and Housekeeping Staff were exceptionally helpful and polite. Received free wii for up to 3 devices and complimentary morning beverages.
review.positiveRemarks: Diligence in service provision and friendly staff and very comfortable bed matress.
review.locationRemarks: Omni of San Francisco, 500 California Street; about a 6 block walk from wharf with trolley, street car, and BART access in close proximity.

review.title: Nice, practical, convenient
review.reviewText:
Room was nice and it had everything I needed. I enjoyed breakfast in the room (I had options and chose one I liked most) and dinner in Bob's restaurant on first floor. I wanted to order a taxi to go to airport and was pleasantly surprised to figure out that Omni hotel has its own park of cars for clients transportation available at any time. Location of the hotel is great. So far it's the best hotel in SF I stayed (compared with other popular ones like Marriott and George Hotel)

==
Internet is $10 per day but I didn't need it so for me it worked.
review.locationRemarks: Close to center; nice restaurant on first floor

review.title: great service but restaurant is not for vegetarian
review.reviewText: I stayed for 3 nights while attending meetings at an office nearby. i found the hotel very comfortable , with excellent service.
review.positiveRemarks: service and free internet once you become a member.
review.negativeRemarks: the fact that the restaurant serves has little for vegetarians and is expensive.

review.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff, but the double beds are a bit too small for two. It seemed that they could have fit queen beds in the spacious room.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in a good location. Staff is professional and friendly.

review.title: Good if you have money to burn...
review.reviewText: This hotel is awesome if money is no object. As a romantic treat on a budget I wouldn't recommend it. I know I should have known better but there you go. Hotel was lovely and staff were really happy to help. Not to mention free mulled cider and gingerbread men at Christmas in the lobby.

review.title: Fantastic service at a San Francisco luxury hotel
review.reviewText: Superb luxury hotel in central San Francisco with the service to match the accomodations.

review.title: Loved this place
review.reviewText: Very nice! No issues! The staff was very helpfull. I will return to this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location......

review.title: Good location for exploring
review.reviewText: Quiet location at weekend (when I was there) as in the financial district, and convenient as close to union square and the waterfront (10-15 walk). Good value for money when booked as a 'deal'.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet at night and convenient location
review.locationRemarks: Financial district, on corner of California and Montgomery, so quiet at weekend

review.title: Omni
review.reviewText:
We stayed there in early December and the hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays. The staff was most efficient and warm and friendly.
There is no airport shuttle, so you need to order that service yourself; if taking the BART, be sure that your travel times are not too early or late in the day for the safest travel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very nice lobby area, rooms were comfortable but don't expect any views. Bed was incredible and we are picky.
review.locationRemarks: central to all

review.title: Happy Holidays at the Omni
review.reviewText: Great staff...the guys at the door were very helpful and warm!
review.locationRemarks: Cable car is directly in front of the hotel...nice!

review.title: Good business hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: It is in a great location at the financial district of San Francisco. Great restaurants and bars around including the Bob's Steak House in the hotel. Very friendly staff but lack of a good concierge. Beddings are very comfortable however other furniture is a bit old.
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great hotel and service staff
review.reviewText: This hotels staff could not have done anymore! They were great. Made for a more enjoyable trip.
review.positiveRemarks: the little things that they did like hot cider and gingerbread men in the lobby as you arrive.
review.locationRemarks: good central location.

review.title: For Fans of 1950's Retro
review.reviewText:
Excellent, helpful staff.

Decor appears unchanged since 1945 (or is it 1955?) Outdoor noise excessive (no double-paned windows in 1945).
review.negativeRemarks: The Decor! My room was designed and furnished by my Aunt Mildred.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for business, sight-seeing, dining.

review.title: Noisy--Old--Unaccommodating
review.reviewText:
NO concierge at 7:00 pm on a Friday night ? ....when I asked the front desk people they were clueless about recommendation! .....and said there is never a concierge there at night...huh??

Nothing more than basic cable TV ...every other 4 star hotel I've stayed in had better.

Hotel looks a little old and dated.

There was some middle eastern protesters outside my window EVERY NIGHT.....their consulate is across the street so they gathered there every night with a blow horn and were VERY LOUD .....so annoying!

The restaurant had good breakfast though.

I'll never stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, isn't cheap but it felt very well maintained and very classy. Reception desk staff were charming and always helpful. Located quite close to Union Square so you're in a great location too. Definitely felt more of a business trip hotel than a family one but the overall quality of the hotel was so good that anyone could like it!
review.negativeRemarks: Cost was very high...even getting breakfast wasn't cheap
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, safe and easy to locate area

photos.caption: king size bed in our room

review.title: Great hotel stay.
review.reviewText: The stay at Omni was great. The only bad thing when we arrived we noticed the bathroom sink was clogged and water would not drain quickly. The cleaning service took notice of the note I left in the bathroom and seems like they took care of it (although not to perfection).
review.positiveRemarks: 5 star hotel at a great price.
review.negativeRemarks: Only one choice of restaurant to eat and pricey.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to most places

review.title: Very comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel was in very nice condition and in a great location. Nice to have Bob's Steakhouse on lobby level for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

review.title: Great quality hotel!
review.reviewText: Excellent stay at the Omni. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. We liked the location as it was central to Union Square, Market St, Chinatown, North Beach. We'd definitely stay again.

review.title: Good but some problems.
review.reviewText: Room could have been cleaner when we checked in although it was acceptable. Maid service during the stay was spotty and things like soap and bottled water were not always replaced. Maids also came late in the day while we were in the room. Parking Valet was awful. When we checked out we called for the car but still had to wait over half an hour. Then they brought the wrong car. Finally they brought our car but never apoligized for the long wait.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown.

review.title: All around great and close to everything in City
review.reviewText: No complaints here, this hotel lies right next to China Town about a block up the road. Room was always kept clean by the hotel maids and there was no issue with a late checkout. Overall great stay and would definitely stay here again. Reminder to all, sign up for their free gues membership online, there are a few perks to that and it's absolutely free.
review.positiveRemarks: Location in relation to the City and the surroundings
review.negativeRemarks: The parking sucks and they charge you $47 for their personal garage parking, much less in other areas. I would recommend EZ Parking on Jones street

review.title: Very nice hotel in a very good location
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel because it was very highly reviewed. Probably THE best reviewed hotel in the area without knowing anything about the area or other hotels. My choice was correct. We arrived late in the evening and it was raining. The valet met us quickly and the door staff was extremely helpful in getting us and the kids inside quickly.
I let the staff know it was our anniversary and I also joined the loyalty program, as recommended by other reviewers. Both of these turned out in my favor. I ended up not even using the free Wi-Fi but they gave us care packages for the kids which included nightly cookies and milk, and we got some strawberries on our anniversary date. We also took advantage of the morning delivery of coffee and orange juice that didn't cost us anything.
The location could not have been better. We were close by everything we wanted to see. We stayed over a weekend so for the most part the neighborhood was quiet, I'm guessing because it's the financial district. Our room was on the 15th floor so outside noise was never a problem. I didn't hear any of the other hotel guests either.
I can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel. Everything was great-service, location, value....I would definitely stay here again.
I guess the only thing I could possibly gripe about is paying $102 plus "city parking tax" for three nights of parking. From what I have seen from other reviewers, though, I may have gotten off easy compared to some.
review.positiveRemarks: Great service, very friendly valets, desk staff, bell staff, everyone. They were there when I needed them.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees. You have to factor these with the per-night cost. But still, even with the parking, I think this place was an extraordinary value
review.locationRemarks: In the financial district just south of TransAmerica pyramid. Cable car runs and stops directly in front. Streetcar/BART a few blocks south, awesome

review.title: Great hotel in great location for a family.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni Hotel over Veterans Day Weekend just on a whim for a short weekend stay. The location was great- right in the financial district between Chinatown and Union Square. We walked all over to Chinatown, Union Square, North Beach etc. Upon check-in the doorman gave each of our sons a backpack with puzzles and small toys and a water bottle. Very nice gesture and our sons were very impressed. They wore the little backpacks all over during the weekend- it helped to carry their Nintendos and game cartridges. The front desk was very hospitable and upgraded us to a bit larger room, not that we needed it but always nice. The hotel offered hot cider and fresh fruit in the afternoon and hot coffee in the morning. The rooms were clean and nice. Very quiet. The location was great. Friendly staff. My sons wish were was an indoor swimming pool but we didn't have time for that this trip anyway.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff. Clean room. Very quiet. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: My sons wish were was an indoor swimming pool- but really nothing negative to say about this hotel stay. Very pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: Great Location right near the financial district- between Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: Everything was to the tens except for parking which is understandable. Valet worked out fine but the $48 is steep. I should have parked my car myself for a quarter of the price. Convenience and service shouldn't be that expensive, especially when the actual workers dont see any of the money.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We usually like staying at boutique hotels, but this was a very nice property. The staff was cheerful and helpful, the room was lovely and it was very quiet. We were there celebrating an anniversary, and they sent up a beautiful tray with strawberries and champagne. We really enjoyed our vist there and will be back.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet but a little far to walk to things. Everything in the area was closed on Sunday. But the quiet made up for it.

review.title: Great value for money for a downtown luxury hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very neat and elegant but the older style decor (dark timber furniture and carpet design) did not suit me.

The staff were very helpful and professional. After I checked out on my last day of stay, the concierge staff agreed to hold my luggage all day so I could pick up after my tour of the city -which they had arranged for me - and this was very helpful as I it allowed me to enjoy me tour without worrying about what to do with my bag.

There was no information on telephone costs which meant that I could not make calls as call costs could be prohibitive. There was also no information on whether 1800 calls could be made toll free - even for airline confirmations.

As I did not have a laptop, I would have appreciated a courtesy computer facility - but this was not available - or there was no information about whether computers were accessible with or without charge.

Despite the above issues, the location of the hotel is its best asset and makes life very easy for both tourists and business people as it is right in the middle of downtown and close to everything.

review.title: Nice Hotel, But I was expecting better.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, But I was expecting better. A lot of the fluff and luxury is upfront in the lobby, but lacking in the rooms. Parking is 50.00 per night... and you have to wait on average 15-20 minutes. The shower and bathroom is ok, but I have experience a lot better at fewer star hotels. I will not consider staying here again.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of town

review.title: Great recommendations
review.reviewText: Great service! Loved all of the dining recommendations from Darryl!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed for two days. Hotel was nice , staff, 5 plus..well trained helpful.
Food was good close to everything
review.positiveRemarks: We've stayed at many nice hotels very well maintained property..a pleasure to visit for business or pleasure

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
We have a very nice stay in San Francisco.
When we arrived the staff gave a big with gifts to our kids: they were delighted.
review.locationRemarks: Central location

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful, helpful staff, great location. I would stay in this hotel again for sure.

review.title: Gottogo
review.reviewText: Polite and knowing staff.Do you want this input ot not?
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to all tourist attractions.

review.title: Do not expect a good night sleep.
review.reviewText: I've stayed at Omni twice. First time I was extremely busy in the city I didn't pay much attention to my lodging for I just came there to crush and be the first person in the morning to leave, but I did notice the overall nice interior of the hotel and very good location. The second time I came to SF for a weekend, I picked Omni remembering that I was satisfied with my previous experience. There was no rush, and I could actually take a closer look at my accommodations and enjoy them. To my unpleasant surprise I did not like what I saw. First of all, the walls in the hotel are made of paper, and the staff is outrageously discourteous. Starting at 6 am, "housekeeping!" and "mini bar!" rushes into the hallway slamming every possible door on their way. So if you're an early riser, even during weekends, then this hotel's feature might not bother you too much. Another disturbing nuance is hotel's in-room WiFi which, at this age of wireless freedom everywhere, is not free. It's $9.95 per day. And it's not that big of a deal, really, except that it is absolutely not working! I don't mind being charged a reasonable fee for internet, but I do, surprisingly, expect it to work. I am not coming back to Omni and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Exquisite San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Exceptional customer service from curbside to hotel room. Staff very welcoming and courteous. Rooms were spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Great location.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located near convention center, shopping district, and a variety of dining options.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Clean rooms, friendly staff. This was located just about in the middle of everything.
review.locationRemarks: Business district

review.title: Elegant while comfortable.
review.reviewText: My last stay in San Francisco was at the Palace Hotel. This was vastly superior and is now my favorite. The staff at this, the Omni, is especially great. I can't think of a bad thing to say about it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were especially gracious, prompt, and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown within walking distance to the Ferry Building and pierside restaurants.

review.title: Lovely location for the travelling business-woman
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience from start to finish! Very attentive and welcoming staff, lovely room.

review.title: Well located but a little disappointing
review.reviewText: For such a highly rated hotel on trip adviser I was disappointed. It is a well located hotel that is clean with friendly, helpful staff. Watch out for unexpected additional charges. If you can't handle white-noise I would consider a different hotel or try and get a room on a higher floor, I presume this comes from the cable car tracks.

review.title: NWM 2012
review.reviewText: The staff was very polite & accommodating. Juan at the front desk went the extra step to call me on my cell to get my authorization so that the other girls in my party could check in to the rooms since I was running late. He also gave us all Mojo (energy bars) when we checked in. He was great! Many of the desk staff, bellhops/door men wished us good luck before our race and congratulated us after the race (2012 NIKE Women's Marathon). The staff definitely did their best to ensure our stay was enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were so comfortable as well as the robes. I love the tub.
review.locationRemarks: Loved the location.

review.title: Great finanical district hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great last minute one night stay. Very pleasant.

review.title: Elegant hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel in a great location, close to where we needed to be but nice and quiet. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Our only disappointment was that we were not able to have a late checkout, maybe at 3:00 p.m. without being charged extra.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect central location . .

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a great location with walking distance to Union square, china town, Ferry and lots of restaurants. The staff are very attentive. The room was very clean and beds were excellent.

The parking is a bit expensive but that's expected in all big cities.
In general I was happy with my stay in this hotel.

review.title: High quality, great location.
review.reviewText:
Great location. Easy walking distance to Market and SOMA, Union Square and Chinatown.
