The front staff, doorman, valets were all very polite and courteous. The lobby is nice and has the look of a classic, high end hotel. The rooms are also very nice, the bed comfortable. The bathroom was nicely appointed but had only one sink, not surprising for a older, small hotel.
Street noise (from the 8th floor) was a minor inconvenience.
One one gripe was that Wi-Fi is not complementary unless you join some free Select membership group. I should have know this but in this day and age, most higher end hotels have free internet.
Nevertheless, I would stay here again for the convenience of location and high quality accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: Mild street noise. Wi-Fi not complementary.

review.title: Worth treating yourself to a short break here.
review.reviewText: Met at the door, valet parking was very efficient, but expensive... so we handed the hire-car back early as public transport is so good in San Francisco. Kendra greeted us at the desk and gave us lots of good advice, information about the multiple events happening during our stay. Jason looked after us during the very good breakfasts we had...nothing was too much trouble. The staff were helpful and efficient throughout the hotel. The hotel offered a bar grill and formal dining, the food was good but we ate at other places as well. We felt the hotel was worth what we payed.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel itself is beautiful... and in a convenient location, but the staff are a real strength.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, breakfast and wi-fi are all added to the bill... but that's true of many of the other hotels we stayed in.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for access to public transport... within comfortable walking distance to the ferry and to Chinatown.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, great food, and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful to all of our needs.

review.title: Fantastic but expensive hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel in a great location but a tad expensive.

review.title: Good business hotel - try the restaurant
review.reviewText:
It is an older property, but very well maintained with a very elegant feel and the staff was quite friendly.

The quality of the food in the attached restaurant, Bob's, was excellent. I had a very nice bowl of lentil soup and the 12 oz filet mignon was tender and had excellent taste. Their garlic mashed potatoes complemented the steak very nicely and the glazed carrot added a nice touch of sweetness and was a good change from the standard side of steamed vegetables that many restaurants offer. The service was very good when they were present - but it did take too long for the servers to attend to us. The prices for most entrees are such that it's not going to work for most families' budgets. But they should fall within most business travellers' expense account limits.

review.title: We'd go back every time
review.reviewText: Staff we well trained and provided all services with a smile
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly well trained staff make staying there a pleasure
review.locationRemarks: Central and convenient to most everything

review.title: Great hotel for sightseeing and business travllers
review.reviewText:
spent 5 nights there during amrica's cup racing and columbus day weekend.
very central place for financial district. great food places for lunch and dinner nearby in walking distances. I would reccommend this for busienss travellers as well as couples and families visiting city over the weekend. Rooms were specious and well-cleaned. Staff is polite and great service.

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText:
Great location! On flat ground near the BART (4 blocks) and the Farmer's Market/ Embarcadero/ Ferry Landing. One block to chinatown- what else can you ask for. We walked a lot and I can't tell you how nice it was to minimize hills.
Service was amazing- brought my little girl cookies and milk in the evenings and a roll away bed - no extra charge. Always helpful and smiling, the have great staff. Can't wait to return.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART/ Chinatown and the Ferry Landing

review.title: Beautiful hotel with great service!
review.reviewText: Omni San Francisco Hotel is definitely one of the best 4-star hotels that we have stayed in. Hotel staff members were super friendly. Hotel lobby was beautiful and well maintained. Our rooms was nice and neat with high quality furniture. Service was excellent. Overall, we had a great experience staying there!
review.positiveRemarks: Welcome backpacks for kids and milk/cookies for the evening were a nice touch.
review.locationRemarks: We like the location as it's on a quite and neat street. A few blocks from Chinatown and 10-20 min drive to Fisherman's Wharf and Golden gate bridge.

review.title: NICE PLACE, CUSHY.
review.reviewText: CLEAN ROOM, SPACIOUS, FRIENDLY STAFF. PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION A LITTLE TOUGH, UNLESS YOU WANT TO USE THE CABLE CAR, WHICH IS INFREQUENT AND EXPENSIVE (BUT IT MIGHT BE JUST WHAT A VISITOR WANTS). BAR AND RESTAURANT OVERPRICED, BUT QUALITY IS GOOD.

review.title: Comfortable get away
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were well informed, engaging and helpful. Location provides easy access to a number of San Francisco destinattions.

review.title: Would stay there again!
review.reviewText:
I really found nothing to complain about this hotel.
Good location. Helpful front desk. Rooms were large and pleasantly decorated.
Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Upmarket hotel in SFO financial district
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel in the financial district of SFO. The district is very quiet at weekends so if you do not want to pay the hotel prices for snacks and water you may have a bit of a search.The staff were excellent, the bar lively and the restaurant good if pricey.

review.title: Great place, great people.
review.reviewText: When we arrived we received a warm and friendly greeting from everyone we encountered. The staff was well informed and knowledgeable. Our room was clean, comfortable, a little small but certainly cozy. Access to the sights and sounds of the city was excellent. We will definitely make a return trip! By the way, they have great tasting birthday cake!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with big, spacious, clean room. Bed was very comfortable and bathroom was very nice. Highly recommend the Omni Hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square.

review.title: Wonderful needed get away
review.reviewText: The hotel and our room were perfect. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. We are looking forward to our next visit!!

review.title: Terrific Staff
review.reviewText: What a lovely experience. The clean, comfortable, quiet room was only surpassed by the terrific front desk and front door staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees are high - like every other hotel in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, central city location.

review.title: I'll be back....
review.reviewText: Nice, quiet, clean room-nice furnishings, good comfortable bed-helpful staff. Need I say more? I'll be back.

review.title: A Fantastic Hotel.!!
review.reviewText: Coming from south america, Paraguay, it is not always easy to find accurate reviews on the web, never the less the ones I read about the Omni where right on the money. The hotel is fantastic! Located conveniently a few blocks away from chinatown where you must try R&G's food, the best Chinatown has to offer. The hotel staff is pleasing and will go the extra mile to satisfy your necessities. The rooms are spacious and the beds are Fantastic. I would recomend this hotel any time. Also in a very safe neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: no cocktails or drinks available in lobby
review.locationRemarks: near shopping attractions, market street, etc..

photos.caption: They remembered that it was our Anniversary!

review.title: A great Anniversary Getaway spot.
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Omni this past weekend for our Anniversary and we had read mixed reviews about the place. We were a little skeptical but the overall ratings were too good to ignore so, we booked the weekend for our stay in downtown San Francisco.

We arrived early as our flight was a red-eye flight but when we reached the hotel, the staff acknowledged us right away and straight away recommended things to do and places to go to fill the time gap as we were too early to check-in. Not only were the staff very welcoming but they did everything they could to help us fill in the time so we wouldn't get bored in such a big city. They helped store our luggage and the concierge gave us some vouchers if ever we wanted to eat or visit any recommended spots they gave us.

The rooms were nice and spacious and we were up on the 12th floor and I've read reviews about the traffic being so noisy but we didn't hear much. It was very faint and not enough to annoy us into not getting any sleep. Our room was always kept tidy and promptly by the time we arrived back from whatever we were doing and we also noticed little goodies laying around our room from the hotel staff.

Overall, we couldn't have had a more amazing experience if it wasn't for such a great hotel and the services they provided for us. We are very grateful for the staff there at the Omni and we will definitely return again. We highly recommend this place as it is very close to everything that you could see and do, try it!
review.positiveRemarks: The service of the staff, the spacious rooms and great environment.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Trolleys and Cable Cars all over and shopping and dining are at a close walking distance.

review.title: extremely comfortable beds & pillows
review.reviewText:
Very good hotel, with extremely comfortable beds & pillows, we got perfect rest. Location is great, next to the China Town, walking distance to Union Sq, museums, shops, Embarcadero, Columbus Ave. with some of the best restaurants in the city; one of the famous local cable-cars has a stop right in front of the hotel. Very good restaurant & bar downstairs, with excellent service & food, drinks.
Cons: during our 4-day stay only one of the three lifts worked, and we always had to wait for it, very annoying; the housekeeping most of the days forgot to replace the coffee & tea in the room, very annoying, too.
review.positiveRemarks: perfect rest in the comfortable bed & pillows; the breakfast - omelet with smoked salmon!
review.negativeRemarks: the lifts - only one worked; housekeeping forgot to replace coffee & tea
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, next to the China Town, walking distance to Union Sq, museums, shops, Embarcadero, Columbus Ave.

review.title: A gem of a hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: The staff are extremely polite and very helpful. I was in town for the long weekend and they were able to provide me and my party with great recommendations for restaurants and bars.

review.title: good location and great for family
review.reviewText: expensive but worth it, great staff and the location can't be beaten.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: High quality hotel in the financial district. My room was recently remodeled. Bright airy and comfortable. Location was decent, walking distance from the embarcadero, easy cab ride to ensure everything else. On par with the good hotels in NY, LA. I could have spent more downtown, but wouldn't have gotten much more.

review.title: Wonderful for families, couples or business
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in San Francisco for a ten year anniversary trip without kids. The hotel room was immaculate and gorgeous. While the street noise during the day was noticeable in our room, at night it was definitely peaceful. All the staff we encountered from check-in to the concierge to the door staff were overly helpful and polite. One of the doorman went out of his way to hail us a taxi. We decided not to rent a car, so I don't know how the parking fees compare to other hotels but the Omni is centrally located to all types of transportation to get around the city. Since this hotel is located in the Financial District, most of the cafes within a quarter mile are closed on weekends but there are plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance, not to mention being able to pick up a cable car practically at the front door. Union Square and Chinatown are not a far walk from the hotel and neither is the BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit). The Ferry Building is a bit farther than Union Square, but it is a relatively easy walk as I did it eight weeks after ACL reconstructive surgery. This hotel is great for couples, but I know that our young kids would enjoy staying their as well. I would stay at this hotel again just for the robes! Sign up for their rewards program and receive free wired and wireless internet and free beverage service every morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Polite staff who were knowledgeable about the area and the room was comfortable and pristine.
review.negativeRemarks: For some reason, I thought their was a pool, my mistake, but their fitness center is well-equipped. The outside noise was really the only detraction.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of the Financial District within walking distance of upscale shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel on the weekend for two.
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I were greeted at the valet car drop off with prompt service. They took my keys and away we went to check in. The staff were fast, efficient and very friendly. We were delighted to see we had a very clean room and a descent view of the financial district. We had only one minor setback, we had the toilet over flow on us and the hotel staff came to our rescue with immediate attention. They quickly mopped up the mess with friendly and sincere service. We had three great nights of restful sleeping. Rooms are very quiet and spacey. I love this place. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and friendly staff were great. Very clean and spacey rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was a bit expensive but I guess that's what you pay for in the big city.
review.locationRemarks: I love the location of this hotel . Right smack dab in the Financial district.

review.title: Parking is $48 a night on weekdays
review.reviewText:
When we booked online, Expedia described this hotel as bein in the fishermans wharf vicinity
It is not, it's in the financial district. The hotel staff gladly took our car for valet, saying that was the only option, and not telling us the price. The cost to us was $28 the first night....expensive but expected. The second night hiked up to a price of $48 at time of checkout, which was non-negotiable. Just a hidden cost planted in our faces. Very disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: Financial district. Away from most attractions

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel, right in the middle of the Financial District. The location was really convenient the cable car stops right on the corner. My only complaint was the outside noise and we were on the top floor and the food was a little pricey. I would suggest requesting an inside room, the windows are high so there is no view anyway. The staff was exceptional, catering to our every request. I would surely stay here again when vacationing in San Francisco. There were a few surprise charges, like who charges for internet anymore nowadays??? And if you park a car, make sure you do all your running around in one trip, they charge more if you take your car out more than once a day. BUMMER!! But overall, this was an excellent hotel and clean as a whistle!!
review.locationRemarks: Great location.....

review.title: Relaxing at the Omni
review.reviewText: Very pleased with our stay.Room is just the right size and impressively clean...thanks Jiao!Friendly and helpful staff.Definitely coming back to the Omni when in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness of our room.Prompt service with every request.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access

review.title: Amazing hotel with quiet rooms.
review.reviewText:
The Omni San Francisco exceeded my desire for a relaxing vacation. Professional front desk, polite room staff and very clean gym. The rooms provided an well needed escape from the hustle and bustle of the city as they were rather quiet and had comfortable beds.

Great breakfast options on surrounding streets for those who don't want a hotel breakfast and want to pop over to Starbucks, Peets or McDonalds.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were quiet, clean and amazing beds!
review.locationRemarks: Directly on California Street allowing for easy access to the Cable Car and Taxis. Short walk to China Town and Union Square.

review.title: Stay at the Omni! you won't be disapointed.
review.reviewText: My wife and I booked this hotel for a couples getaway. Even though it's in the Financial District, it has easy access to Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown and Little Italy. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends and family. The hotel is impeccably maintained and the staff was very friendly and helpful with suggestions for activities, food, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost (a little pricey, but worth the treat)
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown and Little Italy.

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: Could not cool the room down, never felt comfortable. Staff was fantastic as usual. Waited 40 minutes for a bellman upon checkout called 3 separate times.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality and training of staff, really superb
review.negativeRemarks: Aircon in room, shortage of bellmen
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel for a family.
review.reviewText: The staff is wonderful. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. This was our first stay here and it lived up to all the great reviews. With two kids, they provided us milk and cookies each day! Who does that? It's the little things like this too that made our stay a great one.
review.locationRemarks: Very near Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf so it was convenient.

review.title: A very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay! Staff was great, room was clean and a great location!
review.positiveRemarks: When we came in from a day of sightseeing there was fresh fruit and citrus iced tea waiting for us in the lobby!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was not included and no microwave in the room.
review.locationRemarks: California and Montgomery-not far from BART and a cable car line was right outside. Close to Chinatown.

review.title: It was a very short stay, but the staff was very f
review.reviewText: It was a very short stay, but the staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very nice experience
review.reviewText: Great cost/benefits ratio. Very well located, walking distance or easy public transportation access to most places of interest. Very well trained and helpful personeel. Multipurpose hotel (great for families, couples or business). If taking Calcar from or to the airport, better using Embarcadero Bart and not Powell Bart
review.locationRemarks: Superb!

review.title: San Francisco Omni Review
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco on a 40th anniversary trip, and stayed at the Omni based on Expedia customer recommendations. We were not disappointed. The room was clean and the staff was very courteous and attentive. They surprised us with complimentary chocolate covered strawberries and champagne on our anniversary, and they were very helpful with dining and other recommendations throughout our stay. Our only nitpicks: the room temperature was a little hard to regulate, and there was not much of a view due to taller buildings even though we were on the 16th floor.
review.locationRemarks: In the San Francisco financial district amidst a lot of taller buildings.

review.title: A sanctuary
review.reviewText:
Was very impressed. Perfect location to walk everywhere, comfy and clean rooms. Quality amenities ( towels, pillows, etc)
Very friendly and helpful staff.
Loved it!

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: Great place . Location is very good for walking . Could use an iPod dock in room.

review.title: Great City Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful city hotel. Concierge and staff were the best I've experienced, knowledgeable and friendly. Room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Walkable to most areas - central location for cable car, trolly or taxi. Valet parking was a little expensive. I would stay here on any other trip to San Francisco.

review.title: great hotel for a weekend
review.reviewText: The omni was a great choice for a couples weekend in san Francisco. It's located in the financial district, an easy walk to the Ferry building, union square, and a nice leisurely walk to fishermans wharf. The staff is incredibly helpful and proffessional.

review.title: Guest Service comes first!
review.reviewText:
Staff was incredible with my elderly and handicapped
Mother in law. They made sure to get her a shower with grab bars and at reception they had a wheel chair waiting for her to help her get from the lobby to her room!
The only request was we did ask for and pay for a higher floor and the 13th floor we didn't have a view. Our view was looking into another building.
review.negativeRemarks: Tough to maneuver one way streets in area
review.locationRemarks: Get room higher up so you have a view

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: They gave us a better room that we booked at no extra charge. Everything is beautiful, from the floor, to wall papers and all the details. Great location, wonderful energy! Thank you to all staff memebers.

review.title: Excellent service ugly matress
review.reviewText: The hotel is on a good location, better for business than truism. The staff is very good as in awry omni I haves stayed. The only thing I an conplain is that the bed matress is not comfortable, neither the pillows.
review.locationRemarks: Is a good location in San Fran downtown

review.title: Great hotel for a San Francisco city tour
review.reviewText: The hotel is really located in a strategic area of the San Francisco for family visiting the city. We enjoyed our stay in the hotel. There is no view from the rooms, but this is not a problem since we were in the middle of San Francisco. The room was clean but could be bigger. It is important to notice that hotel has only vallet parking.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in the middle of the city nearby of everything you may visit in the city.

review.title: Great hotel!!!!
review.reviewText: This is a GREAT HOTEL. The room service was very expensive though. I loved my overall stay.

review.title: Positive experience
review.reviewText: After reading the previous reviews we were expecting excellent service and we were not disappointed. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The overall level of comfort of the hotel was impressive.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

review.title: Great couples getaway
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent our 11th anniversary in San Francisco, staying at the Omni. We loved the location, and the hotel was beautiful. The room was comfortable and clean, and the staff friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay at the Omni again!
review.locationRemarks: Central to downtown, easy access to public transportation.

review.title: wonderful
review.reviewText: Wonderful, Parking was expensive prices, this observation the only

review.title: Worst I have been in
review.reviewText:
Staff was extremely rude. Room, considering this is a 4.7 star hotel, is obsurb. Motel 6 is better. No toiliets, etc.
Very, very disappointed.

review.title: Omni Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Omni hotel is fabulous, very stylish, comfortable, clean and has excellent customer service. The foyer of the hotel is gorgeous and has the most amazing chandeliers and floral arrangements. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and it was a real pleasure to stay there.The hotel is in the financial district of San Francisco but Fisherman's Wharf is easily accessible by tram or a 30 minute walk, Union Square with its abundance of shops and the Ferry building and Embarcadero are a 10 minute walk away. There are many restaurants in the vicinity to meet everyones requirements. You won't be disappointed if you stay at the Omni hotel and I would highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Customer Service is excellent as is the room cleanliness, comfort and facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise is a bit of a problem.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything a tourist would want to see whilst in San Francisco

review.title: No Views
review.reviewText: Room had a view of offices and other hotel rooms - not good.

review.title: Well Managed Centrally Located Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in the Financial District so we did not need to rent a car. Lots of nearby restaurants and shopping. Walk to Chinatown, Cable cars right out front door. Hotel staff was very helpful. Room did not have a great view, everything else was superb. Coffee was hot and ready in lobby, Cappucchino machine in room. Fresh fruit and Tea or Lemonade was available during the day. No worries.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of financial district.

review.title: Excellant Hotel and very Central Location
review.reviewText: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and gave us some excellent information. The doormen were wonderful in providing excellent choices for breakfast & dinner. Our room was located on the 12th floor (1229) and it was extremely quiet which is something I requested amenities were super. The only problem for us was that the temp in the room didn't feel cold enough even though we had to set the thermostat at 64 degrees. Another glitch, we arrived early, 12:20 pm and our room was not ready until a little past 4pm. We were able to visit the city, Ferry Building, and then return and were provided with complimentary drink and appetizer until our room was ready.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, cable car runs in front of hotel

review.title: would stay at again
review.reviewText: fantastic experience. very helping staff and concierge. room cleans and food service was also very good. traffic a bit crazy during daytime but overall really lovely place

review.title: Go to the omni!
review.reviewText: The staff and rooms were excellent Go to bobs steak and chop house and ask of Aaron. Make sure you ask the front desk for the three day trolley pass.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley line stops right by the hotel.

review.title: Top Shelf Service
review.reviewText: They were very welcoming and made our SFO stay fantastic. I would pay more to stay with OMNI where available. Their service was superb.

review.title: Love this hotel!!!
review.reviewText:
staff extremely helpful, great location, beautiful rooms
would definitely stay there again

review.title: would go again
review.reviewText: Great location, nice rooms, friendly and attentive staff. The quality to cost ratio was great. My only complaints are that the maid service came into my room one day when I had a do not disturb sign up and the room service/restaurant is on the expensive side.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel...but expect to pay a lot for parking!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and service!! Staff is so friendly!
review.negativeRemarks: Paying way too much for parking...48 dollars a day...are you kidding???
review.locationRemarks: Central to Union Square, China Town, Embarcadero, and Little Italy

review.title: 1st class hotel
review.reviewText: This is a 1st class hotel, the service they provide along with all the staffs attitude being excellent makes them number one in my book. From the time we arrived in the valet line to the time we checked out the staff took care of us. This hotel definitely carries high standards when it comes to taking care of there guest. I am a very picky, hard to please person and I have no complaints. I will be returning to this hotel on future stays.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Omni. Staff friendly and helpful. Very comfortable beds. Bobs steakhouse had great food. Location is excellent, central to wharf, ferries, chinatown and Market street shops.
review.negativeRemarks: No swimming pool, but very good gym.
review.locationRemarks: Great, central, close to many attractions

review.title: Omni not for families
review.reviewText: The Omni is beautiful but a bit stuffy and very expensive.

review.title: Good place to sleep
review.reviewText:
This is best suited as a business hotel. I was there on vacation because of its fairly easy access to the bay bridge, but still not too far from dining destinations.
The bed was perfect with great pillows, but the overall feel was of a generic business hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel in Northeast SF
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel located in the financial district, which is walking distance to the Embarcadero and several very good upscale restaurants. Quick valet parking solves the parking problem, but the price is high, even for SF ( $48/ night). Overall, the hotel is one of the best in NE SF

review.title: Great hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText:
Excellent hotel. Signed up for a free rewards program and they even ironed 2 peices of clothes for free and shined my shoes! The bed was super comfy. The room was small, but considering it was in San Francisco it was average, but furnishings were top notch.
I loved my stay there!!

review.title: Enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: Lovely, everything about it. The staff was wonderful and the room was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: highly recommend
review.reviewText: Our stay here was wonderful - friendly staff & super clean. We would also like to mention the housekeeping crew, they always left a thank you note with a smile for our tips. Would definitely recommend anyone to stay here.
review.locationRemarks: could be better, but we found everything accessible anyway

review.title: Worth a stay
review.reviewText:
A lovely hotel with 24 hour door security and front desk. Hotel is located in banking district so not too touristy. Was ok for me as was prepared to walk around the city. Chinatown is one street away. Room was very large bigger than expected, and was a nice room.
Doesn't have a your desk.
review.positiveRemarks: The pleasant look and security at front door
review.negativeRemarks: Few tourists around at this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Not in tourist area but not far from everything walk everywhere

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The concierge was exceptional. The entire staff was both friendly and very helpful. It is a beautiful hotel, with an exceptional history and a great location with access to cable cars, Nob Hill and other landmarks. My only drawback is the noise from the street, but it was minimal.

review.title: Great stay.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni on the last night of our California tour. It was a great place to stay with a great location. We had dinner in Bob's on the first floor and had a great meal. The only negative is that they charge $48 to park your car overnight. I had gotten a good deal on the hotel stay, but with this fee added on it really makes the stay way out of our budget.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great experience from check-in to check-out. The staff was incredibly friendly and gave us good recommendations for where to visit and eat. Our room was clean and comfortable and impeccably made up every afternoon. I will stay here again if I am ever back in San Francisco.

review.title: Omni Hotel - Golden Gate Bridge 75th Anniversary
review.reviewText:
We spent a very enjoyable weekend in San Francisco using the Omni as a walking base. From greeting to departure our experience was very positive. We thank Cameron and the folks at the desk for their consideration.

We had a nice room well above the street noise - we could hear the cable cars go by with the window open a bit - a fun addition really as the room was quiet when the window was closed. Great location right on the California street cable-car line; an easy walk from the Ferry Building, great restaurants etc.
review.negativeRemarks: perhaps the styling is a little old school, but the condition was fine
review.locationRemarks: great central San Francisco location

review.title: Gorgeous elegant wonderful hotel
review.reviewText:
Very very nice and attentive to our every need.
Thanks
review.locationRemarks: Very good

review.title: Great hotel for a weekend stay in the city
review.reviewText: Fabulous all around, especially the superb staff and service!

review.title: 2 Small improvements needed
review.reviewText:
The Omni was excellent - the only negative I can report is that they did not have any free bottled water in room - there should be a couple bottles for free available to guests and that Internet is not included - this is a service every Hotel at this level should have included.
If these couple of small items were included I would have given perfect 5.0 score.
At less expensive Hotels I have stayed at they offer bottled water at front desk, a couple in the room and free internet.
I realize these are small complaints - but hopefully Omni will make these small changes and improve upon a great hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Good Location, Nice Rooms and Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bottled water and Internet should be included
review.locationRemarks: Nice Location - easy walk to Square

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel was extremely nice.

review.title: Don't drink at the bar.
review.reviewText: way, way, way overpriced bar drinks.....rooms are very nice....climate controls could use work...the lobby is great....cable car stops right across the street....house car is only $50 to the airport...
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Great Hotel in SF-Close to Everything
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great lobby, excellent service and staff.

review.title: Awesome place!!
review.reviewText: A fabulous and elegant hotel to stay and enjoy your time in the city by the bay!

review.title: Amazing
review.reviewText: Exceptional service, wouldn't stay anywhere else in San Francisco! Juan (at the front desk) was fantastic! World class service, not enough good things to say!

review.title: Good location, satisfactory hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Welcoming staff. My room through Expedia was a bit dreary, but very clean. Great bathroom. The breakfast was second rate...

review.title: Standard tourist
review.reviewText:
Got at Omni because of Expedia special on the weekend, otherwise this hotel is not affordable for me. Location is a walkable distance to Warf, Chinatown, Telegraph Hill and even Lombard Street.
Hotel itself is very beautiful, very well maintained and its stuff is excellent. I forgot a few things in the car, which was parked at the valet parking, and had them delivered into my room on two occasions. Whether you ask for city information or any other question  everything is answered with professional courtesy and consideration.
Omni is situated in the financial district; therefore all eateries around hotel are closed Saturday and Sunday. Since Hotels restaurant was too expensive for us, we were going to a few nearest Starbucks for breakfast.
Overall experience with Omni was great and I am looking forward to use this hotel in particular and other Omni locations elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Interior design and valet parking, Hotel's stuff is excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Most eateries around the Hotel are closed on the weekend
review.locationRemarks: Cable car is in front of the hotel, safe and close ( by walk) to main attractions of San Francisco

review.title: Omni is a wonderful hotel
review.reviewText:
It was wonderfully days staing in this hotel
Next time I ll stay here

review.title: Not bad for the price point
review.reviewText: Nice hotel located in the financial district within a five minute walk of Union Square and two minutes from the nearest BART station (Montgomery St). The staff at The Omni were very helpful, the room was spacious and well adorned (desk, ottoman and toiletries were bonuses), and free apples and iced tea was a nice touch. My only gripes would be the lack of free WiFi (reserved for loyalty members) and the hotel restaurant where I paid $16 for granola and yoghurt and $5 each for coffee and juice. Better to head down California Street to La Boulange.

review.title: My Stay
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with this hotel. Enjoyed my stay.

review.title: A Truly Amazing Hotel Experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel understands their business, customer service.... From our early check-in (where we were given instruction on cable cars, great concierge advice for an outstanding dinner in China Town, to a clean, quiet, and updated room, my wife and I agree the hotel does everything possible to provide outstanding service to their customers.

The hotel is beautiful, the service is grand, and the experience totally exceeded my expecations. A tremendous value for the price.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, helpful staff, great rooms, good location. We would definitely book again if visiting San Francisco.
Only negative comment was that the room overlooked the street and the 'noisy' Bin collection occured very early in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: In Finacial District but close enough to all major attractions

review.title: Good choice for downtown SF
review.reviewText: The Hotel is only three blocks from the Trans Am building. The nearest Starbucks is across the street from the Trans Am building. The neighbourhood looks good and feels safe. There was no noise from the street. The hotel lobby was elegant but our room was only good. Unfortunately, our room faced the roof of the lobby and very little outside light got in so I can't rate it higher. The valet and the staff working the entrance were exceptional. We were late for a dinner reservation and they promptly called us a cab and gave us the directions. I would recommend this for anyone going to conferences. You'll get a good night sleep (the bed was comfortable) and you can avoid some of the street issues that some of the other hotels have. The staff are also really great and you'll want a team like this working for you if you need something last minute for your work.

review.title: Great location, You won't be disappointed.
review.reviewText: Located in the much quieter (on the weekend) financial district - but still close to BART, embarcadero & Union square hotel. Priced well and convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, convenience and a lot quieter.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a lot of eateries and hotspots within easy walking distance (ie. couple of blocks) of hotel.
review.locationRemarks: We usually stay in the Union Square district. A lot more traffic, noise & sirens. The Omni was nice, quiet and very convenient.

review.title: Perfect hotel!
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful stay with caring, knowledgeable, and polite staff who really went the extra mile. We were there over Easter and the staff hid easter eggs all over the lobby for kids to find as they went through.
review.positiveRemarks: Cookies and milk in our room everyday.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to BART, Muni, and lots of buses. Cable car line is outside front door.

review.title: lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel in great location. Room had more space than expected, was very comfortable
and clean with comfortable beds. Service was great and hotel downstairs has great food for
breakfast and dinner. Noise from streets can be heard in some rooms - but mostly from the cable cars and rowdy people. And it was only occasional. Would stay here again over the
Fairmount.
review.locationRemarks: Close to chinatown and the Tonga Room in the Fairmount

review.title: Friendly, classical, little gloomy
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. However the rooms on top floor have very small windows starting from almost 5 feet height and its very noisy too. After I was given a room on that floor, I requested a change. My room was changed to another one on the 5th floor with large windows. Even though the second room was much closer to the street it was surprisingly quieter. The rooms look nice but theyre sort of gloomy too, even the second one. I would rather a more modern hotel with more light, such as Le Meridien which is also nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Amazing place! Excellent service. Parking is a bit expensive, but it's SF. Would recommend highly to anyone looking for a great stay!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, great location.

review.title: Great Staff.
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, friendly staff. Especially the doormen, great people always willing to have a chat with you while you wait for a taxi or come back from a Giants game. Will be coming back the next time i'm in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to China Town and Market St.

review.title: Maybe not the best for kids, families in one room
review.reviewText: Location is great... right on Chinatown, walking distance to Union shopping, short cab to Wharf, on California cable car line. Hotel is beautiful. The rooms are clean. The double rooms however have double sized beds, not queen (which we're used to when staying in double rooms), so a bit of a squeeze when traveling with kids. Our little ones are 3 and 6, and I couldn't trust them to sleep together on such a narrow high bed, so we shared and it wasn't really comfortable. The beds only had 2 small pillows each, which again seems not up to standard. The kids liked other places we've stayed (pools, buffet breakfasts, etc) better than this, but it's nice for adults.
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Great hotel with bad mandatory valet service
review.reviewText:
The hotel it self was really nice and located in the center of San Francisco.
That being said, we had bad experience with the mandatory valet parking service the hotel is using.
When we've got our car back we've notice scratches on the back bumper which weren't there before. The valet service manager said that they did a damage inspection when we checked our car in and these scratches were there.
I'm not really sure what is the point of doing damage inspection where we weren't there and when the car the includes the inspections results is at the valet service office at all time.
Eventually we filed a claim (which will probably be declined) and this experience really bummed us.
I would recommend making sure you see what the valet parking service writes in the damage inspection card or even better, park in one of the many parking garages around the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Canter of San Francisco, walking distance from most of the main downtown attractions

review.title: Great family choice
review.reviewText: A great central location for our family - with two teenage boys. Hotel a little dated/traditional according to viewpoint and the 2 double bedded room might have been a bit larger. Otherwise perfect for our stay. Facilities and staff were excellent and what fantastic value with Expedia!
review.locationRemarks: Walk to anywhere - if not, jump on the cable car outside or streetcar by the Ferry Building. Easy!

review.title: Best hotel ever!
review.reviewText: The staff was always available and friendly, especially the door men, They were always available to call us cabs and they always welcomed us back when returned to the hotel. The rooms are well insulated for noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Chairs in room not very comfortable and I wish they had two queen bed instead of full.
review.locationRemarks: Worked great for us. The area was clean. Close to good food.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: I had a very short stay at this hotel for a business trip. The room was nice but the first thing I noticed was a huge stain on the sheets. Disgusting! Also, the street noise was so loud it would wake me up in the night. I would only stay here again if I could get a room off the main road.

review.title: Friendly and gracious
review.reviewText: A gracious and friendly hotel with a beautiful lobby and comfortable (if not extravagant) rooms and a location equally walkable to the Embarcadero/Ferry Building, SFMoMA/Yerba Buena, and Market Street/Union Square shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful lobby, super friendly doormen, convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: A lot of outdoor noise was audible in theroom
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Embarcadero/Ferry Bldg and SFMoMA/Yerba Buena areas, convenient for shopping. Not right next to most public transport but manageable.

review.title: Omni San Francisco
review.reviewText: Because the Omni is located in the heart of San Fran's financial district I was skeptical about how child friendly it was. We took our 10 and 8 year olds over Easter weekend. They had a blast!! The staff was great and made a big deal over them. There were plastic eggs hidden in the lobby on Easter and every night the kids had milk and cookies waiting for them in the room. The hotel was immaculate and the staff was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very helpful and super friendly
review.locationRemarks: great location for touristy things; North Beach, Ferry Landing, Union Square and Chinatown

review.title: Ruined My Engagement
review.reviewText: Requested a bottle of champagne so when I came back from dinner I could propose to my girlfriend. There was no champagne but a cleaning lady did interrupt us mid proposal and stuck around for 15 minutes for turn down service. Called down to the desk to let them know and never got any apology or compensation.

review.title: Does it come any better!
review.reviewText: One of te best hotels overall that we've stayed in!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Friendly and courteous service- Close distance to tourist attractions

review.title: SF Stay
review.reviewText: Excellent experience, the rooms and the overall hotel was amazing

review.title: Look no further..
review.reviewText: Excellent stay. Helpful service from entire staff. Great location.

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText: Great location and price. Not far from pier 39 and shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: Free milk at cookies delivered to my room nightly
review.negativeRemarks: No guest parking. I had to valet my car for a price everyday I was there

review.title: Fabulous experience..
review.reviewText:
I split hot cocoa in front of my door...I Called guest services to report the accident and they were more concerned about me and whether I was alright then having to clean up the mess.
I can honestly not think of one thing to complain about...well worth every penny..you get what you pay for and here more..
I will always want to come back...great service, professional staff but also friendly...
Wonderful stay in this beautiful hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: location was centrally located within walking distance to everything

review.title: Lovely stay
review.reviewText: There was a charge for internet in the room, which I found to be a bit outdated, but as most people have internet via their phone or a portable hotspot, it wasn't a big issue. Very convenient location, and very helpful staff!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Nice hotel, okay for a weekend
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very nice. The room was mostly comfortable (a bit warm, but the windows opened). The housekeeping staff put me off a bit: they tried to clean the room early on Sunday morning (I forgot to leave the "do not disturb" sign out). Then when I left in the afternoon and was gone for a few hours, after calling to say they could get in to clean, it still wasn't made up. Of course, soon after my return, they showed up to clean. Sigh.

Other than that, though, the hotel was great. Doormen to open the front door, good help from the front desk.

The only downside to staying there on a weekend is that the financial district is pretty much dead. And it's not as close to the Ferry Building as I'd thought. Walkable, but a long walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Well maintained. Doormen who actually open the door!
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping staff were slow to respond.
review.locationRemarks: The financial district is dead on the weekend.

review.title: Business made pleasurable
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco on a short business trip. The hotel location is very convenient for needing to run around the downtown core. The staff are quite accommodating and helpful. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and the food is good so I would stay there again.

review.title: great location, service, but disappointing room
review.reviewText: rooms need to be updated. especially a comfortable chair for a workspace...

review.title: Excellent choice for Downtown stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location for downtown, very comfortable room and pleasant staff. We went out for meals so didnt try the restaruant. I'm sure the food is good but prices were all high end, even for a basic sandwhich so plan accordingly. There are plenty of options within walking distance in any direction. We loved the place and will definately stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location, easy walk to shops, ferry building or BART

review.title: Beyond friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: The valets, front desk, and welcome committee really made a positive first impression--especially with our children! Upon arriving, not only was our luggage handled, and car parkes (as expected), but it was done in a very friendly manner. All of this amidst 5pm Friday rush hour chaos in San francisco's Financial District. The staff greeted our somewhat overwhelemd young children with iced tea, jelly beans, and a Omni Kids Backpack of activities, all before we had even checked in. The hotel's location is superb and everyone was extremely helpful. The 6pm cookies/milk delivery caught us, pleasantly, by surprise...
review.positiveRemarks: How were were welcomed, the staff
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were nice. Our upgraded deluxe room was still a bit cramped.
review.locationRemarks: Superb. especially if you like the trolly cars that literally go in front of the hotel on the california line.

review.title: Exceptional Staff at a Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: We followed the many reviews on Trip Advisor when booking this hotel and can concur with the hundreds of glowing reports. We couldn't fault our stay. The beds are so heavenly you'll find it hard to leave! Great location with regards to sightseeing, shops and restaurants. This is one hotel I look forward to revisiting in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The quality service provided by all staff members. The Doormen/Bellmen are wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: We have absolutely no complaints from our 3 night stay.
review.locationRemarks: Superb location to restaurants, shops and sightseeing. Highly recommend the nearby Italian Restaurant "Taverna" in Belden Lane (one street over).

review.title: Washington,DC
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is amazing and very professional! They are extremely child friendly and make each child feel like a special guest. The location is great. We will definitely stay here again the next time we visit San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the property itself.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco was the best hotel experience I have ever had - and I've stayed at A LOT of 4-5 star hotels around the world, even a lot of Omnis. Incredible service from start to finish. Where do I begin? My husband and I arrived at our room to the happy surprise that we had been upgraded from a standard room to a massive and beautiful corner suite. We felt like royalty the whole time we were there - every time we passed by the front desk or concierge, they were smiling and checking that we were happy (we were). They recommended a couple of excellent restaurants to us. The housekeeping staff left us nice personal handwritten notes just saying that it was a pleasure to help us and thanking us graciously for the tips we left them! Fresh orchids in the bathroom were beautiful. Doormen were among the most attentive and friendliest I have met, running to be sure they got the door for us and always with a friendly "welcome back!" As we departed, we mentioned we needed a cab to the airport. The doorman put us in a limo for the same cost as the cab and gave us a hug as we left! I actually looked at my husband as we left and joked, "why am I being treated so well here - am I dying?" A nearly unbelievable, impeccable hotel experience. Many, many thanks, Omni San Francisco! We will be back for sure.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location in the center of everything.

review.title: Best in San Francisco in our opinion
review.reviewText: Wonderful room, great service, could not be much better. Prefer to the Ritz-Carlton

review.title: Top Notch and Great Location
review.reviewText: From a former San Fran resident, this is one of my favorite hotels to stay in on visits back. Classically appointed hotel within walking distance of union square. Only a few blocks from the Saturday farmer's market in the Ferry Building - a must do weekend experience. The room was beautifully furnished with a super comfortable mattress. The staff - bell hops, concierge, check-in - are all super attentive and helpful. Got a killer expedia deal and couldn't believe my luck.
review.negativeRemarks: No views but when you're in San Fran, who sits in the room?
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown

review.title: Layover in SF
review.reviewText: Great location. Very nice rooms, great centralized location for anything in the city.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
In downtown financial district, very nice business hotel. The staff is very attentive.

Highly recommended

review.title: Early checking. Delight
review.reviewText: Especially appreciate the very. Early checkin was a real help to me
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: wonderful, thoughtful staff
review.reviewText: wonderful staff. remembered all my requests. room service and maid service greeted me by name. lovely room. took extra care of me after my surgery.
review.positiveRemarks: arrived sick and was sent chicken soup
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: This was a GREAT hotel and right across the street from the merchants exchange (thats where i had a meeting)

review.title: Omni SF
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. The hotel was very clean and centrally located. We will definitely stay again.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Good recs!
review.reviewText: This is a great location. Close to Chinatown. Got a great recommendation for a restaurant from the front desk. Location is close to financial district, so I would recommend for business.

review.title: Omni Awsome!
review.reviewText: Walking into the hotel there is a gorgeous lobby. The staff is very kind and helpful with your luggage and even offered hot apple cider. The rooms have a home like feel and tastefully decorated. The only thing I can say about the cleanliness is they need to wipe down the fingerprints that were on the bathroom door. It may have been from someone reading a newspaper. Other than that the room was very clean. On our departure day they let us have a late checkout so my mom could rest, she was suffering from a nasty flu. And they were very helpful with getting the luggage out for her when I returned to pick her up after my doctors appt. Overall, I would defintely stay at the Omni again!!

review.title: The best hotel recommendations
review.reviewText: We arrived New Year's Eve to celebrate our anniverary. That evening my wife's elderly mother had to go to the ER by ambulance. We were 4 hours away and fielded many phone calls. Thankfully, everything worked out ok and she returned home in a few hours. In the meantime we cancelled our dinner reservations to a very great restaurant in the city downtown. In the middle of all the phone calls there was a knock on the door. The staff sent a bottle of champagne, bon bons, chocolate covered strawberries, and a lovely note to wish us a wonderful anniversary. Needless to say we were a bit verklempt. What an emotional roller coaster! We decided to order dinner from room service. We splt the 22 oz. Kansas City strip steak dinner. We were flabbergasted at the food!! We could not have had a better celebration. Our room was on the top floor [17th] looking over the city toward Alcatraz. What a gorgeous view. The city lights were beautiful. Our room was recently renovated so that everything was new. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. We were in a very quiet room besides. We usually come once a year and we have stayed in many hotels in SF but this beats them all!
review.positiveRemarks: The people. The entire staff were warm and welcoming. The gorgeous and most comfortable room with the view. The food. What more can I say?
review.negativeRemarks: Very pricey valet parking. We parked across the street in a secure lot...much cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: We parked and walked everywhere.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Just stayed here last week with our young child and it was wonderful. The hotel is kept very well, feels warm and homely and the staff is friendly and helpful. Its centrally located near Chinatown, Cable Cars and other public transportation. I would definitely recommend it. Only negative I would say is that there aren't any food options besides room service or the Steakhouse but not so bad if you don't mind walking a few blocks or taking public transportation which was fine for us.

review.title: Wonderful Time and Satisfaction in this Hotel
review.reviewText: Me, my wife and 2 kids stayed here for five days and four nights.We really had a wonderful time during our stay in this hotel. All the people working here is very friendly and treat us very well and with a warm smile. I can say that the staff here is well train. My family likes one guy who worked there with the name "ADAMS", because of being his concern with us, especially when my wife catch a cold during our stay in San Francisco ( he gave my wife a mint tea to drink ), we really appreciate his kindness. The place is very close in every tourist spot. Every place in this hotel is clean and the room smells good. What we also like is, the location is safe and quiet. We are very satisfied in this hotel, and I can say that this is a perfect place to stay in San Francisco while having a vacation with your family. All thumbs up in this hotel. All we can say to the staff of this hotel is, keep up the good work and the cleanliness of this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff being friendly and the cleanliness of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. Safe and quiet. Close to fishermans wharf, golden gate bridge, bay brige, china town, little tokyo etc.

review.title: Gorgeous hotel
review.reviewText: We thought that we are lucky because this hotel looks gorgeous although the price is very low. We could enjoy city life of San Francisco.

review.title: Excellence in San Francisco
review.reviewText: One of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in; in San Francisco or elsewhere. The staff commitment to service and quality is readily apparent, and hotel amenities are wonderful. I would highly recommend the Omni for any stay: business or pleasure.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to all major destination points in San Francisco.

review.title: High fees for internet and parking.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very convenient location for sightseeing and is very comfortable. The hotel charges a lot for internet use and parking. I paid $125 extra at the end of a three day stay for these amenities which I thought were over-priced.

review.title: Fantastic place for couples!!
review.reviewText: My wife and I came here to celebrate our anniversary. We decided to ask if any suites were available for our stay. Not only were they available but the front desk gave use and upgrade free of charge!! The one bedroom suite was fantastic. The staff throughout the hotel was very professional friendly over the course of our two day stay. We did not try the restaurant this time but enjoyed it thoroughly the last time we stayed at the hotel. This was not the first time I stayed here but it'll definitely not be the last time I go.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are superb. I love everything about them.
review.locationRemarks: South of downtown napa further from the wineries than some of the other hotels. But you appreciate the peacefulness there.

review.title: Lovely hotel & staff
review.reviewText: We had a lovely 1 night stay as part of our honeymoon. Staff are kind & friendly, and the hotel lobby is beautiful. X

review.title: I will go back!!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Good food, clean rooms and quiet.

review.title: Wonderful. Thanks for taking care of me.
review.reviewText: Felt at home immediately. Staff suggestions were fantastic. I'm a convert.
review.locationRemarks: My six mile run along the waterfront at 35 degrees was a pleasu and only minutes from Omn. Client proxminity was within 3-blocks. I'll be back.

review.title: "Will do this Hotel Again-Anyday"
review.reviewText: Housekeeping was Exceptional, first time I have ever received a Welcome Note, and exit note....Also, they did a great job with housekeeping....

review.title: Great service.
review.reviewText: We found the staff to be uniformly friendly and helpful, quick to respond to our requests. The whole movie system was out of operation, and to compensate, they provided us with a DVD player, along with complementary popcorn, soda and chocolate cake. We were first given a room on the 17th floor, and found it claustrophobic(small room, tiny windows), but requested another room, and it was fine. We will return, mostly because of the service the staff provided.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic time here over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel was beautiful with a giant Christmas tree, there were gingerbread men and cider in the lobby each night, we went on a free walking tour of Chinatown (free tours depart from the lobby every Saturday), and we got a great deal on Expedia - in short, we couldn't be more pleased! Everyone we encountered, from the front desk to the cleaning staff, was extremely friendly and the location is so convenient. This is an excellent hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Embarcadero/Ferry Building, Japantown, Union Square/Yerba Buena

review.title: FIRST CLASS SERVICE AND EXPERIENCE
review.reviewText: Loved my stay at the Omni. Gracious staff and comfortable room.

review.title: Omni SF does it with a smile!
review.reviewText: Every step of our experience with Omni SF was a pleasant one. Friendly and helpful staff. Well maintained property from entrance to room to fitness facility. Would not hesitate to recommend.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. 5 star service.

review.title: Marco
review.reviewText: Amazing

review.title: First time to San Fran success!
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location of downtown. Super clean and nice vibe from hotel staff.

review.title: Elegence and style meet relaxation
review.reviewText: this was an awesome hotel with awesome customer service. We were treated extremely well with a very peronable touch. Hand written notes from hotel employees, etc. They made sure the birthday weekend was special and we will most definitely be going back!

review.title: SUPER FRIENDLY HOTEL
review.reviewText: Can't say anything bad about this hotel. Staff was super friendly and informative. Accommodations were awesome, great gym and great shopping and dining all around.

review.title: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We were very impressed with the hotel overall.

There were a couple minor things to note.
One, when we checked in, around midnight on a Thursday, there was no hotel personnel to help with the luggage, etc.
We were dropped off at the hotel by a taxi and no one opened the door or helped us with our suitcases. The only person was at the check in counter.
During the day there were always plenty of hotel employees around but at night it gets very sparse.

Another thing that happened: a friend of ours sent a small perishable gift to us as a surprise and it took a couple days to get to us because of some confusion.
They held it in the kitchen for us but we were not notified directly except there was a flashing light on the phone and the message was not clear at all.

Besides these minor issues, we had a great time at the hotel.
Everyone was very nice, knowledgable and courteous.

review.title: Nice enough
review.reviewText: The financial district is no great draw, but we just needed a room. Nice enough place. The one frustrating thing was the AC, which cycled off and on non-stop.

review.title: Lovely place to stay on San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great quality and service

review.title: Will stay again!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, will definitely go back to stay!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. Parking is expensive, but it is everywhere in SF.

review.title: Perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, excellent service, fine room. Will stay here as often as possible.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was lovely. The room was clean and large with a flat screen HD TV. A cable car ran right in front of the hotel so it was very easy to get around. The restaurant in the hotel was expensive and the food was OK, but there are so many great restaurants in the city you need not eat there. The most impressive part of the hotel was how great the service was. The staff just couldn't do enough for the guests. I would go back anytime.

review.title: Satisfied Customer
review.reviewText: The service and staff were exceptional. The room could have used another chair or at least an ottoman,but considering the size of the room this may not have been possible. The location was great for the things we wanted to do.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Unparalleled Service
review.reviewText: THe SF Omni is a modern but old world gem. The service is among the best we have had in our many years of worldwide travel. The rooms were extremely comfortable. The decor is classically elegant. The restaurant had amazing food and some of the most friendly wait staff. We had drinks in the bar and loved sitting in front of the enourmous windows at a busy Financial District intersection people-watching in one of the most interesting US cities. I can't wait to go back.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Great location and service at this hotel. Very classy decor and furniture. Only drawback is the plumbing. The shower water pressure was very low and temperatures fluctuate...make it difficult to have a good hot shower.

review.title: Great customer service!
review.reviewText: Great experience. Fabulous customer service.

review.title: Absolutely Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The customer service at the Omni was out of this world, every single employee we interacted with was nothing but friendly and helpful. The hotel was super clean, super convenient, and gorgeous. We will definitely be staying here again!

review.title: Staff very helpful
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, room kind of small but we had three people in one room. The thing that stood out most was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. From the front desk staff to the maid to the door man, everyone was professional and helpful. Couldn't find better.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: My stay at the Omni was great......the staff were most accommodating and the room was clean and spacious. The location was wonderful with lots of nearby attractions and easy access to transportation! I highly recommend the Omni for your stay in San Francisco!!

review.title: Great Location, Rooms a bit dated
review.reviewText: Liked the hotel, rooms were a bit dated with a funky old smell, but the staff and location made up for it's cons.

review.title: A Wonderful Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco was absolutely a wonderful hotel in which to stay. The personnel at the hotel could not have been any nicer. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Best Value For Money
review.reviewText:
I have stayed in some of the finest and some of the worst hotels in the world, and this is one of the best value for money hotels that I have experienced.

The rooms are quite comfortable though nothing spectacular, but the service is phenomenal. The staff were all excellent.

The location is very good as well - convenient to the Financial District, Chinatown, and key transit lines.

Next time we are in San Francisco, we will stay here for sure.

review.title: Impressed with hotel but not with restaurant
review.reviewText: This hotel is everything you would expect in a top rated hotel. All staff were friendly , knowledgeable, and very helpful. The hotel and room was very clean. Maid and door service was excellent. Downside to this hotel is their prices for food and drinks. Extremely overpriced for extremely average /below average food. Would not recommend eating or drinking at this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very warm welcome at the reception and helpful hints about where to go, what to see and how to get around. Very clean room & bathroom. Quiet hotel in nice district ideal for families. Not far from any of the attractions. Would recommend to family & friends.

review.title: Couldn't be more satisfied with the Omni!
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Omni Hotel in San Francisco was exceptional. It is walking distance (30 minutes or less) from many of the major attractions of San Francisco, eg. The Ferry Terminal, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, and Little Italy. The staff at the Omni were more than willing to help with directions, and restaurant reservations. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

review.title: Memorable Stay
review.reviewText: Supreme outstanding attention and service from every member of the staff we encountered. So very helpful and knowledgeable about all tourist events, best modes of travel, restaurants. Although we did not have a view (on 10th floor) except office building across the way, the room was very quiet, clean and comfortable. We intend to go back as the location was convenient and safe. Highly recommend.

review.title: Top notch service and excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service, no wonder it's up there in the rankings on tripadvisor. Superb location, walking distance to most places and if this is your first time to San Francisco, the concierge service is superb. Would come back again.

review.title: Nice hotel good location
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, room are great, great location...

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was of high quality: fruit and tea in the afternoon, impeccable room service, great bar and Bob's Restaurant had fabulous steaks. A highlight of our 3-week vacation in California.

review.title: San Francisco's best four star by far
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights at the Omni on a family vacation (with a teenager). The service was like none other -- better than any 5 star hotel I have stayed in.

review.title: OMNI Hotel SFO
review.reviewText: I was looking for lodging options between this, the Four Seasons, and other similar hotels. After reading positive review after positive review, I opted to stay here. Not only was the price considerably less expensive than most, the overall accommodations were fantastic. The staff is also top notch in that it was a pleasure to check into the hotel with them and they gave very clear and precise responses for how to leverage local transportation (which bus to catch, etc). I would not hesitate to stay here again..

review.title: I would certainly stay there again.
review.reviewText:
Just as I expected from the reviews I read. The cable car stop out front made the location very convenient for us. The staff, right from the doorman to Lex, the concierge, was extremely friendly and helpful. The neighbourhood also felt safe unlike some other areas.

The only thing I would wish for is queen-size beds instead of double beds for the 4 of us. I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: San Francisco Omni Delight
review.reviewText: Stayed here on our honeymoon as part of a trip up the Pacific Coast Highway. The hotel was delightful, very clean and well serviced. Our room was well equipped with a great view to the bay and Grace Cathedral. The concierge service was very friendly and Juan provided invaluable information about good restaurants to sample. Overall a great 4 night stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone due to its close proximity to Chinatown and North Beach ( Little Italy ). The hotel is right on California Street and step out of the front door and turn right, look up and it feels like a scene from Bullitt... About a 10 minute walk to the Ferry Building and a short tram ride takes you down to Pier 33 and 39 for Alcatraz and Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Exceeded all expectations; our new SF favorite
review.reviewText: We were extremely impressed by the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, the elegance of the property, and the excellent location. Beautiful guest room with big windows that opened, a very comfortable king-size bed, cushy reading chair with ottoman, and a lovely deep tub in the bathroom. Great front desk staff and concierge. We'll be back! Our first Omni Hotel experience; makes us want to try them in other cities.

review.title: Pretty
review.reviewText:
Everything was flawless from checkin to checkout.
The reviews which complain about construction noise across the street are valid.
However, the hotel itself is very nice, located in the financial district, and is walking distance to the pier.
The only thing that could have made it better was free parking but you can't win them all.

review.title: A reasonable stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was beautiful. It is located within walking distance of Chinatown and the staff was great.

The room was larger than some I had previously stayed in while visting San Francisco. A bit on the small side overall, but large for SF.

My only disappointment was the view. I had selected the room because it was listed as being a top floor room. It was actually a couple floors below and the view consisted of building renovations across the street. No view beyond the construction, no landmarks, no ocean.

Overall, it was a nice room...as long as you never planned to look out the window.

review.title: Not one complaint!
review.reviewText: An absolutely 1st rate hotel! Staff was the incredible! John specifically was great! Our room didnt have the greatest view and because it was our 10 year anniversary i wanted everything to be perfect. He had us moved to a new room with a view of the bay in 10 minuets!

review.title: Very nice!
review.reviewText:
We stayed for a weekend while visiting Yosemite. The checkin was fast and the people behind the desk were friendly and very helpful in looking up the location of our rental car drop off. The room was spacious, clean and luxurious (don't recommend the pricey bottles of water though, nor the non-free wi-fi).
The location is walking distance to China Town and beyond (Italian quarter, the wharf etc).
The hotel has a large fitness room with treadmills, elliptical trainers, fitted with LCDs screens, water, news paper and continuously cleaned.
Finally the early morning checkout was helped by a personal morning call and follow up call. The man behind the desk walked out with us to help us with the bags. Very nice indeed.

review.title: Excellent hospitality
review.reviewText: Hospitality by hotel staff is one of best in light of my experiences.

review.title: Fully Met Expectations
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in central location. You would think that at these prices they could at least give you free access to the "public" computer in the lobby but no, you pay to use it. Their restauant is also outrageously expensive but there are lots of other food options available within walking distance.

review.title: Generic hotel
review.reviewText: Nothing very special. They charge almost $10 per day for internet access.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with excellent hotel service. Everyone was extremely helpful. We would definately stay again. Prices at Bobs were pricey as was the $45 a day parking fee. Great downtown location. Close to China Town, and Union Square.

review.title: First Time Visit To San Francisco - Wonderful
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were very helpful and welcoming. We took our seven year old grand daughter along with us. The hotel staff were very accomodating to a childs' needs and comfort. Our grand daughter received a back pack filled with fun activities to keep her occupied during our down time and made her feel special with delivering cookies and milk in the evening.
The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet and there wasn't hallway noise while we were resting. The hotel was centrally located. We were able to walk about five big blocks to the pier. It was quite a distance to Pier 39; however, there is plenty of public transportation means to get you were you want to go. We were told it is cold-cool, most of the time in SF. Dress warm.
There is one restaurant in the hotel; very pricey. There are a lot of restaurants around the hotel, as well as at the waterfront.
Great trip. Can't wait to go again. Highly recommend the Omni hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I would totally recommand other people to stay at Omni Hotel in SF.

review.title: overnight at Omni
review.reviewText: I arrived late, stayed the night, had an early breakfast and left. So did not have much chance to check things out. But what I experienced was perfectly satisfactory -- decent lobby, good room, perfectly satisfactory breakfast, quick check out and generally helpful staff. Also, I got a very good rate. The only downside is the cable car repairs going on outside, could be noisy/disruptive during the day but it obviously won't last for ever.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a fabulous staff
review.reviewText: We were shocked at how nice this hotel was for the low price we got on Expedia. Compared to other prices we'd seen for the city, our rate was really low.
