My only suspicion for the more reasonable rate is that the Omni is in the Financial District rather than the more touristed Fisherman's Wharf or Union Square areas. The Omni is a beautiful property with a very elegant decor inside. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance and the Bart Station is also within walking distance if you take the train from the airport. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: A great place to return to after a great day in San Francisco
review.reviewText: From the moment we checked in, to the checkout (which was painless) the staff was most helpful, courteous, gracious...... it was great. The room was spacious, a hideaway bed for our college son didn't cramp our style. The bath was a room to lounge in while my sleepy heads slept. All in all great

review.title: Great hotel in San Fran!
review.reviewText: I did a lot of research prior to this trip and the Omni had the best overall combination of star rating and traveler feedback. It exceeded my expectations on all fronts! The location was perfect - walking distance to many San Fran attractions; the appearance and cleanliness of the hotel and rooms was fantastic; but most of all the staff was extremely friendly, professional and helpful. The Omni will be our hotel of choice for all future San Fran trips.

review.title: BEST LOCATION AND BEST PRICE
review.reviewText: VERY CLEAN. POLITE AND VERY HELPFUL FRONT OFFICE EMPLOYEES.GOOD LOCATION CLOSE PROXIMITY TO CHINATOWN, FISHERMAN'S WHARP, CONVENTION CENTER

review.title: Great Access to Little Italy!
review.reviewText: This hotel turned out to be in a great location. Easy walking to Chinatown and Little Italy, and a little bit longer, but pleasent walk to the Wharf. Parking and room service are both very, very expensive. I almost paid more for 3 nights parking than for my 7 day rental car. The parking was half price Fri and Sat which was welcome. However, there are lots of good restraunts, just walk down Columbus street. Only thing negative I have to say, is that I ended up getting sick, and wanted to stay an extra night, but they wanted their regular rate for the room, which was double what I had paid. I had to drive to my next stop in San Jose in pretty bad shape. Oh yeah, they offer free wifi if you sign up for their rewards program, which is free.

review.title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: Spent a weekend at the Omni. Most notable, the location - right in the middle of everything. The room was comfortable and clean. The service was efficient and friendly. Looking forward to going back.

review.title: Liked it, but not completely...
review.reviewText: Location and service was excellent. The king room was very small, with no view except to an office building. Bathrooms are lovely. Hotel was quiet; breakfast in the restaurant was average. Rate was good. I will probably look for something else next time.

review.title: "Good hotel"
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice. The location was convenient and central to the downtown area. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The staff was friendly. The staff left cookies and milk for the kids each night we were there. The kids also got goody bags when they got to the hotel.

A couple of negatives for me were that the room seemed a bit cramped for me. Maybe it's just because it's a San Francisco hotel. I'm not familiar with the other hotels there, so not sure of the sizes of the rooms in the other hotels. Also this was a room that was supposed to have 2 queen beds which I felt weren't queen, but regular sized. Finally, like most other hotels, I felt the menu was very over priced. We ate breakfast there in our final morning there. We ordered 3 kiddie meals and 1 adult meal. The portions weren't at all too large, if anything very edible. Our tab, including tip came close to $90. It was the worst $90 I've ever spent anywhere. While we were eating, I noticed a subway and regretted not spotting it sooner.

All in all, it served it's purpose. If I'm in San Francisco again, I'll check out other hotels to compare notes. This hotel didn't knock it out of the ball park for me.

review.title: Perfect for business travel
review.reviewText:
They have great people working there.
The room carpet was a little old but the room was super clean, and every building arround the hotel is taller than the hotel itself, so dont expect any sort of views.

Clean, quiet, great people

review.title: Enjoyed It
review.reviewText: Not about in your face fanciness, not necessarily best value, but everything just makes you feel comfortable, just right. A lot of times that's the best thing when travelling.

review.title: seminar king
review.reviewText:
What a treat ! The Omni was one of the nicest hotel experiences Ive had. They have meticulous attention to service like I have never seen. Friendly doorman, friendly super helpful desk staff, no lines at the desk, no waiting, beautiful and clean room. The maid even swung by one evening bringing me ice and a water....just as a courtesy.
Im in San Fran often attending conferences and will book at Omni from now on. Room rates are comparable to most other competitors, but the value and service are outstanding. Its two or three blocks from BART.
Leave your car at a BART station and take BART in to the Montgomery Station....walk a short distance to the hotel and you're set. Great restaurants within walking distance maybe 1 or 2 km. My conference was a half an hour walk....making it a wash to drive. By the time you get your car out of the garage, drive to your destination and park...you're our $ for parking and you haven't saved much time. Or take the Muni F line to Fisherman's Wharf.
Great experience, beautiful hotel, clean and spotless comfy room, tons of the usual hotel toiletries, tons of nice towels ...and robes. :o)

review.title: GREAT STAFF
review.reviewText: VERY PLEASANT HELPFUL STAFF. WE ARRIVED QUITE EARLY IN THE DAY AND THEY WERE ABLE TO ACCOMODATE US IMMEDIATELY.FRESH APPLES AND CIDER IN MAIN LOBBY WERE A NICE TOUCH. WELL WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF MANY POINTS OF INTEREST AND PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS. WE ENJOYED OUR STAY VERY MUCH.

review.title: Nice At The Omni
review.reviewText: The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The hotel is luxurious and beautiful, the rooms are not huge, but comfortable, with good mattresses and a flat-screen TV. Easy walk to Chinatown, for shopping and food. Valet parking for your car will cost $48 and SF takes about $28 in room/car tax. We stayed on the top (17th) floor, and it was quiet, even with a window opened. Avoid the $5 candy bars and $7 bottled water in the room, and if you don't want to pay $18 for a basic egg breakfast, the front desk will tell you where there is a cafe nearby. I would go back, a good value for a nice SF hotel.

review.title: can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: nice comfy beds! very quit! good times!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very comfortable and location is very convenient! We will come back!

review.title: Great stay. We will be back.
review.reviewText: We had a great stay in this hotel. convenient location (BART 5 minutes walk) and friendly staff. Will be back again.

review.title: Excellent Customer Service
review.reviewText: The Omni had the best hotel staff I have ever experienced. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great. This is definitely a step up from your typical Marriott or Hilton.

review.title: brilliant hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel in a great location. The staff were the best I've ever come across and outperform every other 5 star hotel I've stayed at-very friendly and helpful

review.title: Ok but not great
review.reviewText: The hotel currently has major construction in front of it as the trolley line is being repaired until at least June 2011. The elevators are slow. I had driven to the hotel with a vehicle that was too tall (including cargo box on top) for Valet parking. The Valet staff then directed me to a parking garage several blocks away that was not accessible either leaving me to search out my own solution over 1 hour later. The hotel does not have e-check out and thus a Saturday checkout took 20 minutes. The room was not as nice as several others I have stayed at in the financial district. I will not return.

review.title: Impressionable Stay
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed at the Omni Hotel for the first time. We had a wonderful time! Before dinner, we had cocktails in the Omni bar lounge and struck up a great conversation with the bartender. We then went to dinner at Bob's Steak and Chop House in the hotel. It was excellent! If you dare to order a dessert, beware it will easily feed four people.

The hotel is beautifully decorated, as are the rooms. We will definitely go back again.

review.title: very good experience in a beautiful city
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very nice, very well located and a very friendly staff,
the rooms are very comfortable.
We will be back.........

review.title: wonderful sf hotel
review.reviewText: great location, large quiet rooms, very helpful staff

review.title: Very, very helpful and accommodating - especially for a disabled traveller.
review.reviewText: Exceeded expectations at all levels. Especially helpful staff - from doormen staff to housekeeping to restaurant personnel, I was made to feel welcome. Traveling in a wheelchair has its limits but the Omni truly, "opened their doors wide," to make our stay enjoyable. Highly recommend this elegant and convenient property.

review.title: will definitely return
review.reviewText: ,Our 1st stay at this omni, and we arrived very late, after 12am local, after 3am body time. We were exhausted and greeted by a cheerful, helpful desk clerk. She gave us a map which we used to pieces to get around, offered suggestions about room delivery of morning beverages since we were omni club members, and was very welcoming. Room was quiet, wonderfully comfortable and clean.. Staff was cheerful and helpful the entire stay. Only glitch, we were there with a tight schedule the weekend of the time change. We got a notice saying the clocks would change automatcally and only found out that ours didn't when I poured our now-tepid coffee. That threw our morning into chaos and changed plans abruptly. All in all, I now have a new favorite hotel in SF and will stay again while visiting our son, if prices reappear as low as we found on this website. A great stay and staff

review.title: Will use again
review.reviewText: Great hotel, the check-in process was very easy. Joey, the front desk clerk was very helpful. He booked all our city tours. If one tour company was booked, he continued calling until he found one that was available. The beds are very comfortable; the first night, I slept like a baby. Would definitely use again.

review.title: Second Omni Visit - Customer for Life!
review.reviewText: We had previously stayed at another Omni location and decided to try this location in San Francisco. We've stayed at other hotels in the city and so throoughly enjoyed this trip that we will be staying at the Omni for future visits. We can'twait to try Omni Hotels in other cities as well!

review.title: Wil definitely go back.
review.reviewText: We had a ver nice time. The service was outstanding.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely, the staff was very friendly and helpful the location was close to everything we wanted to see. We had a great experience during our stay. We arrived late one evening due to a delayed flight and were very hungry. We went to the bar downstairs and even though it was almost closing time they made us dinner and were very gracious about it. The staff were wonderful.

review.title: Great Pick for San Fran
review.reviewText: Service at this hotel was amazing, they knew what I needed before I asked. Very friendly, very helpful, easiest hotel to deal with. Room was beautiful, immaculate and had the most comfortable bed I have had in a hotel room. I could have slept forever.

review.title: Very Impressed.
review.reviewText: Well worth the stay.

review.title: Omni
review.reviewText: Great location!

review.title: Breakfast Only in Room!
review.reviewText: I purchased the package which included a daily breakfast and the upper floor room to insure a Beautiful city view. At Check In I had to ask for the breakfast vouchers. Nothing was explained about the procedure for breakfast. We were ready to go see the city on our only day there and saw the Vouchers were for an in Room breakfast which then took 60 minutes to arrive. Buyer BEWARE. The next day I asked if we could enjoy our breakfast in the restaurant and was told Absolutely NOT! We were packing to catch a plane and had suitcases and mess everywhere. There was no room service form in our room so we had to request that. Had to eat again in the tiny room. Our room we paid extra for had a view of other buildings and a rooftop. There were lots of vacant rooms when we checked in. Do not get a room overlooking California St. It did not seem like a 4 STAR hotel to me. Had to dry my hair in the hall while my husband showered. One sink! and no shelving under it to put your belongings. The valet staff was great and others very friendly but this did not rate anywhere near 5.0 to me. Might as well book as cheap as you can because they do not take care of people who pay more. Felt ripped off!

review.title: Great hotel, staff and location
review.reviewText: Hotel Review: Omni was great in every way. Located close to Union Square and easy walk to many attractions of the city. Accommodations and staff were excellent. The restaurant had great food and service as well. I would stay again anytime. It could use bigger windows to better enjoy the gorgeous views of San Francisco, but still a great place to stay. Thanks, Steve 2/15/2011

review.title: Luxurious but not snooty
review.reviewText: We could not have been more pleased with our stay at the Omni San Francisco. We arrived way before check-in time (our flight was the red-eye) and the staff graciously allowed us to take possession of our room early so we could catch a few winks. The hotel lobby is gorgeous; or room well-appointed. The staff consistently went above and beyond the call of duty, recommending restaurants and cafes, making us iced coffee at the free coffee bar in the morning, and always with genuine smiles. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

review.title: We will gladly return
review.reviewText: The Hotel is every thing you can ask for in architectural detail and the staff is wecoming and helpful. It is walking distance to great restaurants and shopping.

review.title: NADA Convention
review.reviewText: Over the top friendly service. Walking distance to the Convention Center.

review.title: Gem in the City!
review.reviewText: Warm welcome during check-in, including hot apple cider on a cold, rainy nite. Location close to all, including right on the California cable car line, China town, financial district & embarcadero. Lot to do. Plus wonderful bar & restaurant in-hours.

review.title: Exquisite hotel experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. Coupled with the excellent service, it made for an extremely welcoming and fun vacation.

review.title: Best hotel in the FInancial District!
review.reviewText: I like this hotel a lot...the architecture is stunning, the rooms are big, the bed comfortable, the breakfast hearty and the staff is perhaps the most knowledgeable and friendliest group of people I have come across at a hotel. Food is a bit pricey and service in the only restaurant is slow, but the cooking is divine!

review.title: "Great time in San Francisco"
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was excellent. Convenient to interesting sites and places to dine. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and nicely maintained, but we noticed a quarter sized chip in the bath tub porceline. The ottoman and chair in our room could be better if the dirt stains can be removed. We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni in San Francisco and will recommend and stay at this hotel again.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: it was the prettiest hotel i've been ever! the hotel also had fruits and juice for the guests at the lobby. so impressed!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel room is what you would expect for the price and location.

review.title: Dont look further
review.reviewText: Hotel gives the extra effort to make your stay a memorable one

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: The location is great,the room was clean and quiet, the bed very comfortable and the staff was extraordinary. Definately one of the best in San Francisco.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Will use again when in SF

review.title: Nicest San Francisco hotel in the Union Square area. We will be back!
review.reviewText: The entire staff ( valet, doorman, front desk person, concierge, housekeeping) at the Omni Hotel was extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel was well kept and very clean. Since we stayed during the Christmas holiday season the hotel was decorated very nicely. The Omni is conveniently located within comfortable walking distance from Little Italy, China Town, the Ferry Building complex, Union Square and many nice restaurants. Room rates were competitive. We look forward to returning.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service, decent location, and great staff. Will return!

review.title: One of the best in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with a staff that went out of its way to be helpful.

review.title: Good hotel but it's over-priced
review.reviewText: Expedia was a great source to book hotels

review.title: 100% satisified
review.reviewText: The Omni is in a great location for sightseeing and accessing public transportation. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Many thanks to Stephen for all his help in helping us plan our days activities.

review.title: Love the area
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and everyone was really helpful

review.title: Very nice hotel with excellent service
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel as an Expedia "Unpublished Rate" (4 stars in the Financial District was all I knew) and honestly never would have picked it otherwise. What a pleasant surprise! All the staff were really friendly and helpful, the location was great, the room was large, clean and comfortable.

review.title: Best value in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Have stayed in many hotels in San Francisco and this has been the best for service, comfort and price. Will stay there on all my trips in the future. Perfect for business or pleasure. Staff are a delight.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: nice hotel

review.title: Very nice business location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, downtown location great for business travelers, very nice room with lovely bathroom, comfortable bed, very nice hotel staff.

review.title: Literally my favourite hotel ever
review.reviewText:
I've never bothered reviewing a hotel before but the Omni was so good I just had to. We turned up after a long drive with our 15 month old daughter and were delighted to find the Omni to be much more glamorous and well located than expected given the price we paid. We assumed the service would explain the price but again were pleasantly surprised as we were given a very warm and friendly welcome at the desk (by a lovely man named Benjy, I think). Things just continued well from there.
- My daughter was given a welcome pack full of toys which kept her amused throughout the three nights we stayed (thanks to a bit of rationing).
- They sent up cookies and milk to the room every evening (supposedly for my daughter but enough for us too)
- There was fresh fruit in reception every day
- They remembered my daughter's name and said hello every time we passed the front desk.
- When my wife unfortunately fell ill and needed treatment (nothing to do with the hotel) they were incredibly helpful and understanding and checked in regularly to see if they could help in any way.
In short, this was the best hotel I think I've ever stayed in despite being nowhere near as expensive as others I've tried. I'll be staying at as many Omni's as I can in future and only hope the others can live up to my now ridiculous expectations.

review.title: Some blemishes, but a convenient and comfortable place to stay
review.reviewText: The lobby is beautiful, the staff was very courteous and helpful. However, upon arriving at my room, I was disappointed that they had left a very large, unsightly metal crib that dominated much of the room. It really detracted from the romantic atmosphere I was hoping to achieve that evening. Also, my room looked out over a somewhat unimpressive building next door and the street, which was a little disappointing. The bed was amazingly comfortable and I would have had a great night of sleep had the smoke detector not started beeping every 5 minutes or so from about 3am-4am. It was just enough to keep you half awake but took about an hour before I was annoyed enough to call the front desk to get them to take care of it. I realize this was just a bit of bad luck and would only happen very rarely, but it still really disturbed my sleep and was unfortunate. When I checked out the next morning and informed the staff of what had happened, they were very apologetic, helpful, courteous and even reduced a portion of my bill. All in all it was a nice stay, I had a blast in San Francisco and the problems with the room were pretty easily fixable.

review.title: Omni Hotel
review.reviewText: Received an email in advance of our stay that offered online check-in. This proved a good service with our keys waiting for us on arrival. A nice touch from the hotel was fruit available daily in the reception area.

review.title: Weekend in The City
review.reviewText:
The Omni was very nice - the rooms were small but to be expected in the city and in an 'older' building. What made the stay wonderful was the very friendly staff - always willing to help.

It is an older hotel, so rooms had "character" but were clean and comfortable.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, very calm ...just in the center of the town. High quality of service..People professional and helpful ! A great hotel in San Francisco !

review.title: We loved the Omni
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Omni was perfect! Not only is it a fabulous location, close walk to Union Square and shopping, Farmer's Market at the Pier, Chinatown and Little Italy, but the staff there could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Public transport is right outside the door to take you to Fisherman's Wharf or wherever, and tour buses stop there and drop you back off! We felt very safe wherever we walked. The room was tastefully decorated, luxurious and quiet. The white robes were lovely. Best of all the parking was quite reasonable compared to many other less expensive hotels in less desirable locations - and the valet parking was very efficient! When we called for our car and they asked for our stub, we couldn't remember where we put it 3 days earlier. We tore through our suitcases/bags/purse and finally did find it. However, when we went downstairs to give them the stub - they had already retrieved the car and it was there waiting for us. I loved the whole experience and would go back in a second. I will definitely recommend it to any friends

review.title: Good choice for the money
review.reviewText:
I decided to stay at the Omni because i live in downtown San Diego and I was impressed with the hotel here.

The hotel was really beautiful and impressive looking. The staff was super friendly and accommodating in every way including extending our check out which normally would have been at noon to 1pm.

The concierge recommended a steak house called Bobo's and I thought it was really honest that he was recommending this place over there steak house located in the hotel.

The room was really nice, more old fashioned looking but classic. Everything was clean and nicely decorated. I am a light sleeper and even though we were just outside union square noise was very minimal.

My only complaint was that location wise if you don't want to be in the heart of union square this is a good choice. I thought we would be closer to union square but it was about 5 or so blocks from the heart of union square. But if you want to keep noise to a minimum then this is a great choice for you. Some of the outer lying sections were really sketchy but a good distance from this hotel.

review.title: Best hotel of a four week trip.
review.reviewText: The Omni Hotel was the best one on our trip. Everyone so helpful and pleasant, nothing was too mych trouble. The room was amazing, the bed so comfortable and the bathroom a taste of luxury. We had travelled in the US for four weeks and the Omni was a fitting end. 5 stars

review.title: I'll be back.
review.reviewText: Best hotel I've been to. Only complaint is with the restaraunt. Service is slow and food is not always the best. Everything else is excellent and I recommend this hotel to all my friends.

review.title: very pleasant experience
review.reviewText: Loved the location -- an easy walk to North Beach as well as to the Embarcadero and Union Square. Extremely friendly staff, timely service, attractive room. Stayed here alone and was very comfortable.

review.title: Excellent stay for family of 4 at the Omni
review.reviewText:
This was one of the best hotel stays I have ever had. Check in was great - smooth and effiecient and no line! It was just after 12:30 and the room wasnt' ready but they held our luggage and would call when it was - And they did call 2 hours later. My kids (10 and 7) were given a cute backpack that had some treats and toys in it and they loved that.

We walked to the Embarcadero for some lunch and to enjoy the ambience and they back up to Chinatown for dinner. I loved the location of this hotel.

The front lobby also had some refreshing water and fruit you could enjoy.
Turn down service in the evening and milk and cookies delivered tot he room every evening took this hotel to the next level.
But the very best part about this hotel is the staff. They were friendly, well informed, efficient and happy. From the lady cleaning the elevators to the concierge and everyone we encountered smiles abounded and they felt sincere.

review.title: Best place in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: Everyone at the Omni SF was wonderful, especially the maid, Rosa! Each employee was attentive & bent over backwards to assist you, no matter what the request was. I especially loved the huge bouquet of fresh flowers each day in the lobby! Wonderful touch! I was ready to move in....permanently!! :) This hotel is a "MUST STAY"!!

review.title: Loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved the staff, our room, and the convenient location. It was a smaller hotel with lots of character, and the service was very warm and personal. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: SF Omni experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The room was very comfortable and had a great style to it. The location was unbeatable if you need to be in the financial district. The only negative was the hotel parking. The cost to valet park a car overnight was $56 with tax. No signs or mention of the rate were to be found until check out time.

review.title: Perfect Place right on the tram line close to Embarcadero
review.reviewText:
From the moment I walked in I was pleasantly surprised since it was such a good price through Expedia. I only booked Omni because it was close to start/finish line of marathon which I was running. Doormen open doors for you and greet with a smile. Step into lovely lobby, check in is smooth and they take the time to answer any and all questions in detail and courteously, providing maps, info and making any phone calls needed to get you what you need ie. making an appointment for me at the hairdresser.

The room service was quick and friendly and the quality of the food was very good and not too expensive.

The room was gorgeous, quiet, and clean. Housekeeping was done promptly before noon.

The hotel is in an amazing location right on the tram line for that tourist streetcar experience, close to Embarcadero on California Street. I'd definitely return.

review.title: Great staff.
review.reviewText: Best doorman (Darryl) ever! Everyone was so polite and helpful. Cookies and milk at bedtime. Very kid friendly. Plus, parking is much cheaper on the weekends.

review.title: SanFran Omni
review.reviewText: We asked for two rooms next to each other and in a first we got what we asked for from a hotel order off Expedia. Our room had a toilet problem, but they fixed the issue and left us cookies every night. Rooms were clean (white socks remained white). Hotel was clean. Only real issue was the noise Thursday and Friday night from the street. I thought it was loud for a downtown hotel. Hotel staff was great and the cablecar was just outside for a ride to the bay.

review.title: Pros and Cons
review.reviewText:
This is a crowded business hotel. There's always a rush of people checking in and out, and I was woken by people slamming doors as they were checking out at 5 am. They put a parking charge on my bill, and I didn't have a car. I requested a wake up call to make my early flight, and it never came. Fortunately, I set my personal alarm as a back up. I found that about half the time, the door men didn't bother to open the door.

On the plus side, there is a pretty decent gym in the hotel, and the housekeeping staff is friendly and did a good job.

Maybe if you get a good rate, and you're going for a short business trip, this hotel would work for you. If you're looking for relaxation and comfort, maybe not.

review.title: Love the Bay Area/Hate The Parking
review.reviewText: We love staying at the Omni. It's located right in the middle of town with most attractions easy to get to. The staff is excellent and the rooms are large and very comfortable. The restaurant is very good and the ajoining bar is a nice spot for a drink after sightseeing. The only negative I have is the high price to park your car. We paid $40/night which I thought was outrageous. Otherwise this was our second stay at the Omni and we would return. If at all possible leave the car home.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The location was perfect. Within walking distance of everything. The cable cars were also extremely close. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and I felt as though I was with family. I would definately book this hotel again.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco! Beautiful experience. Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Omni was a great hotel. Great experience. Great service. Expedia set it all up. More than satisfied.

review.title: Best hotel service ever experienced
review.reviewText: The most memorable thing about this hotel was that EVERY person was bought into top notch guest service-from the valet, to the door man, to the bell hop, to the front desk. Several people greeted me by my last name, which shocked me-AND they pronounced it correctly! The valet cleaned up a major coffee spill in my car and did so without my asking. The door man took a personal interest in where we ate, which neighborhoods to stay out of, etc... The hotel was immaculate-I did not spot a single light bulb burnt out anywhere, even in the heavily lighted chandeliers. We will stay at the Omni San Francisco when we return to San Francisco in a few years.

review.title: Only place I would stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best in San Francisco and I am a consistant guest. It provides all the services I look for in a hotel.

review.title: Good and Comfortable Hotel to stay in while in San Francisco
review.reviewText: At check in, service was excellent. Room was very nice and comfortable. Location of the hotel was great for us while we visited San Francisco. Great hotel to stay in. Made our stay in San Francisco very comfortable and enjoyable.

review.title: Excellent choice for seeing San Francisco sights
review.reviewText: Great location. Great service. Quality of hotel is excellent. You will not be disappointed if you choose this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel but they seem to be cutting corners from their service compared to previous stay.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our visit to SF but the room was slightly disappointing. The shower water flow was very restricted and our room was next to the elevator shaft, so we could hear that noise at times. When we had stayed there a few years ago, the turndown service was special...soothing music, treats on the pillow, etc. , but not this visit! Otherwise the service from the hotel front desk and doormen was outstanding...we were able to get our Muni pass, maps, dining suggestions and VIP passes for the DeYoung Museum from the front desk.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The service was great. They went out of their way for us. The room was great for the price. We'll stay there again next time we're in San Fran.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our short stay immensely. Our room was well prepared and the staff responsive to our questions and needs. Our meal at Bob's was fabulous!

review.title: Superior Hotel and Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: My wife, who had previously stayed at the Omni for business, told me that she wanted to stay there for the weekend in order to attend my friend's wedding. Her suggestion was fabulous, the SF Omni is an excellent business hotel with plenty of perks and amenities. Special thank you to the staff, who were unfailingly friendly and helpful!

review.title: Omni in June
review.reviewText: Arrived with rented car filled with items. Bellhops organized it all and transported to room. Check-in staff was friendly. Lex (concierge) recommended that we return rental car to in city location and not airport and provided directions. Staff were always pleasant and helpful, including mentioning one-day muni pass that saved much money getting around town.

review.title: Amazing Location, Great Hotel, Great Staff
review.reviewText: Staying at the Omni was an amazing experience for my first time in San Francisco. Located in the center of financial district, it is a short walk away from Union Square. The F line is a short 5 min. walk away and the cable car runs right in front of the hotel . Hotel staff was very kind, helpful, and knowledgable. The only downside to our whole stay was the price of valet if you rented a car. But then again, where isnt parking expensive in San Francisco. Overall, great experience and I highly recommend.

review.title: Would not spend the money to stay here again-go somewhere else!
review.reviewText: On the positives-housekeeper was wonderful. The doorman was extremely helpful. Negatives-The hotel is old and everything kept breaking. Our TV went out, there was no water the morning we were checking out and couldn't take a shower. The front desk told us to use the 6$ bottled water to brush our teeth and wash up. They acted like it was a favor. They were always too busy at the front desk to answer questions and wouldn't call you back. The room was small for the price and the air conditioner only worked part of the time. Two nights we were too hot to sleep but didn't want to be bothered by a repairman coming into the room again. If you are on vacation, stay on the wharf!

review.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the Omni San Francisco! From the wonderfully inviting lobby and rooms to the desk staff, doormen, porters and housekeeping staff, it was a lovely experience to stay there. Everyone went out of their way to ensure we had a pleasant stay. In the afternoons, they put out a cold citrus water dispenser and a huge basket of fruit in the lobby for hotel guests to refresh themselves and we did so thankfully after our busy days sightseeing in the city. Just another lovely touch! The location is in easy walking distance to the Embarcadero and Chinatown and there's a Walgreens one block away for those incidentals we needed. We will definitely recommend the Omni to our friends and will stay there again when we visit beautiful San Francisco. Loretta M

review.title: San Francisco Hot Spot
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, good location. Nice comfortable bed, friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful room and bathroom. Only a few minor problems, broken ironing board and lighted vanity mirror was not working. Parking was high for the week $48 nite.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: The location was great, friendly service, very clean and comfortable room. Would stay there again.

review.title: Wonderful Stay at the Omni
review.reviewText: The Omni staff is professional and curteous. The hotel is beautifully appointed and smells good in the lobby where they have refreshments for you and fruit. The lemonade or ice water in the lobby hit the spot in the afternoon as we went on a particularly sunny weekend. It's in a great location, walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square, Embarcadero, Financial District, SOMA, Theaters, etc. AND, the concierge is fabulous and knowledgable. The hotel got us tickets to the De Young Museum when we asked about going there. This was a wonderful bonus. we paid for the tickets and got an advanced rate, but they had printed out VIP tickets for us so we didn't have to purchase them there or wait in long lines! This made our outting there so easy to navigate. They gave us directions to a great neighborhood in Cole Valley for lunch on the way to the De Young. I highly recommend this hotel. Top notch.

review.title: San Fran's Best Bet!
review.reviewText: Everyone - from the front desk, to the doorman, to the maid - were very helpful and accommodating. We asked for recommendations for dinners and they named the best spots in town. They weren't pushy or rude at any time and went out of their way to make my birthday special (reason for the trip). It was the best vacation I've had in years!

review.title: Frequent Sydney business traveller
review.reviewText:
A quite pleasant surprise, for us extremely well located, good value and all worked to plan. Staff could not have been more obliging. Breakfast however was surprisingly expensive, with three requests for water .... do the wait staff still really expect a 15% tip?

The three nights for two deal via Expedia suited well, for a 7 pm check-out to SFO international. Website searches found us two very pleasant authentic and atmospheric French bistros within five minutes' walk, half the price of a similar meal at the hotel, there in bland surroundings.

review.title: San Fran Best hotel in Financial District
review.reviewText: I like this hotel because it is across the street from my work which makes it very convenient.

review.title: Will stay there next time
review.reviewText:
Centrally located in the Financial District, the Omni afforded us the easiest transportation available in the City of San Francisco. The three day transportation pass (available at the front desk) saved time and money as both the Muni (bus system) and the famous Cable Cars operated along California Street with connections to other major lines.
First time registrants are encouraged to enroll for 'Preferred guest' status, at no charge. This designation provides you with free internet access, morning coffee delivered to your room, and other amenities.
Staff was extrememly friendly, and provided the names of certain restaurants that proved delicious.
Corporate hotel follow up has been equally efficient. Within two days of check out they have requested feedback about our stay, and actually responded to a comment.
Overall a very enjoyable destination.

review.title: Not as good as it looks from a distance.
review.reviewText: Room was nice but air conditioning was obviously old and incredibly noisy, all night. Bed was good. Also I had to ask four times to get tea bags, hot water and milk for my room, instead of the coffee provided. When I asked for help to confirm my flight the next day the fellow on the desk was impatient and said he was alone on the desk and didn't have time.

review.title: Very imppressed
review.reviewText:
Great hotel, extremely helpful and polite personnel, best location in town!
Very comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms!
Allowed early check-in.

review.title: A wonderful experience!
review.reviewText: This is an elegant hotel in a nice neighborhood. The staff could not have been more accommodating or friendly. I enjoyed every moment of my stay and recommend it highly.

review.title: Worth every penny spent!
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing! It was absolutely gorgeous inside!

review.title: Exceptional
review.reviewText: This is one of the nicest (perhaps the nicest) hotels I have stayed in. The rooms were clean, the service impeccable, and every inch of the place is gorgeous. The staff offered to assist us with anything and everything, including driving us to the airport for $50 (cheaper than if we took a cab). I would absolutely stay here again; I hope I get the chance to do so!

review.title: Omni is beautiful in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
We arrived around 5 or 6 in the evening and we were greeted with champagne for my husband and I, and two goody bags for our kids. The staff remembered our names the first night we were there. The room was beautiful and well prepared. Parking was taken care of by valet (expensive) which seems to be the only option in this part of the city.
The staff was courteous at all times to me and my children (2 toddlers) and though the restaurant on-site is not really appropriate for young ones, they gave us just enough attention and space to ourselves.
It seemed as though there was a staff member handy at all times, wherever we were, including on the walk my daughter and I took around the block. Someone appeared and asked if we needed a jacket because it was chilly outside that morning. It was prompt and genuine and won my gratitude for the duration of our stay.

review.title: Sn Francisco - give me back my heart .....
review.reviewText: Omni Hotel San Francisco - it wasn't until a doorman came to open the taxi door that I realised I'd chosen such a good hotel. The Omni is up market without being stuffy, and very handily located for Market Street, Embarcadero and China Town. All front of house staff friendly, professional and helpful. Big room with everything you'd want including snuggly dressing gown. Only minus - cheap toilet tissue!

review.title: Warm and Wonderful Place To Stay!
review.reviewText: In today's stressed out and uptight society it was a breath of fresh air to step into the Omni and find warm, friendly employees who seemed to actually enjoy their jobs and enjoy their guests and the city. We had a wonderful stay and were so impressed by the staff - they really made the stay and our trip wonderful.

review.title: Already planning our return visit.
review.reviewText: This was our honeymoon and the hotel met or surpassed our expectations. When we arrived mid mornining, our room was already ready. Normal check in is 3:00. Room service was lightening quick. Free Starbucks every morning at 6:30 was a nice addition. The desk did a great job in helping us manage our dailey touring of San Francisco as well as finding good places to eat. The entire staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Overall - a great place to stay!

review.title: Great staff service
review.reviewText: This place is great. Even though the cable car was right next to the hotel the room was very quiet and comfortable. The staff took care of me and was very friendly. My only complaint was the glazed carrot served with dinner. There should have been a replacement available.

review.title: The best we experienced
review.reviewText: We spent 3 weeks in the USA including Las Vagas, LA,and Orlando and stayed at 4 star hotels all of which were very average including the Ritz Calton - however the experince at the Omni was top class in service and in quality, it was our wind down stay for 2 days before heading home back to NZ and we could not of picked a better place, very close to shopping, the markets and other attractions, all staff were pleasant and very helpful, the rooms were good and the room service food was excellent - we will be staying only at the Omni in future visits to San Francisco

review.title: Great Place in the Financial District
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Omni before. First class hotel. Excellent service and location.

review.title: Excellent! We'll be back!
review.reviewText: From the doormen to the maid service, the place is a delight. Clean, well appointed rooms and a comforable bed made for an enjoyable stay. You will hear some "city" noises at virtually any hour so if you're used to rural quiet or a light sleeper you may want a sleep aid. One of the main cable car routes is right in front of the hotel so you'll hear it go by from time to time. Didn't bother us a bit. We were on the 6th floor overlooking the street so maybe higher up or the back side of the hotel would be better? There was always complimentary Starbucks coffee in the morning and citrus water and fruit in the afternoon and evening down in the lobby.

review.title: My wife and I celebrated our 44th anniversary at the Omni. It was great!
review.reviewText: A great hotel that is a great value.

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: Remarkable hotel, one of the best ever. Staff goes way out of there way to make your stay pleasant, they're friendly, smiling and very helpful. The hotel itself is very nice, will cared for, and well located.

review.title: Incredible hotel, incredible service...just don't park there!
review.reviewText: This is a great, luxurious hotel and the service could not be better. We visited for the weekend and the weekend rate was incredible considering what you get. Tremendous value on the weekends. We loved everything EXCEPT the $55/night (includes tax) for parking. Thought that was ridiculous even by San Francisco standards. Having said that, i would stay at this hotel every time I visit the area!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
My wife and I don't stay in San Francisco hotels very often as we live fairly close to the city. We decided to stay recently, however, as we were attending events both Saturday night and Sunday morning.

We were very impressed with this hotel. The front desk staff were friendly and efficient, and the lobby was quite attractive. Our room was very spacious and well appointed.

The hotel is in a very convenient location, close to the financial district, Chinatown, and the cable car line. We had compared prices with several other nearby hotels and felt that the Omni was a very good value. Will definitely stay there again if we have the chance.

review.title: Best stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the quality of the hotel as well as the service. Everyone was very polite and I would most certainly recommend this to friends. I plan on staying here again in the near future. There was milk and cookies and also my niece and nephew received children goodie bags to keep them entertained! My over all experience was wonderful.

review.title: Omni is the place to stay!
review.reviewText: You will not be disappointed at the Omni. Service staff was outstanding, excellent location, concierge was amazing.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay. Staff go above & beyond.
review.reviewText: The Omni staff provided us with city information such as where to eat, maps, etc. that we needed to get around. The helped us line up a tour of Miur Woods with another company, and even had hot cider ready on our arrival back. The hotel was in the middle of all we planned on seeing and the weather was gorgeous! A wonderful trip! Thanks so much!

review.title: Great family experience
review.reviewText: The Omni was all we could have expected! Everything was perfect. This was our son's first trip to SFO to ride cable cars and we all cannot wait to return to this city and this hotel. Especially nice was the care and attention that all the staff gave to our son, including the concierge who were able to assist us with many directions including the nearest toy store! The location is great for families, close to Union square, Chinatown and the cable cars.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Loved the room, loved the atmosphere, loved the help. Would really recommend any of my friends and family to stay here. It was a great experience.

review.title: Very impressed with the Customer Service. We were treated like royalty.
review.reviewText: see above

review.title: Awesome deal!
review.reviewText:
Awesome hotel, polite and helpful people. Definitely recommended...
Great deals on the weekend... very close to Union Square and Embarcadero.. room was great (not a great view hotel) but we got the top most floor so a big plus.. Interiors are very well maintained, clean....

review.title: Fantastic hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel is one of the best in the Omni chain -- evidenced by the crystal pineapple awards its won for hospitality. Upon check-in we received decks of San Francisco trivia cards. When I asked to buy a second one, they said no -- but they would be happy to GIVE me another one. Perfect location in the financial district near many good restaurants. Everyone was friendly and provided top-notch service. Go, go, go!

review.title: Fabulous Financial District Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, helpful and courteous staff. Large, nice room with view of Financial district and bay. Nice perks with SelectGuest sign up (I signed up before booking, so it was all in place - complimentary morning beverage service, paper, pressing etc - when we arrived.). All in all a perfect stay.

review.title: Would definitely stay here each time
review.reviewText: We have a great stay at the Omni. The service was impeccable. We were traveling with our two kids (6 1/2 and 2 1/2) and their grandma and they started out giving them each a gift backpack filled wiith goodies, such as a telescope, flashlight and chinese drum. During the course of our 3-day stay, they gave my son a children's walking map and also each night greeted them with milk and warm chocolate chip cookies. The hotel was right in front of a cable car stop and only a couple of blocks away from the MUNI, the Ferry Building and Embarcadero Center.

review.title: I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were polite and accommodating. Our room look just like the picture posted on the Expedia website. It was a great deal for a luxury hotel. The location was perfect. It's within walking distance to just about everywhere.

review.title: Great hotel and excellent service
review.reviewText: From beginning to end, the Omni provided excellent service and paid special attention to details. Since it was Valentine's weekend, they were very generous. The welcome gift was a rose and glass of champagne...great start to the weekend. Thanks, Omni!

review.title: Great weekend getaway
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel with a good location and very friendly staff. Only advice would be don't go to the "restaurant alley" a block away the doormen may recommend.

review.title: The SF Omni is perfection!
review.reviewText:
I cannot rave enough about our stay at the SF Omni. Service was impeccable. Our standard king room was beautifully appointed and much larger than I'd expected, and we were delighted by all the touches that made our stay so enjoyable--especially the hot spiced cider and huge bowl of pears in the lobby.
We loved the location--just a few blocks from the Ferry Building, which is a great spot for snacks and light meals. It is an easy walk to Chinatown and North Beach. Also, we took BART ($8.10 each way) to and from the airport. The Montgomery stop is just a few blocks' walk from the hotel. Before your stay, be sure to go online and join the Omni Select Guest program. It entitles you to free in-room internet access and complimentary morning hot beverage and juice delivered to your room. After staying at the Omni, we are spoiled!

review.title: "Absolutely the best!!"
review.reviewText: The Omni was an amazing, pleasurable experience from start to finish. The staff was quite welcoming, courteous and helpful. The Omni is in the heart of the financial district and close to everything, including Union Square, Chinatown and the Embarcadero. The room was quite spacious and linens, bedding and bathrobes were so cozy, warm and comfortable! The workout facility was the best I've ever experienced at a hotel--so many treadmills, bikes, ellipticals, free weights, yoga mats, and also had headphones, newspapers, TVs and water!! This is the only place to stay in downtown SF--much nicer and less expensive than other comparable (but not as good!) hotels.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: I've stayed in hotels that were twice the rate and not as nice as the Omni.

review.title: Great centrally located 4 star hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: For the price range, the hotel couldn't be faulted. The room was clean and spacious and the location was great being v.close to Union Square and the financial district. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel for anyone looking for a good 4 star hotel in this price range.

review.title: Top Place except no Guest Laundry
review.reviewText:
This place looks luxurious and has welcoming helpfull staff. It was like heaven after a trip in the national parks staying in cabins & low end motels.

The location is good too - San Francisco is compact enough that we found you can walk to many attractions from here (as long as you are reasonably fit to manage the hills), unlike LA which is too spread out to walk. The cable car goes right past the door, but at $5 a ride don't rely on it for your primary transport.

The only complaints I would have are that there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom (a bit embarassing if you make a smell because it goes through the whole room), and there is no guest laundry.

No guest laundry is a problem I encountered at several decent hotels in the US. It's frustrating when on a long trip. Invariably they offer a laundry service, but starting at $3:50 for a pair of underpants, who can afford to use it? Sitting in a public coin laundry during the day is a waste of sightseeing time, and walking to one at night isn't always an appealing option. Streets that feel safe by day seem less so at night and in all US big cities there seem to be plenty of homeless people even in "nice" areas of the city.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the hospitality at this hotel. Hotel staff was helpful, fun and very accomodating to our needs.

review.title: OMNI
review.reviewText: The Omni Hotel is in a great location. It is very clean. The staff greet you with open arms and a smile. It is a luxury hotel so expect to pay for everything in addition to your room. Parking is a bit expensive, but that is SF!

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: The staff here were the most customer focused, freindly ones I've encountered. Would definitely recommend. They are also very family friendly with a kids welcome pack and cookies and milk delivered to the room each night. We loved it.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We had a great time at Omni Hotel, the staff are very friendly and helpful. I definitely will come back again.

review.title: San Francisco's best hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect. They gave our daughters a welcome gift, which was a great detail, as was the milk and cookies they sent up for them both nights (the best cookies ever!). We traveled down the coast of California, and this was definitely the best hotel. The people were all kind and helpful in every way possible. There was hot cider and cookies/fruit in the lobby. Also, 2 blocks away from Chinatown, and a short walk from Union Square.

review.title: awesome hotel
review.reviewText: The people are very courteous and accomodating.You feel your so special, they open the door for you when you get in and out of the hotel.They treat you like king and queen.Staff are very helpful.The hotel ambiance is beautiful especially the lobby.However, the parking valet is expensive.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: A wonderful experience. Hotel staff knowledgeable and very friendly. Room was very clean and beautiful. i have recommended the Omni to many others that I have told about our trip.

review.title: Great Stay In San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great room, very comfortable. Excellent bed and bathroom.
Staff at Front Desk was great and recommended good restaurants within walking distance.
Patchy situation with bell staff (porters). One was great, One was no so good ( did not explain the parking situation well), the last one was really "ugly". Unfortunately he was the one who bid us goodbye by slamming the car door. If you work in a hotel and don't get a tip because you have not done anything, don't work there, be a road worker.

review.title: Wonderful Time
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay at the Omni! When we first arrived we found our room had two double beds instead of the king size we reserved for our honeymoon! The gentleman at the front desk was amazing and quickly resolved our issue. The rest of the stay we were treated like king and queen. The staff was absolutely fabulous! Highly recommend!!

review.title: Fabulous hotel and staff!
review.reviewText: My daughter and stayed at the Omni for a mini Thanksgiving holiday.We loved the hotel and the staff were wonderful.The gentleman at the front desk went above and beyond to help us get theatre tickets to see Wicket.The hotel even sent us to the play in the town car .It was very easy to make our way to Union Square for some great shopping. We would definitely go back and we would recommend the Omni to family and friends.

review.title: Great place, super location.
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel, very clean, staff were really friendly and helpful. Probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. Comfy robes in the closet and all for a great price. The location is perfect. The trolley stops right outside the hotel, China town is just one block up the street and the ferry terminal is a short walk down the street. Just one block over is a pedestrian area full of restaurants all with outdoor seating. If we return to San Francisco this is where we will stay for sure.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: We had a really nice time at the Omni hotel. Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to help us in any way possible. Our housekeeper was friendly and left us a personalized note each day and did a great job cleaning our room. and greeted us when we passed her in the hall. Loved the comfy bed, and the high shower head (my husband is 6'3' and always has trouble with low shower heads. Mini bar prices were outragous, but they usally are. We didn't get a room with a view but oh well, we did get a good deal at 2nd night 1/2 price. Maybe next time we'll get a upgrade. A little far from union square but the trolley goes right by the hotel every 15 minutes. Buy the city pass if you plan on doing 3 or more things, it saves you money and gives you unlimited rides on the muni and trolley.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni Hotel. It was in walking distance of many areas such as China Town and Little Italy ( Tony's Pizza...Yummy). The room was very beautiful and the Omni staff very friendly and helpful. Our young son really enjoyed the cookie and milk which was delivered every night before bedtime...what a wonderful thing to do.

review.title: Excellent Service - Great Location.
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel - during a very busy weekend in SF (Women's Marathon, Music Festival) and was very pleased with the stay. The hotel is a short 5-block walk from the BART station, and centrally located to many of SF's attractions. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel room was very nice, clean. The only issue we had was that the key cards stopped working the second day, but this was quickly corrected by the hotel staff. SF is one of my favorite cities, and I will be back, and will stay at the Omni again if I have the opportunity.

review.title: "running through SF"
review.reviewText: We had great customer service from the bellman to the cookies left by housekeeping!

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: Omni is a conveniently located, well appointed hotel with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Our room was nicely decorated,clean,quiet and fairly priced. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent a weekend in San Fran at the Omni. The hotel was very nice, and we were very happy with our choice in hotel. We had no issues while we were there and everyone at the front desk was very helpful. We did have to wait until 3pm to check in, but they will take your bags if you get there early and want to walk around. You can easily take the Bart from the airport and walk from the Montgomery stop to the Hotel, saves on a cab ride. As other reviews said the bar at the Hotel is expensive so don't plan on drinking there unless you plan on spending lots of $$$. Overall great stay, I would go back in a heart beat.

review.title: Loved It
review.reviewText: The Omni really impressed me. The service by the front desk & the doormen was wonderful. The location of the hotel was centrally located to all activities. The amenities in the room were great. I would definitely recommend the Omni and I will stay at other Omni hotels in my future travels

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: Excellent location.Close proximity to a variety of quality restaurants.Hotel extremely comfortable for a city break.Staff professional and well informed.Would certainly return.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the business district but is very well situated for access to all attractions. As you will see from my ratings the whole experience was top class. All the staff in the hotel were both friendly and fun. Our visit was for leisure and as a widely travelled guy (internationally) would highly recommend it.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: close to pier. great service all around. Slanted Door is within walking distance. Take the bus #10 to the wharf!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the Omni S.F. Everyone was extremely helpful, it's location was great. Our only complaint was that our room was on a smoking optional floor and it was obvious that our room had been smoked in. When we asked to be moved we were told that there were no rooms on non-smoking floors, but that they would put an ionizer in our room to help clear the air. The ionizer was in our room when we returned, but it had not been turned on. Once we turned it on, it helped immensely. I would not let that deter me from returning or from recommending this hotel to others.

review.title: GREAT
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant experience at the Omni Hotel. ALL the staff were very pleasant and attentive to our needs. All the pleasantries were unexpected but very appreciated. We will definitely return soon.

review.title: Well worth it
review.reviewText: Being from Cleveland, Ohio this was my very first time visiting the West coast. The choices were either Seattle or San Fran. My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the end of August and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is on California Street and this location is right in the heart of everything. Chinatown is a 3-4 block walk, Fishermans Warf is about 10 min. away, and all the sights of the city surround the hotel such as Nob Hill and Union Square. CARRY A JACKET. To me it was a bit cool especially in thew evenings. We went on a cruise under tge Golden Gate Bridge and around Alcatraz and it is really cool out there, but we enjoued it tremendously. If you fly into San Fran Int. Airport like we did and took the Airtran to the rental car facility, be prepared to a large room full of travelers lined up for thier cars. Our rental car was with Hertiz and the line was long but it went smoothly and had the car in about 45-50 min.IIf you are a jogger like me I ran down California to Market St. to Embarcadaro to Pier 39 and back. I got lost on the way back but what a great run!! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised - outstanding service!!
review.reviewText: We weren't sure what to expect since we got this hotel for a great rate - but as soon as the handsomely dressed doormen let you in - it's beautiful - elegant stairway down into the lobby with a great service staff waiting to greet you and get you checked in. It's in a great location with easy access to everything within walking distance. Great fruit and flavored water in the lobby every day. We'll be back!!

review.title: business hotel
review.reviewText: Room and service was excellent. Its right next to Chinatown. However, I don't recommend you bring a car since parking is not available except valet or across the street which you have to pay additional for.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Clean, quiet and a good location for access to all areas. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Fresh fruit basket in the lobby every night. Didn't try the in-house restaurant so I can't comment on the food, but judging from the extremely high prices on the menu and the number of persons I actually saw dining there, it does not appear to be very popular. Our room was on the end of an upper floor and one of the quietest I have ever had.

review.title: Long San Francisco Weekend
review.reviewText: This was the first trip to San Francisco which included reservations at the Omni Hotel. This Hotel is just as advertised. Excellent accomodations, excellent service. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Staying at the San Francisco Omni multiplied the pleasure of our visit to this beautiful city. Another big plus with the Omni Hotel location is the ease with which you can tour the city using the cable car and trolley car system. There is a cable car stop right outside the Omni. This hotel is right next to China Town, 7 blocks from the Italian District and a short cable car ride to Union Square with all of the shopping. Plus for the price of a cocktail you can view San Francisco Bay from the 52nd floor of the Bank of America building right across California Street from the Omni Hotel. Access to Fisherman's Wharf is simple using either the cable car or trolley car.

review.title: Relaxing at the Omni
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Had breakfast both days in Bob's Steakhouse. Pricey but convenient and the food was very good. The service was even better. We will stay there again for sure.

review.title: Excellent hotel and good location
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is well located and most visitor attractions can be readily reached on foot. The room was well presented and very comfortable. We would definitely stay at the Omni again. One other minor comment - don't use the associated restaurant - the steak was good, but expensive and the accompanying vegetables were poor. There are also plenty of other nearby restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Concierge was very helpful in giving dining suggestions, and help in getting rental car back to the airport (including best place to gas up the car).

review.title: none
review.reviewText: none

review.title: Fabulous place!
review.reviewText: The room was great, and the staff was very friendly and accomodating, giving us tips, even looking for stuff we left in the car in valet parking! It was a luxurious experience for a reasonable price!

review.title: Impressive hotel for the price
review.reviewText: centrally located though plan on valet parking, beautiful lobby, feel like a 5-star at 3-star prices

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: service, rooms and location.....excellent. California cable car at hotel entrance, takes you to the Ferry bldg where you can hook up to all modes of transport. Many visits and hotels enjoyed in SFO, this one has been the best by far.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: I took my 13 year old daughter on a last minute Daddy/Daughter trip to SF. The Omni had the best price and quality for our budget. Their service was exemplary and they were extremely helpful in directing us to cheaper parking and the best restaurants in the area. They even sent up milk and cookies as a nice welcome surprise for her! The location is excellent with cable car track right in front, and close to China Town, Union Square, North Beach, etc. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: A Perfect 10
review.reviewText: It was our 25th anniversary and everything about our stay was perfect. It's easy to see why the Omni San Francisco is the #1 rated hotel in San Francisco. It's also very centrally located. I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: From the bell man to the yong man at the counter and everyone else it made our stay very enjoyable. The car parking is expensive but it is what it is. They did allow us to leave our car in their lot after our check out time which was appreciated.

review.title: Highly recommended!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel and an amazing stay...highly recommended hotel!

review.title: Excellent San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Location close to transportation, including cable car. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: A San Francisco Great
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the Omni Hotel. It's a beautiful big hotel with a small hotel feeling in the heart of - everything! Walking distance to the Embarcadero, Ferry Building, China Town and even Union Square shopping. This is the place to stay for high quality at a great value.

review.title: Great Hotel in SanFrancisco
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel was the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was well located for all we wanted to do. Room was very nice and well kept. We would surely stay here again.

review.title: Exceeded my expectations
review.reviewText: It exceeded my expectations. The staff was very nice and the room was exceptional. It is in a great location. We will stay there again.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Top of Class

review.title: Excellent stay, overall
review.reviewText: Our room was near the elevator shafts and it was noisy in the room, but after the first night, we apparently got used to it. Service was friendly and efficient. Everything in the hotel is overpriced--get out within a few blocks and the eats and drinks are great and more affordable.

review.title: Omni in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco was a very welcoming hotel and a pleasure to stay in. The staff were very helpful and anticipated some of our needs even before we asked for assistance. The hotel is well placed in the business district for China Town, The Embarcedero and the Market Street area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco.

review.title: beautiful hotel, good location
review.reviewText: This was a lovely hotel in a good location -safe for walking, several good restaurants close by and near cable cars. Definately would stay again.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located - few min walk to BART (for airport), Ferry Building (for breakfast), North Beach (for dinner), Union Square (shopping), etc. The only negative is that they have started charging guests for computer access in the business center - it used to be complimentary.

review.title: Great hotel in San Francisco financial district
review.reviewText: My wife and I loved our stay at the Omni. The service was outstanding, the room was large and very comfortable.

review.title: Wish we would have stayed here the whole weekend
review.reviewText: The service from the valet to the front desk was first class. The price including the parking we got from expedia was a great deal. Would definately stay there again.

review.title: Great location; review negatively influenced by size of room
review.reviewText: We've stayed at several Omni properties, and the SF hotel shares most of their features: rich fabrics and woodwork, restrained elegance. We arrived late evening and were assigned to a small, rather awkward room. Nothing really wrong with it, but we felt a bit cramped. I was traveling with my adult son, and had specified two double beds. When we checked in, our room had one king. When I asked for a change, I was told nothing was available, which may well have been true. But no effort was made to accommodate us for the second or third nights of our stay.

review.title: A lot of money for a place to sleep
review.reviewText: The staff was outstanding. The lobby was nice. Parking was ridiculously expensive. We spent most of our time sightseeing and wine tasting. All we did at the hotel was sleep. Holiday Inn is just as good for that. Make your reservations early or you will only be able to get a very expensive bed.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of San Francisco close to Chinatown, North Beach and Union Square. Typical 4-star luxury with overly friendly staff. The bedding could use an upgrade, though.

review.title: Expected better
review.reviewText: This hotel had a good location in the financial district but wasn't worth the money and didn't really live up to it's star rating. I've stayed in other Omni Hotels and had a better experience. The water pressure in the shower is non-existent and the beds were not very comfy, beding not so plus. The room was more like what I would have expected at a Hilton.

review.title: all I could ask for at a great Expedia savings
review.reviewText: Location was great, cable car right outside the dor, Muni/Bart down the street. We visit San Francisco often and found this location a bit quieter than the Pier 39 area yet still in the center of things. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable, including "turn down service" in the evening. The Omni is a popular businessman's destination hotel during the week but a vacationer's hotel on weekends. I definitely recommend it!

review.title: I'll be back...
review.reviewText: From the moment the front door was opened on our way in to check in to the time the front door was opened on our way after check out, my girlfriend and I were treated like royalty at the Omni. I've been to San Francisco many times and the Omni is the BEST hotel I've stayed in. The service is exquisite. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk personnel to the housekeeping staff is exceptionally friendly, always upbeat, and very helpful. The hotel itself is very clean, elegant, and conveniently located close to Chinatown, North Beach, and the Financial District. The California Street Cable Car line runs past the hotel's front door, and the BART station is five blocks away. The room was large, clean, and well maintained. There was a nice flat screen TV and DVD player in our upgraded "signature" room, though not every room may be equipped similarly. Every morning our housekeeper would leave us a handwritten note wishing us a pleasant day. We'd write her back telling her of our travel adventures and leave her a well-deserved tip for her service. She even recommended a great place to try authentic dim sum! Staying at the Omni was definitely the key to a most enjoyable San Francisco adventure! I'll be back to San Francisco soon and, without a doubt, will be staying at the Omni again!

review.title: Classic 4-star
review.reviewText: The Omni might be geared more to business travelers, but it was just fine for our vacation stay in SF. The location, in the financial district, was walking distance to the Embarcadero, Ferry Bldg. and Chinatown, and right on a cable car line. The area felt safe for walking at night. With tall office buildings nearby, it lacks a breathtaking view. But our room, a deluxe king with marble bath, etc., was lovely, spacious and well-maintained. The lobby is elegant. The staff and concierge were very pleasant and helpful. My only complaint was the business-center's internet service (we didn't have a laptop with us). They charged too much (per 15-minutes) and the connection was not fast enough. Overall, we were very pleased, especially with the excellent deal we got on the room rate through Expedia.

review.title: Loved it.
review.reviewText: This was the most comfortable and pleasant hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff was especially courteous and helpful. I slept like a baby.

review.title: Perfect Place to Stay in SFO
review.reviewText: This was the perfect place to stay in San Francisco. Location was convenient to everything by walking or public transportation. Very nicely appointed rooms and the price is right too! A much better value than the "notable" hotels around Union Square and Nob Hill. Will definitely be back!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Exceptionally clean, comfortable, elegant room.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: It was our first time in San Francisco and we really did not have any idea where to stay. We arrived at the hotel and one of the first things we noticed was the cable car driving right in front of the hotel. As we walked in the front doors my words were "whoa this is nice!" We checked in early to our room with no problem, the hotel already had our room keys and card printed off prior to our arrival. The staff provided information about local attractions and was eager to help. The room was spacious with a nice flat panel tv and a beautiful bathroom. I could go on and on but the hotel is great. I highly recommend this hotel. I was exteremly impressed and will look for the Omni brand in other locations throughout the states to stay.

review.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL, FRIENDLY STAFF
review.reviewText: We had an excellent time in San Francisco. The hotel room was very clean and spacious. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to fellow travelers. The restaurant and bar on the first floor were excellent also. We ate dinner there three times during our nine night stay.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, great service, great location...
review.reviewText: This is an impressive hotel and came at a great rate from Expedia with only a two week advance reservation for the fourth of July weekend. Three blocks from Chinatown, just north of Union Square, and the cable car goes right by the front door.
