The service was great beginning with the valet parking in front of the hotel, the doormen, and the room service. Complimentary Starbucks coffee in the morning at the lounge. The Steakhouse is excellent, but as expected for a hotel of this calibre, relatively expensive.

review.title: Perfectly located in the finance district and next to Chinatown. I'll continue to return to it!
review.reviewText: Excellent housekeeping. The hotel car was nice so I could quickly get to the airport at the same price as a cab.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay at the Omni Hotel in San Francisco. The room was clean, with a good sized room with a nice sized bathroom. My only complaint was that we requested a king size bed, but were stuck with two doubles. Oh well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely return the next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Good rates

review.title: Too Noisy
review.reviewText: A lot of the rooms face a busy street, and I requested quiet. They put me next to an equipment room that made loud noises all night. It's true the staff is friendly, but what's it worth if you can't get a good night's sleep. I travel a lot, and I'm not expecting perfect silence. But there are noisy rooms, and you want to avoid them at all cost.

review.title: Great San Francisco location
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni. The staff was great. A major cable car line runs right by, so we were able to get around with little or no hassles. The concierge was well-informed, and helped us negotioate the unknown. Stay away from the bar unless you like over-priced drinks. We had two meals in the hotel restaurant - "Bob's Steakhouse," and while both were excellent, $50 for breakfast is TOO MUCH, even by SF standards!

review.title: Omni Review
review.reviewText: When we arrived, the hotel was great. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. The kids even got a treat and I got a rose! The employees were very helpful with suggestions to local attractions. Chinatown is about 2 blocks away but other than that and the pricey hotel restaurant and even more expensive room service you really don't have much to choose from for dining. A helpful tool that was provided by the hotel was a map of the area. We wouldn't have been able to get around without it. Pros: Staff friendly & helpful Very upscale hotel Special small ammenities here and there Trolley passes right by the hotel Hotel provides a lot of useful information about local attractions for both adults & children You can purchase (trolley)Muni passes at the desk at $11 for a full day of unlimited rides. Kid friendly hotel! You can ask for a backpack full of activities for the kids to play with in the room. Cons: Billed over $100 for valet parking for only 2 night stay (there is no other parking, you pretty much have to valet) Financial district location not very good, dining is far unless you want to spend over $120 for a family of four at the hotel retaurant. Other restaurants are pretty far and local eateries are closed during the weekend because no one is working. Hotel more aimed for a business stay due to location. If you're traveling for leisure, something by Union Square would be more ideal.

review.title: Great location and service!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! The staff is very friendly and always available to help. They gave us great advice on resturants and tours. The location was very convienent! Defenitly will go back!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Positives: - awesome staff, especially the front desk and consierge - very comfy beds - clean and spacious Negatives: - Location is so-so for a first time visit to SF. It's on the California cable car route, which is handy, but there are nice hotels closer to Union Square - Five bucks for a plain cup of coffee?!?!? Don't have breakfast there.

review.title: Omni Hotel- Luxury without the attitude
review.reviewText: My 2nd office is located in SF and very close to the Omni hotel. Although there are many other hotels to choose from, I stayed at the Omni. The room is very nice, and very clean! Everyone was wonderful! Friendly and always offered help. No snobby attitudes at all!!!!!Great choice! In fact, the hotel is so great, my company has decided to set up a corporate rate with them directly.

review.title: Not bad, but not great either
review.reviewText: Its a very nice modern hotel right in the city center, so very convenient for shops etc. It does not have a pool and everything there is needlessly expensive. I also found the rooms a bit too stuffy. It is a very nice and clean hotel with friendly staff, but for the costs, its not special.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Superb service, great location, very comfortable.

review.title: Great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: We recently finished a touring holiday of California with 4 nights at the Omni in SF. We chose it because we had stayed at the Omni Boston in the past. This hotel was great in every way and very good value booked through Expedia. The staff were friendly, extremely helpful and seemed genuinely interested in making our stay a good one. Our room was clean and pleasant and the bed was very comfortable. We had asked for a quiet room when booking and this was acknowledged and we were given one on the 11th floor. We could still hear the cable cars passing but otherwise we were not bothered by noise. The position of the hotel meant that we could walk easily to Chinatown, Union Square and the Embarcadero. The cable cars stop right outside the hotel. Altogether a good place to stay.

review.title: Highly Recommended!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice! Definitely would stay here again on next visit!

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located two blocks from China Town. The Cable Cars run in front of the hotel. Several places to eat near by.

review.title: Good base in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location in CBD, fairly close to Union Square. Situated on Cable car line, which makes it easy to get to the Ferry Building, which is a great hub of up-market restaurants and shops. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay at the Omni again.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful Hotel. Everythin was clean and comfortable. We were just shocked by the prices in the restaurant. Two cups of coffee, a croissant and an order of toast was $30.00.

review.title: A Typical Wonderful Omni Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel located in the middle of the financial district and just a few blocks from Chinatown. The trolley cars are right out front but it is a very safe area to walk in. Lots of cafes and shopping within walking distance. Most bistros and cafes shut down for the weekend, but there are still lots of places to dine. Fast room service and wonderful staff.

review.title: Exactly what I needed!
review.reviewText: Very classy hotel. Everyone there was on top of their game. Very service oriented. The door men were all smiles greeting me and opening the doors everytime I approached whether I was coming or going. The concierge sent a bottle of wine & chocolate truffles to my room, with a handwritten card wishing me & my husband a romantic weekend. He helped with reservations, made suggestions for an itinerary, and offered us their house car service available M-F. The bedding was exquisite! The first night I arrived, I thought I would check in, freshen up, then go out to get something to eat. But the bed was so cozy & inviting!! Quality linens, lots of pillows...so once I laid down there was no getting up again!!! GREAT water pressure in the shower!! This is so important to me. It is so disappointing when you stay at a quality hotel and the shower head looks like it's been there for 20 years, or it's just terrible water pressure and water's shooting in every direction! So, the shower was perfect! The bathroom was beautiful. The restaurant in the lobby (Bob's Steaks & Chops) was pricey, but fantastic. Great service, and one of the best steaks I've had. We had very low expectations because of the name, but it was just too cold out to leave the hotel. So we figured we'd get something to eat in the hotel. It was high end and worth every penny! I would absolutely stay at Omni San Francisco again. So should you!

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable in the right area to get around the Bay. Would go back for a stay next time around. Very Friendly team.

review.title: Would make a different choice next time
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were great. Really helpful and friendly. I was disappointed with the room for a 'deluxe' hotel. The bedspread was shabby, the carpet old and worn and the room seemed generally dingy. Parking is expensive...$48/day so you should factor in that. It's really more in the financial district rather than Union Square so parking options are really limited. We looked for other garages but they are also expensive. You can use the street overnight until 7am for free but then will need to go to a garage if you need more than one hour. For the same rate, I would go to another area that has better parking access and look for a more updated room.

review.title: Worth a Visit
review.reviewText: Great location and friendly staff.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Nice room. Quiet. Very good service from chambermaids. Hotel restaurant, Bob's Steak House, is pretty good.

review.title: Location, Location, the Omni is right there!
review.reviewText: the Omni reputation for service was overrated as far as the bar personel but the doorman and the reception personel were up to the reputation! as for the room, it is in need of restoration: the chair cushion ripped, the wall, marked but the bathroom, all marble, very nice. Location of the hotel is ideal, walking to shopping or restaurants. In all, satisfied, we would go back!

review.title: Exceptional Service!!
review.reviewText: This hotel has some the BEST service I have ever seen. Would recommend to ANYONE!!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great place!

review.title: One of the best hotels we have stayed in
review.reviewText: Staffs were very friendly and approachable. Easily one of the best hotels we have stayed in!

review.title: A wonderful place to stay.
review.reviewText: great location, great hotel. Highly recommend this hotel. Staff is very helpful. They try very hard to make your stay enjoyable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Service, attitude excellent. Concierge recommended affordable Italian restaurant, La Gondola near hotel, great food, very affordable Valet service excellent and timely.

review.title: omni hotel
review.reviewText: Starting with the valet that opened my car door and the doorman pulling my bags every minute spent there was a completely satisfying experience. the hotel staff was excaptional and the concierge took a question about where to eat as if his job depended on my satisfaction and he did not disappoint.

review.title: Good but quite a bit expensive and a small bathroom.
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with this hotel but the price is kind of expensive and the bathroom was small. The reason for the price is the location I think.

review.title: Very impressed wth the quality of this hotel!
review.reviewText: Rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The hotel is very well laid out. The hotel staff were very professional and friendly. Hotel was beautifully decorated and the ambience was wonderful. Especially liked the doorman. He was awesome! Made you feel very welcome and was a wealth of information regarding the city of San Francisco!

review.title: Quality hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel really liked us. Near to the Civic Center. The view was not the best, but does not matter. Good experience overall.

review.title: Fantastic experience
review.reviewText: Everything met or exceeded expectations. Check yelp for more reviews.

review.title: Very Nice, but Over-rated
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located in the financial district. It is very nice, customer server is very good, but for the price you could do just as well elsewhere with a smaller bill. The hotel's dining room was not well staffed at 6:30 am when they opened. My eggs and bacon cost $30.00. The most I've spent for breakfast at other 4-5 hotels was $23.00 Simply put, you can get the same quality at a lower cost 4-5 hotel in town.

review.title: omni san fran is the best
review.reviewText: I travel all the time and this hotel is the best I have ever stayed in. I had truly exemplar service from everyone. I was upgraded when I arrived to a gorgeous room on the 16th floor so I had peace and quiet. The food from Bob's Chop House via room service was divine and had healthy options. One evening when I went out, rather than hail me a cab, the friendly doorman bundled me into the house town car and a wonderful young man drove me to my event 8 blocks away. I usually can't wait to get home from a biz trip, but I can truly say I was sorry to leave the Omni San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful stay at a beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely interiors, convenient location, well appointed rooms. They offer an assortment of amenities consistent with their four diamond status. Only criticisms I can think of: they didn't seem to have a doorman, and when you call ahead for your car, it may take a bit longer than the stated 20 minutes (go down and confirm with the actual valet that they are bringing your car around to expedite things and ensure no miscommunication from the desk to the valets) -- but vastly better than the valet service at other places in the city.

review.title: vey pleased with hotel
review.reviewText: great location - within walking distance of the Ferry Building, Union Square and financial district, so close to LOTS of great restaurants, shopping and theater. Quieter than many hotels right in Union Square, plus parking was included iwth our package, which was a huge benefit. WE found the stff to be very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice and quiet
review.reviewText: nice and quiet

review.title: Consistent Comfort and Value
review.reviewText: The Omni SF is always a terrific place to stay. Courteous staff, nice accomodations and a great location make this tough to beat. I go back every time.

review.title: Perfect location for a stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Omni hotel is a beautiful hotel with excellent atmosphere, service and rooms. It is in a perfect location for exploring San Francisco. It is about 2 blocks away from Chinatown and about 5 blocks away from the Ferry Building, where you can take a leisurely stroll to Pier 39. The only thing I would mention is that if you don't hold a credit card, they immediately take money from your debit card for incidentals -which is no problem. However, you may have some trouble getting the balance credited back to your account - what should have taken "up to 72 hours", took 10 days, following phone calls & emails! But I have to say overall, the Omni is an excellent place to stay.

review.title: Smelly Room
review.reviewText: My room smelled like faint cigarette smoke, they sprayed it, next day smell was back due to the cleaning solutions they use.

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in good location with good access to the locations we were interested in. It had excellent service. Would definitely return the next trip.

review.title: Beautiful & Clean
review.reviewText: Can't complain about the hotel itself, staff very friendly and helpful, bathroom very clean and elegant, room clean and classy, (although it did smell a little like faint cigarette smoke, they cleared it up with air freshener, next day the scent was there again after cleaning, turns out it's the cleaning products they use. Gym was also, nice, you'll love this hotel. Word of caution, the desk clerk charged my debit card $$$$ a day without my knowledge or authorization in the event of incidentals. Something I didn't discover until I returned home, he was supposed to "authorize" $$$$ per day in the event of incidentials, I called to have this corrected and didn't find the staff as pleasant over the phone as they were in person. But it did get cleared up. Just be sure to ask exactly what is being done with your card when they ask for a form of payment in the event of incidentals so that you don't have any surprises...that asided, I really enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel based upon the reviews and we were very pleased with our choice. The staff are extremely friendly and professional. The rooms are clean, fresh, quiet and comfortable. Everything is well maintained and does not have that "worn-out" look. We booked this hotel as a package with our airfare, and Super Shuttle provided ground transfers to the door.

review.title: Staff Great
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel 5 times now. Each time the staff is very friendly and helpful. Great recommendations for dining etc.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, the location is perfect and the staff very helful. The cable cars pass in front of the hotel, reason why it is easy to go anywere. I used taxis a couple of times and the price is not more than USD 10 for the most famous attractions. I planned to rent a car but it is really not necessary. I would certainly come back to the Omni !

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: It's a beautiful hotel and the room was very comfortable. Avoid the bottled water at $5 and the mini bar as they are all overpriced. The cable car passes the front door so it's ideally located. I also took the online option for parking which worked out at $20 day which is a bargain.The staff were all friendly and the doorman always treat you like royalty.I would definately stay again.

review.title: Very good fantastic
review.reviewText: This hotel is overwhelming. The staff is very friendly... I can recommend it!!!

review.title: Great location and wonderful staff
review.reviewText: The staff were extremely helpful and so pleasant. They were always available to provide directions and often highlighted the main attractions. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel was so close to the bus and cable stops and a short walk to China town, union square and the many restaurants. An absolute charm!!

review.title: Great Location!!!!!!
review.reviewText: I was EXTREMELY pleased with the Omni in its location and courteousness of its staff. I took the BART from SFO and walked about 3-4 blocks from the Montgomery street station. The hotel was quite close to China Town,Union Square,Market Street, and the trolley passed right in front of the hotel. I was in SF to attend a wedding and the reception was right across the street at the Julia Morgan Ballroom. I got a great deal with the hotel since I booked my airfare with Expedia. I bought the travelers insurance "just in case" since on a previous trip dealing with customer service (in ANOTHER country,I might add!) was a REAL PAIN!!!!!

review.title: Very comfortable, good location
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel with a nice location in a great city. Our only complaint came with the fact that the doors to the rooms near ours closed very noisily. We had a long trip to get to the hotel and were tired; we tried to take a nap in the afternoon but the doors kept slamming and waking us up. Otherwise the facilities were very good quality. While I wouldn't pay the rack rate for our room, the Expedia rate was livable.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location. The staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants. Close to China Town and Union Square for shopping. The rooms were clean and a good size.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: Wonderful, friendly, helpful staff!!!

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Elegant hotel. Helpful staff. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Very comfortable. Had a fantastic stay!! Would highly recommend.

review.title: Will stay here again!
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay and were very well taken care of. We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I thought I was checking in to a five start hotel, instead I got a treatment of 1 star. First they screwed up our room arrangements and then they charged me twice for everything. I have spent the last two days trying to get my money back.

review.title: Wonderful choice
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco was a beautiful addition to a beautiful week in San Francisco!

review.title: Nice Place - Greate People
review.reviewText: Upon entering, the lobby gives the impression of a great hotel. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, and the concierge was as well. Take advantage if the concierge if you're staying here. The bellmen were also very cool. We were on a weekend trip for fun, so we were clad in jeans and sneakers. Even though this was a fancy hotel, whose typical clientele are dressed much nicer, we were still treated with outstanding courtesy and respect. Only complaint was that the room was warm. The AC did not work very well and so we could get it cool enough for our taste. Other than that, great hotel for $189/night on the weekend! Nice location too!

review.title: Just what we were looking for
review.reviewText: Excellent location on California Street. We enjoyed riding the cable cars all over (Union Square, Grace Cathedral, Fisherman's Wharf, etc.). Location of the Omni is perfect for exploring downtown SF.

review.title: Terrific
review.reviewText: Too bad all hotels are not like this one. Great location, great food, and great service. I couldn't have asked for any more!!!

review.title: Extremely Satisfied
review.reviewText: Review Title: Elegant property, new favorite in SF Hotel Review: We have been to San Francisco numerous times. This is a lovely hotel. Rooms are larger than most in the city, a real plus for my wife, our 3 year old and myself. Decor is plush, beds are comfy, finish details perfect! Only knock would be on lack of concierege experience, call ahead on this. Perhaps just a labor day weekend issue!! Traveler's Tip Category: Dining Traveler's Tip: We enjoyed the Bay Boulangeris for pastry and a very good value lunch. Local company with a number of locations. Very busy at the lunch hour. What does that say? Run to the little kiosk of Blue Bottle coffee! Worth the effort. First Name: don Last Initial: g Do you wish your name to be displayed with this review? Yes Where do you live? Manhattan Beach, Ca

review.title: convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: The location is great, in the heart of the financial district just blocks from the Ferry Building. The service was good, the rooms were nice enough, the bathrooms are very nice. We would go back there again.

review.title: Beautiful San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was the most helpful I've experienced anywhere. Suggested an excellent restaurant and made reservations for us upon check-in. Very elegent SF Hotel.

review.title: Very convenient, clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: Everyone was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: We will return
review.reviewText: The Omni exceeded our expectations. We traveled for the first time with our infant. They helped to make this vacation a vacation. Everyone was very helpful...from the front desk to housekeeping.

review.title: Pleasant if the Price is Right
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 days over the Labor Day weekend. Pleasant hotel. Not quite sure why it rates 4 stars tho. I expected more. Some of the 3 star hotels I have stayed at in San Francisco were pretty much on par. Was very surprised at the grimey robes in our room. I was not at all tempted to snuggle in one. Breakfast in the restaurant is way over-priced. We did get a good deal for staying 3 nights tho.

review.title: VERY Nice
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and excellent location to the various transportation posibilities. Great staff. Our room was wonderful. The only two down items would be the small gym facilty if you like to work out and the resturant, while very good was a bit pricey.

review.title: Very good hotel in a convenient location!
review.reviewText: This hotel had wonderful service, particularly at the front desk/concierge. The rooms were very well kept and housekeeping did a great job. I received a very good price for the hotel on Expedia, and can't imagine a better hotel for the price that I paid!

review.title: Great location and good service
review.reviewText: It was so easy to get to just about anywhere in SF from this hotel - very easy to walk. We did not have any issues with service and all staff memebers were friendly. Door staff were a bit too causal but that is really a small item. Our room was right by the elevator but we really could not hear any noise. Room Service was good and always on time.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: No matter where we were going, it seemed that the Omni was only a few blocks away.

review.title: Great hotel, would go back in an instant!!!!!!
review.reviewText: The room was great. Service amazing. Everything about the hotel was top notch. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

review.title: Superb in SF
review.reviewText: Perfect stay. Everything worked.

review.title: best location and service
review.reviewText: This location was very central to the Ferry Building, Chinatown, Unionsquare, Nob Hill, the Trolley, North Beach and the Wharf. We could walk to them all! Also, the staff at the hotel were superb. We definately recommend this hotel. The only thing I can think was missing, was a sundries/gift shop, but we walked to the Walgreens and cafe's nearby instead.

review.title: Superior service and great location
review.reviewText: Our family of six had a great time for one week i

review.title: Great hotel!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel accomodations were excellent and the hotel was located fairly close to most attractions and shopping. The hotel staff and service were excellent. I will definitely consider staying here again when traveling to San Francisco.

review.title: Outstanding Service
review.reviewText: This hotel had everything we needed. The staff were outstanding and always helpful, whether it was bringing up a complimentary toothbrush or printing out our boarding passes for the trip home. I could be more pleased with the accomodations and will definitely stay there on my next trip to SF!

review.title: Very polite. Excellent service!
review.reviewText: I was very happy with this hotel. Excellent service, extremely polite and very helpful.

review.title: Great Service!
review.reviewText: Every night we go back from walking around san francisco, the beds would be made, they would leave chocolate, fill up the ice, and housekeeping would even leave a hand-written message to us personally! It's little touches like that that make our experience at this hotel so great. Great Location near chinatown and downtown. Very scale service. Would definitely go back!

review.title: I won't use another hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My stay in the Omni was very pleasant. The staff were personable and the service was excellent. The rooms were clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The location was convenient to most of the local attractions. I plan on returning.

review.title: very nice hotel, would stay there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, very clean, and the service was great too. My parents stayed there when they were in San Francisco and they recommended it to us. We glad they did.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: It was our anniversary and we couldn't have picked out a better place. We have stayed several other places in town, but will return here!

review.title: Great Customer Service
review.reviewText: Every single person I encountered that worked at this hotel went out of their way to be friendly and helpful in anyway that they could. The rooms, while not huge, are clean and comfortable.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: The rooms were very clean and spacious. Every staff member we had contact with was professional and extremely helpful.

review.title: The Omni made our trip to San Francisco memorable
review.reviewText: The over-all service was impeccable! From the greeting at the front desk to room service, to check-out, everyone that we encountered on your staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Omni quality, what else can you say?
review.reviewText: I've stayed in several Omni hotels and they were all great. This one is great for business, or personal enjoyment. If you are here for the shopping around the union square, you might want to choose other hotels cuz this one takes some walk. It's very close to Chinatown, which means the surroundings are not the best in the city. Beds are just so comfortable that I did not move at all overnight, not even a turn. The bathroom was great, they offer almost everything, unlike Nikko, that has almost nothing in the bathroom, makes you feel stingy. Overall, great hotel with great price. Even the valet parking is not too bad for the city standard.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We did ask for extra coffee and received, but not enough cream and sugar to go with it otherwise the accomidations were excellent.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed in Omni during our visit to SF. It was a good hotel, but the only aspect that we didn't really like is the front desk. It lacked separate concierge area and they couldn't find our reservation until I provided the print out from Expedia confirmation email. Front desk will provide the concierge service; however, that makes checking in and out a timely matter, and there is always a long line on front of front desk. For a four star hotel, you would expect a little more.

review.title: Extremely pleased
review.reviewText: I can't say enough about the Omni San Francisco. It was my first stay there and everything was beyond my wildest expectations. The room was lovely, extremely clean with great amenities. The dinner recommendations were superb. The staff was extremely professional, friendly, and very knowledgeable. The Omni is also very well situated in walking distance to many wonderful sights. I can't wait until I can return!

review.title: Pricey for what it is...but this is San Fran
review.reviewText: A fine hotel, lobby makes a nice initial impression. Very clean, and service was certainly adequate. Our request for a non-smoking room could not be honored (sort of a chronic problem when using expedia)but it was not a problem as smoke was entirely undetectable on the floor. The doorman was helpful with directions, but clearly unimpressed when I was not prepared to tip him for hailing a cab. I would stay there again, and probably will, though nothing really impressed me enough to command long-term loyalty.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: in heart of business area but close to Union Square. Very good service & freindly staff

review.title: Good, bur pricey
review.reviewText: Great hotel, nice rooms, but a little too expensive for the location and the amentities. If you want to stay where the action is, you should probably stay somewhere in the mission.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel in general, nice room, good view, the only problem was parking and the parking service of the hotel was preety expensive.

review.title: Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: I cannot say enough about the staff at the Omni. From everyone at the valet, porters,frontdesk to the cleaning staff. Friendly,helpful, and detail oriented. The room was just fine, roomy, nice bathroom, ample size closet space. Room Decor nothing to write about but very clean, not worn out. Don't look for views in this hotel, but the downtown location was excellent.

review.title: Friendliest Staff I have ever encountered
review.reviewText: From the greating by the doorman to the most helpful agent at check in, to every other employee we encountered, this is the friendliest, happiest hotel staff I have ever met. We asked if a room upgrade was available, which it was. We upgraded to a California Suite - which I highly recommend - it was a wonderful room with great views.

review.title: Weekend Get-away
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were attentive and polite. A very good location for a weekend get-away.

review.title: Exceptional service at a fine hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I travel frequently, for business and pleasure, all over the world. This service at the Omni in San Francisco for my one-night stay outranked the service I received during a week-long stay at a 5 star caribbean resort. The Doorman, receptionists, valets were friendly and helpful. The baggage handler filled our ice bucket for us after unloaded our luggage and called room service to order champagne and flutes for us. The staff made many dinner recommendations, and secured us a difficult-to-obtain, last-minute reservation at Ozumo's. I had a flat tire, and the front desk called AAA for me and arranged assistance on my behalf. The location couldn't be better. We walked through Chinatown, North Beach, up Lombard and down to the Wharf. But, for those not wanting to walk, the trolley runs right in front of the hotel. It's not inexpensive, but the price is worth the quality and service. I will stay here from now on.

review.title: Nice hotel away from the noise
review.reviewText: Omni Hotel San Francisco offers travelers luxury and comfort in the heart of S.F, but away from the noise and crowds. The staff is friendly and professional. I love the bathrooms!

review.title: Very Good choice
review.reviewText: The location was quite good. Our disattisfaction lies in the fact that they did not have a Wifi set-up and charged $10.00 per day for internet access and a business center the size of a cubicle. There is no separate concierge, so their advice was hit and miss. They did arrange for a rental car for us and that went very smoothly. Overall it was nice.

review.title: Excellent Experience
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Omni. It's location is excellent and everything except the wharf was within walking distance (5 blocks max). This would be my first hotel choice during another stay in the city for sure.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Great location. Excellent service from hotel staff - concierge, bellman, and housekeeping all went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. Spacious room, very clean. Comfortable bed and Ghiradelli chocolates on your pillow. Life is good.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: I can't think of any better word that "perfect" to describe my stay at the OMNI SAN FRANCISCO. Extremely kind, courteous, helpful and pleasant staff from the front desk to the bell men and even the Room Service Staff! The hotel was gorgeous, clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Definitely my best hotel experience to date. It can help to make a very romantic stay. Service is great and reliable.

review.title: Omni is a class act.
review.reviewText: I was satisfied in all aspects. I stayed there for 4 days and found it to be of high quality and consistant.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. All employes were very friendly and hepfull

review.title: Excellent Hospitality!
review.reviewText: We had the best time at the Omni Hotel. The staff was great, the enviroment was clean, and classy. I will definately go back!

review.title: Luxury hotel at reasonable rate
review.reviewText: We stayed over the New Year's holiday and had a wonderful experience. Even with parties in nearby rooms we never heard any noise in our room. The rooms were very clean with new bedding and furniture, great service, friendly staff and the in house restaurant was great. Loved the location, walking distance to many areas but not in the noisy part of town.

review.title: Good, but not great.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely appointed and in a fairly good location, especially for the financial district. The rooms are pretty small and can be noisy if you like fresh air. The staff is great and when we needed a taxi and couldn't find one they offered their town car to take us to the ballpark for $10. Belden St is nearby with some good restaurants like Plouf and Brindisi.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni SF over the New Year's Eve Weekend. The hotel is very centrally located and very nice. The staff were very well trained and nice. The rooms are small but nicely decorated and well kept. The bed is very comfortable. We loved the way they did the bathroom. About the only thing I didn't like about the hotel was how much they charge to park. ($51/day) It seems a little excessive even for San Francisco.

review.title: Beautiful, Upscale Hotel
review.reviewText: This is great for business travelers and vacationers. The photos on this site do not do this hotel justice. You have to see it for yourself. A few additional services here and there and they could easily qualify for a 5-star status!!

review.title: Excellent, centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I stay in San Francisco for a couple of nights each Christmas season as a matter of routine. We have stayed everywhere during these visits, except two of the most expensive, since we usually look for a Christmas package and neither has offered one. The Omni was a standard for judging all the rest, in my opinion. Their service was excellent, all the staff very courteous and helpful, and the hotel was perfectly located for equidistant access to Union Square, Chinatown, the Embarcadero, and Market.

review.title: It's great to find a hotel that is actually customer focused
review.reviewText: All amenities are explained well. Guests are greeted throughout stay and assistance is offered with every greeting. Housekeeping staff are excellent. Business/IT area is small, but very accomodating. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom very clean and in perfect working condition. Restaurant and bar very good. Hotel location perfect for walking tours of San Francisco.

review.title: Met expectations
review.reviewText: Overal, straight ahaead. No views per se, given the surrounding buildings. Great front desk.

review.title: Service is great, quality is OK
review.reviewText: Located 1 block from Chinatown and about 5 blocks to Union Square. Service is great and the concierge is great at suggesting places to eat. The rooms have high ceilings, but their beds need to be changed. I read they were comfortable, but I would highly disagree. After a long day walking everywhere, it would have been nice to sleep in a bed that was at least comfortable.

review.title: Loved the location! It was convienant (sp) for everything (BART, Ferry Building, shopping, etc.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great location, friendly staff, very knowledgable of the restaurants, shops and entertainment in the various locations in the area. Staff remembered our names and greeted us by name each morning & evening!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: the employees were fantastic, always friendly and willing to help out. Our only complaint would be the parking service. The valet told us not to park with them since they were almost full and told us to go park in the parking lot across the street and it would only be $10, but it turned out to be around $40. But the place was great, food, and bar were excellent as well

review.title: Great Hotel, Awesome Restaurant, Fabulous Customer Service
review.reviewText: I was in town for a business trip, and many other hotels were booked. I got a great rate at Expedia, and the stay was great from start to finish; almost everywhere I wanted to go was in walking distance, including the finance district, where I had to work. The food at Bob's Steakhouse was amazing, and perfectly cooked. It wasn't cheap, but what in San Fran is?? The customer service at the hotel was great, every employee was pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful. The housekeeping staff writes a personal note to welcome you, and you get 2 chocolates at turndown service on your last night - score! It made being away from home less lonely.

review.title: Great location for a weekend of Christmas Shopping 2006
review.reviewText: My wife used to travel to SF for work and since then has changed positions. She loves the shops at Union Square so a surprise spur of the moment weekend shopping trip was perfect for us. We arrived at 10 AM and checked in without any prior request for an early check in. From the Omni Union Square is 10 minutes on foot and Chinatown is also 10 minutes on foot. The California St Cable car runs right in front of the hotel and is at this time of the year easy to get on without much of a wait. The Omni is an excellent hotel. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful with directions and shopping tips. Our room was clean and very comfortable. Each evening the hot apple cider and cookies in the lobby were very tasty and appreciated after a long day of carrying shopping bags. All in all a great hotel with a good location and a fantastic staff close to everything but far enough away to avoid the crowds.

review.title: One of SF's Best
review.reviewText: This was my first stay at the Omni in San Francisco & it was an excellent experience. The hotel is one of only 2 in the middle of the financial district & was conveniently within 2 blocks of my meetings. The staff was extremely courteous, helpful & forever timely. I can't wait to return.

review.title: Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommended!
review.reviewText: This is a great, central hotel (walking distance to North Beach and Chinatown and on the cable car line). We managed to check in at 8.30am in the morning (despite not having specified an early check in). Staff also allowed us to check out at 2.00pm on the day we were departing. Customer service was exceptional. The hotel also put on a free walking tour on the Sat morn which was well worth the time we spent (about 1.5 hours).

review.title: Great Place to Stay in the City.
review.reviewText: Great Location, nice large, upscaled rooms, free wireless, good steak house (a little pricey), and good internet rate. Can't beat it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of museums, shops, restaurants, trolley line, and Chinatown. We were also able to walk to North Beach, Embarcaderro, and Fisherman's Whalf. For those times that our feet were tired or we didn't feel like walking, there was no problem getting a taxi.

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: The suite we stayed in and was essentially two rooms, connected by a hallway with a bathroom. No flow, nothing special. Working class luxe. Plus, the room emitted the distinct odor of urinal cake. A little heavy on the cleaning fluids.

review.title: Will gladly stay there again
review.reviewText: We got a great price for Memorial Day weekend, considering we booked it only about a month before. The Omni SF was conveniently located, within walking distance to Chinatown and Downtown. The buses were nearby as well. The rooms were very comfortable. The only thing that was not satisfactory was there was a leak in the ceiling in the bathroom. I guess someone was taking a bath above our room? It only leaked one night we were there, but other than that, it was fantastic.

review.title: We were treated like royality Great employees!!!!!
review.reviewText: The staff, from the personal at the front dest to the maid service were exceptional. They were all very helpful with everything from booking theatre tickets to providing any needs in the room. If all the Omni hotels are like this I will try to stay at an Omni whenever I can.

review.title: Outstanding luxury hotel with supurb service
review.reviewText: This is an outstanding hotel with outstanding service. Beautifully located on a cable car line and near Chinatown, it is near all of the major sites of San Francisco. In addition, the hotel itself is gorgeous. The service is exemplary and it is truly the best hotel I have ever stayed in. I will definitely stay there again the next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Treated like royality! We loved it! Would recommend it to all our friends and family.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, great service!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni for 3 days and loved it. The hotel was so beautiful and the people there were all very helpful. The room we stayed in was a good size with 2 double beds and a huge bathroom. Definitely a four star hotel. We'll make sure to go back. Also, had 2 great dinners on a recommendation from the doorman..Tiramisu's and Cafe Bastille's. The breakfast at the hotel itself was also very good.

review.title: old school luxury
review.reviewText: beautiful and luxurious; very friendly stafff; excellent room service. not pretentious, really willing to serve their patrons. the epitome of what a hotel experience should be.

review.title: Really enjoyed our 6 nights there----would love to return !
review.reviewText: My only complaint --- I just wished the hotel was nearer Union Square. Those 8 blocks got rather long. But we knew the location when we made our reservation. We had a great time there !

review.title: This would be my choice again!
review.reviewText: When we arrived, it was in the a.m. However, our room was ready and waiting for us. Upon returning each evening, our bed was turned down and sleep was so rewarding and peaceful after a long hard day of shopping and sightseeing. The room was clean and tidy at all times. The fitness room was a plus and plenty of equipment to workout on. No waiting your turn here. It was within walking distance to major attractions with cable car just outside the door. No need to rent a car! You will love this place as did I.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel is top of the line. The phrase "Great First Impression" definately relates to this hotel. I would recommend this hotel and would definately come back.

review.title: Weekend @ the Omni
review.reviewText: Hotel was great and better than expected. Service was excellent, staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. Will stay here every time we visit SFO from now on.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Hotel is location on the cable car line.

review.title: It was Great
review.reviewText: Felt totally comfortable. Take advantage of the walking/jogging map the hotel provides; takes you to the Ferry Market (when we were there Sundays and Tuesdays were Farmer's Market days, along the bay towards Fisherman's Warf, through a touch of Little Italy, then back towards hotel. You're also just two blocks from Chinatown (catch a morning pork bun at one of the bakeries - yummm).

review.title: Always service with a smile
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel helped make our visit to San Francisco a more enjoyable one. Assistance with transportation, directions, restaurants, etc., was gladly offered. Our needs were effeciently responded to. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and professional. Excessive charges for local calls and the in-room "snacks" didn't particularly set well with me, but that was nothing compared to the prices at the house restaurant. I could not find any justification for what the Chop House charged for their meals. Just one dinner set us back plenty.

review.title: Perfect location and very friendly staff!
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for us. It was located near most of the places we wanted to visit or located near a bus or trolley line to get us where we needed to be. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. They provided maps, directions, friendly and helpful hints and they were always available for us. The hotel itself was beautiful and the rooms were great. I would certainly recommend this hotel and stay there again.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and a great location. Make sure you have plenty of tip money.

review.title: The rooms could of given you more. Very expensive
review.reviewText: We were upset that a room as nice as it was didn't give you a refrigerator of your own nor a microwave. Never gave you enough condiments for your 4-cup coffee maker. The place is beautiful, but we won't return.

review.title: Great location, Elegant Hotel, Friendly Service
review.reviewText: Located right between Union Square, Nob Hill and North Beach, this allows easy walking access to all three without being stifled by a teeming tourist scene. The building is gorgeous and impeccably maintained with beautiful marble, granite and woodwork throughout. The staff is helpful and very friendly. Need to go someplace not too far from the hotel? Take one of the black Town Cars outside the hotel at a flat fee of ten bucks because it's as reasonable as a taxi, much more comfortable and the driver is a pro who knows where he's going (not always the case with taxi drivers).

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Location is good: close to Union Square, Chinatown and North Beach (just take Columbus St. and you will be there in 5-7 min of walking). They charge $45 (plus city tax - $6) for cars (24 hr period). The restaurant downstairs is pretty expensive: the breakfast cost us (three people) around $70 (!!!). We didn't order anything fancy: 2 orders of egg benedict, salmon bagel, 2 cups of coffee and a glass of orange juice. But there are plenty of restarants and breakfast places around. The beds are comfortable, the room is clean. Overall - very nice hotel, convenient location.

review.title: Amazing service!
review.reviewText: Trust the Omni name. This staff at this hotel will make you feel like a superstar!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Supurb Service!
review.reviewText: I can't stress enough how great this hotel is. Everyone had a smile from the moment I walked in the front doors to the moment I stepped into my room. The turndown music from the TV was a nice touch also. We had a bad night in the city one of our nights, but just by coming back to the hotel and hearing a warm "Welcome Back!", made those bad memories go away. I will definitely stay here again!

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: a courteous staff, 2 blocks from Chinatown, closeby shopping

review.title: Great Location & Rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to get to, with easy access to all the SF atttractions. The hotel rooms were extremely quiet and comfortable. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. The hotel parking was expensive but not compared to other parking alternatives.

review.title: Recommended Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, clean, tidy and generally good service. The only area that let it down was breakfast at Bob's Chop House. Poor service and poor quality menu.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni for our 25th Aniversary trip to San Francisco. We can't say enough compliments to the staff and the condition of this Hotel. Wonderfully decorated, makes you feel like royalty. The rooms are very clean and turn down service is very nice. The street car stop at the Hotel was a plus. Tour pickup at the Hotel a nice feature as well. We enjoyed the cool weather and the fine dining the city had to offer. You can't go wrong with this Hotel!

review.title: I will stay here in SF
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. The location was great, the service was excellent, and their restaurant's food was incredible. Overall the rooms are nice and comfortable with everything you would expect from a nicer hotel. My only complaint would be the pillows. Thin and yet, somehow, still lumpy.

review.title: I'd return in a NY minute!
review.reviewText: I cannot express how wonderful our stay in San Francisco was, with our stay at hew Omni topping our list. The hotel is a stunning piece of architecture in an elegant part of town with a staff that was friendly and courteous and eager to assist. Our room was spacious, our every need addressed.The hotel's loction was ideal for shopping, siteseeing and enjoying the area's fine restaurants. We'll return to the Omni again and we'll recommend it highly to friends.

review.title: Convenient, Classy Comfort
review.reviewText: As infrequent travelers, we depended on the internet to choose a hotel for our recent trip to San Francisco. We were very impressed with the Omni. While it is located in the financial district, the Omni is withing easy walking distance to shopping, dining and cable car connections. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful in arranging tours, dining reservations and car rentals. The room was spotless, comfortable and carefully attended to by a housekeeper who left us charming little notes each day. Room service was quick and high quality--a reflection of the excellent restaurant within the hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco. You will be well cared for at the Omni.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: friendly, courteous staff

review.title: What you look for @ a hotel.
review.reviewText: My family and my self had a great stay. We felt confortable and welcome.The staff was great,can't say enough. I have recommended this hotel to co-workers, who are also planning a trip to San Fran for a vacation.

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: WE stayed here as our first stop on our honeymoon. We had a great experience. The staff was excellent in helping us make reservations or giving us directions. The room was very nice. The location was excellent-just a walk down the street to the Ferry Building and on the famous cable car line! Would definitely go back!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel well located in the financial district, but reasonably good for tourist access to transit, too.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is fantastic! I would definetely go back. The service and people are extremely nice and helpful, and the hotel is beautiful and clean. You will not be dissapointed!

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed in many hotels and find the Omni San Francisco one of the best. The excellent service began the moment you approached the outside doors of the hotel. Everyone was courteous and helpful. I especially liked the personal notes from the housekeeping staff welcoming us to the hotel and the San Francisco area. If you are a fitness enthusiast as I am, the fitness center is one of the best hotel fitness areas I experienced. The fitness center contained 2 flat screen TVs, 6 treadmills, 3 eliptical trainers, 2 cycles, machines for each major muscle group, dumbbells from 2 to 50 lbs, exercise balls, medicine balls, jump rope and mats. This place was a travellers delight. Also, headphones, bottled water, fruit, and starbucks coffee (caf and decaf) were available. We made our tour reservations, picked up MUNI passes, and received helpful sightseeing tips through the hotel. It was fabulous. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: The hotel we'll stay at from now on
review.reviewText: We had such a great experience at the Omni San Francisco hotel. The customer service we received was amazing. We were greeted everywhere we went in the hotel and all our needs were met with a smile. The location was perfect, walking distance to Chinatown, Union Square, and North Beach. The hotel restaurant was absolutely superb. This is definitely the hotel we will stay at on future trips to San Fran.

review.title: Hidden Gem of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Since this was mine and my wife's first trip to San Francisco we didn't know what to expect. But, from our first step into the hotel lobby the San Francisco Omni exceeded our expectations and then some. Whatever we asked of the staff was accomplished in a prompt and courteous manner. They arranged tours, made recommendations for restaurants and whatever else we asked of them. Top notch restaurant in the hotel(Bob's Steak and Chop House). We would stay at this Omni or any other Omni because of the experience we had in our week in San Francisco.

review.title: Great weekend
review.reviewText: Exceeded my expectations, We went for our 30th anniversary. They arranged the limo, the most beautiful roses in the room when we arrived. Chocolate covered strawberries and champagne that afternoon (complimentary). Arranged for a limo tour of Nappa, restraunt reservations.... Spent 4 nights, the hotel is a great central location. Will return.

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Omni Hotel is one of the cleanest, nicest hotels I have ever visited. The staff were wonderful. They were friendly, helpful, and gave very personal attention. I truly enjoyed the Omni and would love to return for another vacation. I would not want to stay any other place in San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful from start to finish. The room was a nice size and very comfortable. The fitness center was great. The staff where wonderful and very helpful. It is in a great area and very close to Fisher Mans Wharf, Union Square, Market St etc. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francsico.

review.title: What a wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: Stayed here on a girls shopping weekend. Staff was exceptionally curteous, helpful, and always smiling! A true 5 Star experience. It was my mothers birthday and on our first night we were greeted by complimentary champagne and chocolates. Great location. Quiet on the weekends because it's in the financial district, but an easy trolley, cab ride or 5-10 minute walk to dining, shopping, and sites. Will DEFINATELY stay here again. Remember to tip bell hops and other appropriate staff. They really deserve it!

review.title: Convenient but Quiet
review.reviewText: Front desk very helpful. Lobby and rooms very clean and well kept. The location is good because it is quiet at night.

review.title: The Service to die for
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfect, but the best is the service, in guiding you in all your needs, I can't wait to go back. Carmen Lasso From Florida

review.title: Financial sector -- moderate luxury
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, I got the room with a package, so I'm not sure how much it cost. Workout facilities were excellent. My son and I slept very well on the pleasant beds. The location couldn't get any more convenient to chinatown and Little italy. We did not sample the restaurant. I parked my car in St. Mary's garage on California and Kearny for about 30 dollars a day.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our choice of the Omni San Francisco Hotel. We were 2 blocks from Chinatown, a short walk to North Beach, a reasonable walk to the Ferry Bldg (boat to Sausalito), and far away from the heavy tourist crowds of Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf. Although the restaurant was expensive, we had one of our best dinners there. The hotel has a fully equipped health club also. Everything was very clean and service was friendly and efficient. The room was large enough to comfortably accommodate 3 of us, and the bath was large for any hotel.

review.title: Omni worth returning to
review.reviewText: We stayed over a long weekend and loved how quiet the hotel--and financial district--were. It was nice to not be in the tourist crush in the ugly Union Square area and we always felt safe. It's a short walk to the Ferry Building, Chinatown, the Grace Cathedral and even the Union Square area. A bit longer walk to North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf, but there's always the cable cars, muni buses, cabs, etc. if you don't like the walk. We enjoyed NOT having a car in the city and this location worked fine without one. Like other reviewers have noted, the staff was very accomodating and the beds were comfortable. We'll be happy to return to the Omni SF.

review.title: We will stay there again when we return to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very comfortable,and great location.

review.title: First Class All the Way
review.reviewText: Wonderful doesn't even describe this hotel... The staff is great, the place is beautiful, and the location is perfect. It was our first trip to San Fran and this hotel is in the middle of all the hot spots we wanted to see. The mini bar prices are far too high so byob. Although the hotel caters mostly to business, they made us feel right at home even though we were there for leisure.

review.title: Sincere Staff
review.reviewText: Little touches, like the hadwritten note welcoming us from the housekeeping staff, and the courtesy of all staff members made our stay quite enjoyable. Room service was prompt and reasonable, and the one time they made a mistake in our order, it was corrected quite fast. The hotels staff knows the city well, and if you stay for more than a day or two, they will come to know your preferences as well, tailoring their restaurant reccomendations to your tastes.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco is a well kept and excellent hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights and it was a joy. The room was well appointed and the service was great! We enjoyed the benefits by signing up for their guest program. It was convenient to all attractions and public transportation.

review.title: Definately will go back
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located & service is just great.Just like every other travelers mentioned that the overnight parking is just outragious,too pricey.I hope the hotel can provide their own parking for their guest.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco, and the Omin Hotel definitely made it an enjoyable stay. The location was great...walking distance from all of the main attractions. And when you were tired from walking, the trolley and buses are right out front...the staff even arranged car service for our trip to the Wine Country. Great choice!

review.title: Very well located and I would stay there again!
review.reviewText: I would and have told people about what a nice place this was and We will stay there again. I really was not impressed with the Restaurant or the Bar in the Hotel, I thought they were over priced.

review.title: Perfection..
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Rooms quiet and comfy. Concierge services were wonderful. Everyone was so eager to help us with every question. We loved our 6 night stay and would stay here again and again.

review.title: Excellent hotel and staff
review.reviewText: My fiancee and I stayed here for 1 week and were impressed with every aspect of the hotel. The hotel location, quality, food and staff were all superb. Definately recommend staying here.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: Excellent service and hotel was well maintained. Staff was nice and helpful. Turn down service came without having to ask for it. Everything is within walking distance from hotel and the cable car is just out side the hotel.

review.title: Hotel next to the Cable Car
review.reviewText: Good size safe to lock up valuables. Good locations to points of interest (must see sites). Hotel staff (esp. housekeeping) are eager to serve.

review.title: Just remember, it's in the financial district!
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay, but if you are there over a weekend or holiday, as we were, so much in the immediate area is closed. Eating at the hotel is only an option if you want to spend big, big bucks! Expect to do a lot of walking if you are there for sightseeing. Cable car is close, but be sure to get at least a day pass. Staff very friendly and helpful for directions.

review.title: Excellent Choice. Thank You to the staff. We'll be back.
review.reviewText: Great rooms. Friendly helpful staff. Lots of nice little things to make our 10th anniversary stay special. The kind of service you can't seem to find anymore. Thanks again!

review.title: Would recommend to others!
review.reviewText: The hotel met my expectations and beyond. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. The room was perfect. It was clean, comfortable, beautiful and a great place to unwind after a busy day.

review.title: Very impressive and worth the price
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the service I was given.

review.title: Best Hotel Ever!!!
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay, the rooms are confortable, and very clean. The staff there are top notch, and are very helpful. I would go back in a heartbeat!!!

review.title: Omni SF
review.reviewText: Awesome Service and location for business and pleasure!!!! I highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait to return.

review.title: Fairly good hotel but poor value
review.reviewText: I went to the Omni as part of a conference. I am pretty familiar with San Francisco having been there many times before. I felt that the location was excellent, just on the outskirts of Chinatown with close proximity to North Beach, the financial district, and only a couple of blocks from the Bart. The room service menu was varied but overpriced for the quality of food served. There are of course all the perks of an up-scale hotel; night-time sheet turndown, morning paper, breakfast menu, and full-service concierge.

review.title: Excellent hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Service and room were excellent. Located downtown within walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square. Would stay there again.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect location, best service. BEST HOTEL Only thing I didn't like in San Francisco was the Parking, it is expensive

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: My husband and I had a romantic weekend at the Omni. The hotel is beautiful. Very Grande in feeling. Service was outstanding from the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel. Front desk was well staffed and everyone was happy to help use and orient us to the hotel. Our room was wonderful. First class all the way. We got a Superior Suite and found the size to be just right. Lots of little touches made it that much more special. Free fresh fruit bowl in the room. Chocolates at turn down service. Found the closet space to be very good with plenty of hangers. Bathroom was well done. Shower was pleasant and water pressure was great. Bed was SUPER. We are used to only the best in feather beds, and linens and we were not disappointed. Great location. We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Very nice place
review.reviewText: but....bring a wine opener and shop for wine or byob because the hotel has adopted a policy that you are going to pay for services once you are there, check your bill too because they tried to charge for items in the refrigerator that we didn't use, and we there two nights.

review.title: Amazing hotel, awesome location
review.reviewText: This is a fabulous hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. The staff was polite and helpful, it was in a fabulous location, was beautifully decorated, and well-maintained. I may be a little overly enthusiastic because I was very much in love while there, but I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: The service at this hotel was top notch. Everyone was very helpful and provided service in a timely manner. The hotel also provides free internet access and business center with fax and printer service, which most hotels usually charge for. The location is in between Union Square and North Beach/China Town. So if you are looking to stay right in the heart of Union Square, this is probably not your best choice.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with a great restaurant. They offer a private car service to and from the airport (SFO) for a flat $45 fee - much nicer than a taxi for the same price. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant.

review.title: Away with no kids...
review.reviewText: Had a great time weekend with no kids it was the best. Look forward to getting away again and enjoying a room of silence and relaxation.

review.title: Impressive customer service
review.reviewText: The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in. The staff was friendly, knew you by name and kudos to the concierge service. The front-desk manager is friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful with restaurant suggestions. I was impressed and can't wait to return.

review.title: Omni SF impresses
review.reviewText: We got the deluxe room and it was very comfortable. The room was spacious as well as the bathroom. One slight problem we ran into was that there was a bit of a leak in the bathroom on the ceiling, but that only happened the first night. I guess the room above decided to take a bath! But after that, nothing else went wrong. Glady would stay there again.

review.title: Good times at the omni
review.reviewText: Had a great time...

review.title: Fantastic location and beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazingly posh and beautiful. The staff could not have been more helpful. The location was excellent; right outside was a cable car stop. The bar and restaurant were both first rate (have the spinach salad, you won't be sorry!). Overall, this hotel was one of the best I've stayed in. I would highly recommend it.

review.title: I wish i could have stayed longer
review.reviewText: I loved my stay at the hotel. The room was the best I've ever been at. I recerved the california room and i enjoyed every bit of it. I didn't get a view of the bay or anything but i did enjoy the view of the city. Everyone was very curtious and made me feel at home. In the morning I took a walk aroung downtown but I was up way too early to do any shopping. After my stroll around the hotel I had breakfast at the restarant at the hotel. The breakfast was delicious. I ordered scrambled eggs and pancakes. It was all great. Yeah a little too pricy for me but it was worth every penny. I will definatly stay there again. Yes overnight parking is expensive but it' worth it when you don't want to find parking yourself at 10 at night.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Omni is an excellent place to stay. It is conveniently located to all the major attractions. Lovely hotel. Caters to the business crowd so there were not a lot of tourists around, which was nice. Nice fitness room.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and very service minded staff.

review.title: beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: service was great valet parking very expensive

review.title: Omni San Francisco is top-notch
review.reviewText: The staff at the Omni in SF were extremely helpful and polite. The room quality was beyond our expectations and we loved the view of the street. Room service was reliable and went out of their way to service guests. The free internet connection in the room (including cable in the desk drawer so you don't have to remember yours) was greatly appreciated. The Omni was within walking distance for most of the restaurants we went to over our 6-day stay. We found room servie pricey, but this was to be expected. Bed was comfy and we loved turndown service each evening.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location for Chinatown, Union Square and the Embarcadero. Fine restaurants lke Aqua and the Carnelian Room are within walking distance. Everything else is on the Cable car right outside the front door. I would not bother to look any further for a hotel. This one has it all.

review.title: This hotel was perfection.
review.reviewText: I've never been more pleased with a hotel than Omni in San Francisco. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty. They were courteous and professional. The hotel is plush and immaculate. The only not so great thing about the hotel is that their restaurant "Bob's Steakhouse" is pricey. However, I will gladly stay in this hotel again when I return to Cisco.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This is a small, beautifully appointed hotel. The service was wonderful and the staff was friendly and helpful. We found the location perfect for getting around with the cable car right outside the door. There were great restaurants within walking distance and the staff made great suggestions for restaurants in the area.

review.title: can't wait to go back, excellent service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were gracious and extremely helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable hotel. Concierge at registration desk very nice and helpful. Too bad the business center was located only off the main lobby....only 2 computers available there. Drinks and snacks at Bob's were lovely. Room service and valet parking.....very expensive overnight parking,,,,but what are you to do in SF? Close to Chinatown and cable cars. Great place to spend a few days.

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText: The Omni Hotel was wonderful. The lobby is amazing. The bed was fantastic, very comfortable. Hotel staff was very pleasant. We stayed in a Signature room which was absolutely beautiful. Highly recommend.

review.title: Much better than average.
review.reviewText: Larger than usual room, very comfortable bed, very good work space with free internet connection. No surprise fees at check out.

review.title: Nice hotel for a quick getaway
review.reviewText: Got a decent deal for the california suite through expedia. Suite was very nice with a comfortable bed. Bathroom was a little small, just a tub/shower combonation. Room service was hot but on the expensive side. Valet parking is $45.00/day. Overall, a nice hotel.

review.title: A Great Hotel with Great Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great place to stay, it is located in the heart of San Francisco. The staff was very polite and friendly. They paid attention to small details. They even turned down the bed and left a mint chocolate on the night stand next to the bed. Old fashion charm with in renovated hotel. I will be staying at the Omni when in San Francisco from now on. I highly recommend the Omni t anyone visiting San Francisco for leisure or business.

review.title: Happy Customer
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Omni Hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and gratefully helped us out anytime we needed their services. The hotel was beautiful/ luxurious... service was great... location was central... our room was comfortable... I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience San Fran at its finest.

review.title: Going Back
review.reviewText: This hotel is extremely classy. The staff is friendly and very, very helpful. We loved it so much we plan on going back in the summer. Great location, close to Union Square without all the noise of the hotels that are right on the Square. I would recommend to anyone who is looking for an up scale hotel without the up scale price.

review.title: Awesome Hotel will be back.
review.reviewText: This is the best city hotel I have ever stayed in. Perfect location close to everything. Staff went above and beyond to make the stay perfect.

review.title: undiscovered gem
review.reviewText: Staff go out of their way to help. Super clean, guiet hotel on the cable line. Dont tell everyone else.

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, great location for shopping and access to cable cars. Note: If you have a rental car, it costs $45+ a day to park at the hotel.

review.title: It's a great hotel full of old-world charm
review.reviewText: The hotel is very luxurious. The service is great as well.

review.title: Very well appointed.
review.reviewText: The only complaint I have with this hotel is its location. It's in a very good neighborhood (the Financial District), but that is also the downside if you are visiting on a weekend. Most of the coffee shops/businesses are closed during the weekend, and it's a bit of a trek to Market Street. The hotel itself is very comfortable and I highly recommend it for business travel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We did not try the restaurant, but it looked very inviting.

review.title: Best. Hotel. Ever.
review.reviewText: A perfect spot to celebrate our 10th anniversary. Fantastic location, great service, comfortable room. A++!

review.title: Great stay at a great location
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco Hotel was a joy. A classy, older hotel, it's conveniently located in the heart of town, with all the sights of San Francisco easy to get to. The hotel staff was very friendly and quite helpful and the restaurant/bar was great. Only downside was the $45/day parking fee. Otherwise, I would recommend the Omni to all.

review.title: Birthday by the bay.
review.reviewText: My wife booked this hotel via Expedia.com for my birthday which is near the end of December. We live in the Phoenix area and (believe it or not) get a little board of perfect weather and sunshine. I got exactly what I wanted! The hotel is exquisite! A grand lobby with all the elegance of the best hotels in Europe, a well polished staff a perfect (I do not use that word often) location and great rooms. We happened to arrive just as a wet storm was hitting the Bay area, which for most would have been a downer, but for me was a plus. Even though the cable cars are nearby I loved walking the town it is really an easy and exhilarating walk to just about anywhere in the city. One exceptionally stormy night we took advantage of the town car service offered by the hotel and was impressed with their accommodating attitude, and even less expensive than a local taxi. The concierge recommended some fabulous restaurants and we lucked upon some great ones as well. Come to think of it is hard not to find a great restaurant in North beach, China-Town, and the Pier area. We even had a stellar view of the Bay and the Trans America Tower from the 17th floor room.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The rooms were roomy and exceptionally clean. Everything was there, that we needed. Fitness Center was perfect for our athletic college aged children.

review.title: Great Hotel in a great city
review.reviewText: Clean dignified hotel with a great location. Cable cars just outside the front door. Chinatown just blocks away. Good service. Enjoyed a great trip without worry.

review.title: A real find ...
review.reviewText: Great location, great ambiance, great service !

review.title: Omni is superb
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is courteous and very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay here anytime I am in San Francisco

review.title: Made a Great Choice for First Time
review.reviewText: We couldn't have been more happy with our choice for our first visit to SF. The hotel is very clean. The room was extremely clean and very nice. The views aren't very scenic, but I can't imagine many hotels being that way. The views are good in terms of being able to see the surrounding hustle and bustle.
