They were interesting since we hadn't been to SF. The outside staff (bellhops, doormen, etc) are great. The service desk could be more expedient at times, but no worries since you usually rarely need to deal with them. The rooms are wonderful, the bathrooms come stock with all sorts of knicknacks and products (above and beyond shampoo and conditioner). The location is great for walking about anywhere you would probably want to go (Chinatown, North Beach, Wharf, Financial, etc) and you can get a cab within seconds of stepping out of the hotel if you desire.

review.title: Wow!
review.reviewText: This hotel was such a treat after a hectic week. From the softly scented lobby to the beautiful oversized tub awaiting me in the room, their theme of "sensible luxury" was everwhere. Housekeeping had classical music softly playing for me when I arrived in my room....nice touches like this made the trip very memorable. I felt like I was away for longer than my 5 day stay which, to me is a sign that they did their job well. I'll be back next December!

review.title: San Francisco Delight
review.reviewText: Great accomodations convenient to Chinatown, Union Square, and North Beach. Quiet beside the cablecars. The greatest beds.

review.title: Oh my Omni
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel due to the special price I received through Expedia and it turned out to be a great deal! Don't know how old the hotel is, but it has all of the modern conveniences of a brand new hotel. The level of service was on par for a luxury hotel, and I have no complaints. The hotel isn't without some sacrifices, however. There isn't an on-site pool/fitness area, and dinning options are limited to one restaurant and one bar. The hotel itself is in the financial district which means that it is near all the places you'd like to be, but you still have to travel to get there. There are not great restaurants or shops right outside the hotel door. So, if that matters to you, you might want a hotel closer to say Union Square. But overall, if you can get a good price, this hotel is hard to beat in terms of luxury and comfort!

review.title: Had a wonderful time
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel everyone there made our visit nice. Great location in the finacial district. So on the weekend it was very quiet. Had a grat dinner at Cafe Basstille on Kearny and Bush down an ally highly recomend it.

review.title: everything was great except the view
review.reviewText: When I walked into the hotel to check in at 1:30am in the morning they adressed me with my name which was a pleasent suprise. Hotel was just like the pictures promise. Small intimate setting, big room, high ceilings, black marble counters in the bathroom. everything you would expect from a 4 star including turn down service (they make your bed twice a day ;). only backdraw was the view out the window which faced DIRECTLY into some office windows and the only way to keep privacy was to keep the curtains closed during business hours. I definetely would go back however I would request a room facing the street.

review.title: Excellent Service by All Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: Very clean, newly remodeled. Great location. But what really made our stay memorable was the gracious service of the hotel staff. They really made an effort to make our experience pleasant and our siteseeing arrangements and concierge requests were flawlessly handled. Room service was superior as well. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Very nice hotel, friendly, helpful staff.
review.reviewText: I liked the location of the hotel, within walking distance of shopping area's, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, etc. The majority of shopping in the financial district is upscale, like Gucci, Versace and similar stores. Many excellent restaurants in the area.

review.title: Omni - Great service and close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is not classified as Union Square, but it is only several blocks away. Service is great, but they don't know your name as I have read in several reviews, but who cares! Hotel is very clean, big rooms ( for SF ) and good service.

review.title: great hotel, very central to sights
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little pricey, but you wont regret it. Easy walk to china town, north beach, and union square. Check out farmers market on saturdays at ferry building.

review.title: Awsome Hotel!
review.reviewText: This Hotel had the friendliest Staff I have ever encountered. The Hotel was in excellent condition. I felt very pampered! Highly recommend!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the location of the Omni. It was next to China Town and on a lot of good bus lines to get you all around town. We did a lot of walking and this hotel was at the bottom of the hill which was nice on the walk home. The hotel staff was friendly and recomended a great Chinese restaraunt the first night.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: excellent location, comfortable room, no views and decks but didn't spend much time in room. service was outstanding.

review.title: Couldn't have been better
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything you could want. It was extremely clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We definitely will plan another stay.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: good location

review.title: Would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel right across the street from BofA in SFO. Very quiet room with a comfortable bed, turndown service, the works. The front desk was more than helpful with directions and finding stores/restaurants.

review.title: Centrally located with beautiful accomodations.
review.reviewText: The staff was exremely helpful in arranging sightseeing and knowledge of the city. The restaurant was less than stellar. We were seated with two other couples already seated. Given coffee and water and ignored as three other tables were seated and their orders taken.We left the restaurant after 15 mins without having our order taken.I was looking forward to having dinner their but after the disappointing breakfast treatment we declined.

review.title: may not get the room type you want
review.reviewText: We spent a weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Omni. The hotel was excellent in all respects, and I would recommend it to anyone. Beware, however, that if you book the hotel through Expedia, the hotel will not guarantee the type of room you want but will give what is available. We wanted a king size, non-smoking room, and the only room they had available for us in non-smoking had two double beds.

review.title: classic
review.reviewText: i like the decor. they dont speak english very well tho.

review.title: The Service is fantastic
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Omni for our 25th wedding anniversary. The staff from the front desk to the maids were very very accommodating. The location of the Omni is perfect, just a short walk to Chinatown, the trolly line passes right in front of the hotel, and North Beach is just a stroll away. Did I mention how great the service is? Our room was perfect we will stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel that Emphasizes Customer Service
review.reviewText: This hotel gets in "A+" in customer service. There is always a friendly face greeting you as you enter or leave the hotel. The people at the front desk were very helpful with directions to local attractions.

review.title: Highly impressed
review.reviewText: Great location, great room decore and excellent service. I was very pleased!!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Absolutely wonderful hotel. Stayed 5 nights and never had a complaint. The hotel staff is the most courteous and helpful anywhere. They give great advice and know the city very well. Cable cars run directly in front of the hotel and give you access to everything from the Ferry bldg. to Market street, to Union square and to Fisherman's Wharf. City tours pick you up in front of the hotel and the staff even make sure you don't miss your tour.

review.title: Definitely on list of hotels to revisit
review.reviewText: very nice property you certainly get what you pay for, the fitness center was excellent! modern, everything spotless & all equipment in working order, nice extras towels,water,fruit etc. for those interested the old St.Mary's cathedral is walking distance, ferry marketplace, shopping in chinatown and union square..you won't be disappointed!!

review.title: Excellent in all ways
review.reviewText: This hotel is above standard especially in repsect of cleanliness and service. Staff are very friendly & helpful. Location is good, very convenient for all sightseeing and the cable cars stop outside.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel were extremely courteous and welcoming. Any concern and question was answered quickly and efficiently. Great weekend.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Very convenient for sightseeing and shopping. Great housekeeping staff. Only issue was that there is no concierge. One of the check-in staff was not able to answer question on bus tours but one was.

review.title: Enjoyed it very much!
review.reviewText: The cable car stops in front of the hotel, the staff is kind and very helpful, the rooms were clean and well maintained!

review.title: Very Impressive!!! Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel with great employees. Very, Very clean. I would recommend to anyone. 5 star hotel. We loved the stay!

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: By far the best hotel and service we have ever recieved from any place we have stayed at including the so called 5 and 6 star hotels and resorts. This hotel in located walking distance from everyting you might want to see downtown and near the water. The staff at this place was great and went way above and beyond what I had recieved from other hotels/reorts in the past. The hotel was maintained to perfection. This will be the only place I stay at when visiting San Francisco

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: we loved the hotel and the little extras, the turn-down service and the friendly notes froms housekeeping.

review.title: Great location & lovely place to stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with large comfy rooms. Best gym I have ever seen for a Hotel gym with plenty of state of the art equipment and complimentary water & apples. Staff were generally very helpful & friendly however some were far more helpful than others. Great location next door to China Town & a few blocks from Union Square, we walked to almost everything.

review.title: Best in San Fran...
review.reviewText: I have stayed in, literally, dozens of hotels, and this is by far the best. From the knowledgable and friendly doorpersons, to the accomodating front desk personnel, to the room attendants, this HOTEL is the best. I live in the hotel capital of the world, Las Vegas, and nothing here compares to the Omni. They rank an "11" on a scale of 1-10. No need to rent a car either, it's centrally located to everything. For the experience, I recommend using public transportation. "I'll be back".

review.title: Watch out for the parking fees!!
review.reviewText: If you drive be prepared to get raked over the coals on the parking fees. The parking fees the hotel charges cost more than the cost to rent the car. Keeping in mind that parking is at a premium in the downtown area it seems they could work out a better deal with the parking facility. To add insult to injury sometimes it would take more than 20 minutes for the valet to bring your car around.

review.title: Wonderful attention to detail
review.reviewText: The Omni San Francisco is a lovely hotel, and we will stay there again. The staff is very friendly and professional. Very comfortable, clean, and bright. I was impressed with the attention to detail. Twice daily maid service, including turndown service with milk and homemade cookies! We ordered room service twice and it was delivered promptly. The food was delicious and very reasonably priced!

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Nice looking building with good service. Room was quite clean every day. Some annoyances: If your booking online, room type is not guaranteed (may end up with two doubles instead of a king). Mini-refrigerator packed full of overpriced items so it's hard to get your own items in.

review.title: Really great hotel and city.
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, well situated in a really beautiful city. The staff was friendly and very help.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel with excellent service and charm!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, staff was awesome.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: It was an excellent experience and truly a first class hotel. From the front desk to the doorpersons. Location was good as well, within walking distance to most everything.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Excellent all around.

review.title: Excellent Hotel...very impressed
review.reviewText: Been to San Francisco three times and this is the best hotel I've stayed at. The location is great, in the middle of everything, short walk to Chinatown and Union Square, and North Beach. Lots of resturants at North Beach. Excellent services and all the staff was very helpful. The BART was 4 blocks away so we took it from/to the airport...only $5, can't beat it!!

review.title: Completely exceeded my expectations. Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, the location could not be better, and the staff went above and beyond in helping us with anything we needed. I will definitely make this a regular destination

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: Hats off to the staff at this hotel. They were professional and courteous and very accomodating. We enjoyed our stay and will be back.

review.title: Truly outstanding service, great for business and for kids
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic vacation and the service at the Omni was brilliant. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly to children unlike other similarly rated hotels. Excellent location and easy access to Union Square, cable cars and attractions. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and every need anticipated. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was amazing. Staff was more than friendly and helpful. Room was beautiful and spacious. Overall a relaxing and lovely experience.

review.title: Great Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Omni is a very beautiful hotel. Good location and the restaurant though pricey was very good.

review.title: Fabulous!
review.reviewText: Just perfect.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel! The hotel was very well decorated, very clean, and staff is friendly and attentive to my needs. The quality of the food - especially room service - was top notch! I ordered room service five times and was impressed each time with the presentation, quality, and taste of the food. The only thing I though was a little off key, were the prices of the items in the room's snack bar. Although similar to other hotels, I think the pricing is rediculously high. An example is a 10oz diet Coke - $4.50. I went out and bought a 12 pack for $3.99. Not sure where they're going with this, but I can assure you the products do not more that fast, which questions how fresh they are. To conclude, I would absolutely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

review.title: Everything is first class
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel.  Service and staff exceptional.  It is located a short walking distance from Chinatown and North Beach.  Fisherman's Wharf is a distance away (about a mile),  and after walking around the Wharf all day and becoming tired, it is a long UPHILL walk to get back to the hotel!  You can, however, take a cab for about $8 to get back to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing.  The restaurant at the hotel is good, but extremely expensive.  Excellent Italian food in North Beach just a short walk away.  The area this hotel is in gets pretty deserted at night and didn't feel too safe for walking around with the exception of Chinatown and North Beach.  The hotel staff goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is exceptional.  Fresh towels each night at turndown service.  This is the only hotel I would stay in when visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Everything was great!
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel, it was so gorgeous. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. A little bit of a walk to fisherman's wharf, but not too bad and we learned to enjoy it even in the rain. Close to everything! Would definately return and recommend to friends.

review.title: Like the facility so much
review.reviewText: This is one of the hotels that you should consider if you're planning a trip to San Francisco. The location is strategic enough (it is located near the union square and chinatown).To go to Union Square, you have to walk like 4/5 blocks. The facility that i like so much is the fitness center. It's big enough and they provide fruit,water,towel to ensure your fitness is going well. The service is really good, the receptionist is very friendly and helpful, the cleanliness in the room is amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel to everybody.

review.title: Classic hotel comfort in a recently renovated office building.
review.reviewText: The Omni conveyed the character, qualities, and comfort of an "old line" San Francisco hotel.  Yet, you would never know that it had been used as an office building in its fomer life.  I was quite pleased by the ambience and quality of service.

review.title: Great hotel for business travelers
review.reviewText: We spent a weekend at the Omni. The hotel lobby is handsome with dark wood paneling and our room was spacious, quiet, and comfortable. Hotel service was very good and the staff was helpful and polite. One quibble, we were five blocks from the Embarcadero area, where most restaurants are located. We either walked and took a $4 cab ride to get to restaurants or the Embarcadero BART station.
